The plot had me both laughing and crying with this captivating tale.  I found the dialog entertaining with a delightful cast of characters. This story is part of a Serendipity, Indiana Book series but reads well as a standalone. Disclosure: I read this in the box set: Sweet Christmas Kisses 2: Nineteen Heartwarming Holiday Romances

This is a beautiful and emotional Christmas love story. Caleb Montgomery comes to the rescue of Janie Worthy life a knight in shining armor.  Janie is more a damsel in distress than she realizes, but he sees the ivory tower she has locked herself in. She realizes she has been letting life pass her by and it's time to let go, be happy and be loved. What an inspirational message with great characters and heartwarming dialog. God always does have a master plan in place, it's not an accident. This story is part of Shellwater Keys Tales series but reads well as a standalone. Disclosure: I read this as part of the Sweet Christmas Kisses 2: Nineteen Heartwarming Holiday Romances box set.

I am so excited about this box set of Mail Order Brides and Christmas.  I had read two of the stories for two authors, which I am leaving a review for now. I actually won the box set in a giveaway and was so excited. I can't wait to read the other 4 stories and will add to my review later.  I love mail order bride books and these stories offer inspiration.1. Jacob's Christmas Dream (Christian Historical Romantic Novella) (Christmas Mail Order Angels) by Darlene FranklinWAITING UPON THE LORDWhat a sweet and inspirational story of faith, trust and listening for God's answer and obey His calling. This is the beginning of a wonderful series, Christmas Mail Order Angels.  The Christian men of Angel Vale, WY decided they need to find them Christian mail order brides and send off to Merville, Maine to the Ladies Aid Society. Becky Patterson, daughter of Seaside Community Church's Pastor, sees this as an answer to prayers and enlist the single and widowed ladies to join in and answer letters. The arrangements are made and the ladies travel by train and then wagon to Wyoming to meet and marry their prospective grooms, some immediately and others after a short courtship. Jake Underwood, merchant and fill in pastor for Angel Vale is excited for his future bride.  Sometimes, what God is calling us to do, is the one thing we are struggling with and don't want in our life. Acceptance of God's will in our life gives peace and happiness.2. Christmas Gold (Christmas Mail Order Angels) by Cynthia HickeyAN ANGEL SENT BY GODAnother sweet and inspirational story of faith, trust, and an answer to prayers. These Christmas Mail Order Angels books are a series, but I believe will read in any order. Phoebe Ross was alone, losing her beloved employer and faced with a choice to leave or marry the son she detests. She joins the mail order brides going to Angel Vale, WY with an agreement to marry Alex Vaughn, jeweler and gold miner. Sometimes the interaction between these two is a comedy of errors and you just want to knock both of them up beside their heads. This is a charming story with delightful characters, humorous antics, witty dialog and heartwarming moments. Alex and Phoebe are a sweet couple, especially when they learn to be honest and open with each other.

Four stories, all revolving around one no-kill animal shelter. With lots of wonderful animals seeking their forever home and to offer their new people unconditional love.  Each story has many of the same people and adding new people and challenges. I like that most of the adults are mature people and that with the abundance of animals comes sweet love stories with second chance romance.Unleashed Love (Sheltered Love Book 1) by Jackie MarillaWE COME AS A SET, ME AND ALL THESE MARVELOUS ANIMALSI really enjoyed this sweet romance of second chances and all the wonderful animals involved at the shelter.  Loman Cejka is a painter and has volunteered his time painting the no-kill shelter for free. He is divorced with two grown children who live out of state. Glenda Weber, a former RN, is a widow, having watched her surgeon husband have a seizure that took his life.  She has two grown children out of state and to combat loneliness she is a volunteer at the no-kill shelter. This story impacts the lives of several people who meet by chance but have a mutual attraction and a love for animals. The plot kept me captivated with a great cast of characters, witty and honest dialog and lots of entertaining animals.  Lots of emotions, some angst and a bit of interference help keep the pages turning on this delightful story.Love's Always Paws-able (Sheltered Love Book 2) by Joanne JaytaineEXPERIENCE THE TRUE MEANING OF UNCONDITIONAL LOVEWhat a fun and exciting story, steeped in devotional, mystery, deceit, kidnapping, crime and the love of dogs.  Faith Daniels has so much love to give animals and has created a unique foster home with plenty of room with state of the art housing.  She screens all potential adoptive parents to make sure that for animal and human it will be a perfect match. Tanner Keen is working pro bono at the shelter to help see what can be done to bring in more donations. He is recovering from a near-death experience and on sabbatical from his advertising firm. Something is amiss with the animals coming in, and mysterious “deaths” of some of the older, but healthy dogs. Can Faith uncover the problems, and will she do it alone? This story is suspenseful and will keep you captivated and the pages turning. A great cast of characters, both human, and animal, with a mystery, to be solved.Love Again (Sheltered Love Book 3) by Angela FordNEW BEGINNINGS AT A NO-KILL SHELTERThis is a story that will have you on an emotional roller coaster and will keep the pages turning.  It has a cast of characters with some you will love and others you will despise.  So many feelings from shock, anger, bitterness, self-doubt, confusion, depression and eventually to acceptance and deciding to make a difference.  Dealing with divorce and adultery, a complete change of friends, and trying to find purpose in your life again. Nothing says healing better than an adopted four-legged friend. When two damaged individuals meet while volunteering at a no-kill shelter, not only will two special dogs find forever homes, two broken people will find true love and happiness.Champagne and Catnip (Sheltered Love Book 4)by Amanda WardSTEPPING OUTSIDE OF YOUR COMFORT ZONEThis is an emotional story and nice ending to the Sheltered Love series. Dr. Dan Livingstone is divorced with two adult sons.  He works as a vet and also helps at the no-kill shelter. Caryn Fielding is widowed, no children and volunteers at the shelter.  She lost her hearing and had to retire from her job as a midwife. Can she allow herself to step out of the box and try dating again? Her biggest fear is being left alone after sharing her life with someone again. Dan isn’t into casual dating and flings. He has had his eyes on Caryn for a while, but will she agree to date him? The plot is heartwarming with open and honest dialog.

This is an emotional story and nice ending to the Sheltered Love series. Dr. Dan Livingstone is divorced with two adult sons.  He works as a vet and also helps at the no kill shelter. Caryn Fielding is widowed, no children and volunteers at the shelter.  She lost her hearing and had to retire from her job as a midwife. Can she allow herself to step out of the box and try dating again? Her biggest fear is being left alone after sharing her life with someone again. Dan isn’t into casual dating and flings. He has had his eyes on Caryn for a while, but will she agree to date him? The plot is heartwarming with open and honest dialog. Disclosure; I received and e-copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

What a fun and exciting story, steeped in devotional, mystery, deceit, kidnapping, crime and the love of dogs.  Faith Daniels has so much love to give animals and has created a unique foster home with plenty of room with state of the art housing.  She screens all potential adoptive parents to make sure that for animal and human it will be a perfect match. Tanner Keen is working pro bono at the shelter to help see what can be done to bring in more donations. He is recovering from a near-death experience and on sabbatical from his advertising firm. Something is amiss with the animals coming in, and mysterious “deaths” of some of the older, but healthy dogs. Can Faith uncover the problems, and will she do it alone? This story is suspenseful and will keep you captivated and the pages turning. A great cast of characters, both human, and animal, with a mystery, to be solved. Disclosure: I received a Kindle copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

I really enjoyed this sweet romance of second chances and all the wonderful animals involved at the shelter.  Loman Cejka  is a painter and has volunteered his time painting the no-kill shelter for free. He is divorced with two grown children who live out of state. Glenda Weber, a former RN, is a widow, having watched her surgeon husband have a seizure that took his life.  She has two grown children out of state and to combat loneliness she is a volunteer at the no-kill shelter. This story impacts the lives of several people who meet by chance but have a mutual attraction and a love for animals. The plot kept me captivated with a great cast of characters, witty and honest dialog and lots of entertaining animals.  Lots of emotions, some angst and a bit of interference help keep the pages turning on this delightful story.

I found this story to be very moving, emotional and inspiring.  The descriptions, emotions and people will take the reader back to a time when life was difficult, but people were proud and did what they needed to survive.  Not everything is pretty and wrapped up with bows.  It is an intriguing story of struggles, survival, and heartache told in a way that the reader is drawn into the story and the pages keep turning. The description of the book fits this story very well. The story kept me captivated with the cast of characters and dialog that is raw, open, and honest.  Disclosure: I was gifted a paperback copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

This story continues from Closure and Forbidden. Once again I was captivated and on the edge of my seat as the mystery and suspense continued to unfold. The plot twist kept me in constant suspense and the pages turning. I love this fast-paced action pack thriller story.  Beware; you will be drawn into this story and its emotional roller coaster ride! Just when you think you are safe, a new danger is lurking in the shadows. Meeting new people, revisiting ones from the first two books, some happiness, some heartache, and shock. Finding out that someone you trust is evil and where will it lead. Trying to move on in their lives, but trouble just won't leave them alone. This is an excellent FBI thriller series with a wonderful cast of characters, entertaining dialog and heart-stopping scenes.  Disclosure: I received and e-copy of this book as a proofreader and for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

This is a fun and at times comical story.  Dillion Westover is a widower with two children, Michael and Christy, and an author.  He is engaged to Amanda Dickenson who takes care of his children while he writes.  Amanda is spoiled, selfish and lazy, and a whiner.  Dusty Dickenson, a nurse, gets a letter pleading for help from her twin sister Amanda begging her to come to Arizona, which she does. She tells her all about the ghost town there, knowing that Dusty would love it, and she needs to see her sister and find out what the problem is.  But Amanda being who she is, abandons her and the children, leaving her to deal with Dillion and his anger. The plot kept me captivated as Dusty tries to play along that she is Amanda and trying to uncover what is going on in her relationship. The dialog is entertaining, the children’s affection to Dusty heartwarming and enduring.  When will Dillion realize there has been a switch? How long will he pretend not to be wiser to the twins? Where did Amanda go and what will Dusty do? Sometimes, what seems like a trick is being played on someone, they may have a nice treat in the end.  There are several spankings but no sex in this story.

I enjoyed this Christmas story of the Colburn family mainly seen through the eyes of Dr. Lydia Colburn Bradshaw.  This book is a spin-off from the Uncharted series and can be read well as a standalone. The plot kept me captivated and is full of emotions, many trying to capture and recreate past family memories.  The dialog is open, honest and heartwarming.  I especially enjoyed the journal from Lydia’s late mother that told more on the family.  Lydia is heartbroken that the family traditions are changing and her siblings are starting their own traditions and she feels they are going to ruin Christmas. It hit home as I thought of my own childhood memories, then marrying and moving away and starting new ones for my family, and now dealing with adult children and grandchildren.  This is definitely a heartwarming and emotional story.  I think reading all the Uncharted books would be very enjoyable. Disclosure: I received an e-copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

Disclosure: I won a paperback copy of this beautifully illustrated 1, 2, 3 Count With Me book at a Goodreads giveaway.  The illustrations are colorful and appealing.  The story counts forward from 1 to 10 and then again backwards from 10 to 1. The rhyming is fun and even a matching song at the end of the book.When trying to teach children counting, I think that it would have been so much better had the animals not been repeated in groups of 2 or 3 for numbers.  Example: 1 Sheep and on the page across from it 2 sheep, it would be easy for a child to start counting and come up with 3 sheep because they are basically all together on the two adjoining pages, then 4 Lizard and 5 lizards, so in total on the 2 pages you see 9 lizards, and on countdown, 2 kangaroos and 1 kangaroo appear as 3 kangaroos.  Children easily see the 2 pages combined as one large canvas.

These Sweet Biblical Amish Romance stories are such a joy to read with the similarities to characters in the Bible with the same names.  The plot will keep the reader captivated and the pages turning as a heartwarming story is spun off from Biblical figures we learned about and loved. The dialog is clean, inspiring and heartwarming.An Amish Romance: RUTH: Sweet Biblical Amish Romance (Amish Bible Heroes Book 1)AN INSPIRATIONAL AMISH TWIST TO THE STORY OF RUTHWhat an inspirational story of love, family loyalty, seeking God's will and finding a new beginning. Ruth Miller loses her husband, John, in a freak accident.  When her mother-in-law, Naomi, decides to leave Ohio and return to her Old World Order Amish, Ruth insists she will go with her.  God is so good, He always provides and His bounty is overflowing. The plot kept me captivated and refreshing as the story from the Bible of Ruth, Naomi and Boaz unfolds.  Heartwarming dialog and inspiring scenes.An Amish Romance: REBEKAH: Sweet Biblical Amish Romance (Amish Bible Heroes Book 3)WHEN GOD SPEAKS THERE IS NO REASON NOT TO OBEY HIS LEADINGI enjoyed this inspirational story and book 3 of the Amish Bible Heroes series.  After the death of his wife Sarah, Abraham Stoltzfus realizes his son Isaac needs a wife but the Amish community is so small and there are no suitable women available. Abe, sending his friend Mark to Lancaster, PA on a mission to locate a wife for Isaac, prays for God's will and guidance. The story is fascinating as it follows from the Biblical account of Isaac and Rebecca. Mark finds Rebekah Miller and God opens the door. With God, all things are possible and He can use His messengers.  The faith of Rebekah that she believes God is leading her from Pennsylvania to Ontario, Canada. But there is also a nice little surprise in this story.  Disclosure: I received an e-copy of this book in exchange for an honest review. All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

This is an extremely emotional story of a woman who wants to be loved and accepted and goes about it in a destructive way before she meets Cal  Chesterfield.  Her parents have really done a number on her with their rejection and the only love she really has known was from Granny.  Astraea is definitely a rebel, Goth look, lackadaisical attitude, no self-respect, but it is all a barrier to try and not be hurt again. Cal was hoping for a change in his own life, but wow, Astraea comes as a shocking change, sometimes opposite attract. The plot kept me captivated, the dialog is raw and honest, full of emotional and heartache. Can Cal and Astraea work past her painful past, learn self-respect and find that happy medium?

I absolutely loved this time travel romance, with its charming cast of characters, witty and entertaining dialog and sweet romance.  I was laughing out loud so many times while reading this story of the various antics described, especially at the Kringle’s Ball. Ms Hartman has a wonderful way of spinning a tale, adding cats, birds and various animals, entertaining us with delightful characters and a clean sweet romance.  The plot kept me captivated and the pages turning.  I love a story with an HEA ending. Disclosure: I received an e-copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  All thoughts, opinions, and ratings are my own.

Don't know what I did without this more durable style of nail file for the first 35 yrs of my life.  A little more expensive than a disposable, but the quality is so worth it.  It works great for filing natural nails, and seems incredibly durable - still like new after several months of use.

Very nice sun shirt.  Does the job and seems comfortable for my child.  At my son's age (29mo) the kangaroo pocket design works fine for us.  Not too different pulling it over his head vs. any other pullover style shirt.It definitely runs small though.  I have a very small 2-year-old and the 3T/4T pretty much fits him, just with a little room to grow (esp sleeve length).  Definitely size up.

It works well as a conditioner.  Actually better than most mainstream conditioners at keeping my frizzy hair tamed.I do not personally care for the scent.  I think it's the rosemary, which I've just never been a fan of.  It smells like glue to me.  I also tried the Luscious Island conditioner from Sprout, and I liked that much better.  Will probably continue using that one for myself, although it's also very expensive.If I needed a conditioner to use on my baby though, I'd probably keep using this one, since it's supposed to be gentler.

Very nice, quality product.  Thick cardboard, well made.  Child can match pairs based on letter/number or color (the two halves have different backgrounds for the most part, but there's a tiny bit of spillover of color from the animal object/half to the letter half).  I liked that both the full alphabet (A-Z) and basic numbers (1-10) are covered.  My 29-month old finds them entertaining already, and it's pretty early days for him in terms of letter matching.  He has very good good letter recognition already, but doesn't yet understand how to identify the animal with the matching letter.  The puzzle and color matching aspects though keep him engaged enough to keep going, which will help us to keep working on the letter matching.The only downside (a minor one, really) for me: the box is unnecessarily large, in my opinion -- the cards, when paired up, only fill it up about a third of the box, so this uses up more storage space in my home than I'd like.  But I guess the large box was designed with enough room to allow toddlers to put all of the pieces away themselves without getting frustrated.

Very nice product - hours of entertainment for our 2-year-old - just perfect for restaurants, doctor's offices, etc.  Great concept and works great for the most part.  My kid loves it.Three ways that M&D could improve this product:1) The opaque white film is not as opaque on this product as it is on the Water WOW spiral books.  So there isn't quite the same mystery - my kid can identify each animal/object before he even puts pen to paper.  But, he still seems plenty motivated, so I guess it still works.2) The opaque white film is also not that durable.  It scratches off easily, when my kid holds the pen at an angle a ridge on it leaves scratch marks.3) The plastic ring is a great add, but there needs to be a better way to store the pen.  The plastic blisterpack in which the pen comes packaged has a hole in it so you can add it onto the ring, but it is awkward and bulky.  Also there's no top for the pen, which means you can't leave any water in the pen whatsoever before storing it, or it will leak out and permanently damage the cards.I do recommend this product though, as well as the Water WOW books, for younger toddlers, say ages 2-3.  I'm guessing older kids with greater physical dexterity would have more fun actually using their imaginations more and coloring on their own.

I was super excited when I saw this bib as we are huge fans of the Modern Twist placemats (have used ours for every meal for our child for the past two years).  We have been long-time users of the Baby Bjorn plastic bibs with the lip, and I thought this might be a nice, more flexible alternative that would be more comfortable for our child.  Well, I'm sure it is more comfortable, because the material is totally flexible, but the downside is that the lip does not stay open and as a result does not catch ANY food.  This bib is fine for just protecting your baby's chest, but it certainly does not catch anything.  It's back to the Baby Bjorn bibs for us.

This loose green sencha tea is excellent.  I am a green tea snob - usually only like gyokuro.  I enjoy this almost as much (has the same grassy taste), and it is much cheaper.  The price is quite reasonable actually via Subscribe & Save.One note: the brewing instructions on the package are definitely overkill.  They suggest 1 tbsp tea per 8 oz water, and to brew for 2-3min.  That is definitely way too much tea, and for too long.  I brew 1 tsp of tea per 10-12oz of water for 2min, and the result is just perfect.  Unfortunately I find the second steep too is too bland for me, so I only get one steep out of each tsp, but it may work better for others.

These are OK - they do the job.  They run a little small.  I have a small 26mo old and the toddler size (2-4 years) clasp his head too tightly.  In theory I thought the reversibility would be nice so I wouldn't have to worry about my son putting them on upside down.  In reality this has turned out not to be that important, as he had no problem grasping the concept of something being upside down, and the downside of them being reversible is that they are not cute either way.  They make my son look buggy eyed.We much prefer the Babiators, which I purchased after receiving these and not being thrilled with them.  My son strongly prefers them (they don't squeeze his head as tightly, I presume), and they look way cuter on him!The Julbos might work well for you if your kid has a narrow head and the looping mechanism is an important feature for you.  Otherwise, check out Babiators as an alternative.

PROS:- Good variety of shapes (range of shapes, animals, vehicles)- Eash to wash (with fingerpainting paints, just wash out easily with cold water, w/o any soap)CONS:- Much larger than expected (up to 4-5" in length).  Use up a lot of paint (even when painting it on as one reviewer suggested), and difficult for my 26mo old to manipulate (cannot press down the whole shape at once, leading to uneven prints).  Also produce figures that are just too large for normal (8.5x11") or fingerpaint size (12x16") paper.  Maybe a good choice for very large format paper.- Do not work great with fingerpainting paint, at least not the Crayola brand washable fingerpaints.  The impressions they leave behind are bubbly and diffuse.  Not sure if it would be any different with non-fingerprinting paints and/or non-washable paints.In retrospect I had not purchased these.  Would appreciate tips if anyone finds any good smaller sponges, and/or ones that work better with fingerpaints.

Nice sheet of Pooh stickers (love the art), but it's only one sheet (of 31 pcs) rather than three as advertised. :(  Not great value for the listed price.Something else to note (though not necessarily bad), these are also constructed a little differently from the typical sticker - the backing and edges around the stickers are clear (rather than white).My kid is obsessed with Pooh though, and this is some of my favorite art from the Pooh stickers I've seen on Amazon, so I'll probably keep them.

Wow! Snorkels have changed. The double lens mask comes in a convenient carrying case. It fits securely on the face. Has sturdy adjustable straps. The flexible tube has a filter on the top that prevents water from getting in.The mouthpiece was not to large and fit comfortably. I received this product for an honest review
Easy to use wine saver. Plug the spout, then pump the air out. Keeps wine fresher. I received this product for an honest review.
Soft well made boys briefs. Thick cotton, reinforced seams for durable performance. I received this product for an honest review.

Handy mop holder that grips those pesky handles and keep them out of the way. Flexible grip can hold a variety of sizes, and when you grab one- the rest don't fall in an avalanche. Screws into the wall for easy access. I received this holder for an honest review.

Battery operated facial brush that briskly rejuvenates the complexion. Seven different brushes for maximum effect.  Good way to massage the face and get skin stimulated to stay young and healthy. I received this product for an honest review.
Handy switch blade style meat thermometer that pierces a small hole in the meat rather than slicing into it. Clear LED readings. I received this product for an honest review.

Something smells at the Chili Queens's house of ill repute, and it's not in the kitchen. The Chili Queen is a tale about a tough as nails madam with a tender heart who takes in an abandoned bride, who repays her by turning her well-ordered life upside down. At times hilarious, at times tender, even sad,  the Chili Queen is a colorful adventure of the old west filled with ladies of the night, bank robbers, and con artists. Sandra Dallas's wonderful prose recreates the honky-tonk atmosphere of frontier towns. Her West is dry and dirty, a hopeless place where one can only expect a hard-scrabble existence. Everybody has a past that has brought them to their present, and some of the stories are hallowing. Rape, incest, murder, bigotry, and war are part of life, and influences the paths that people end up taking. However, this is not a tale of victims, but triumph. Each character uses what life has dumped on them, carving out a niche, trying to find a spot to thrive.  Nobody appears as they seem, and despite living on the wrong side of the law,  even the most corrupted inhabitants have a conscience.  This was an interesting book, and while I guessed some of the intentions of the characters, I missed others. I was entertained and well as surprised by the outcome.
Sturdy yoga straps that will hold tight in a pose for years. Strong plastic buckles, reinforced stitching, and a perfect length. I received this product for an honest review.
Surprising amount of light from this little garden lamp. It soaks up power from the sun all day and sends out a bright light as soon as it gets dark.I received this product for an honest review.

Easy to hold and sturdy, this is a much better nail clipper than the standard one you get in the drug store. Sharp and precise. Swivel handle. Very long for easy handling. received this product for an honest review.
Prevents the mess in microwave when reheating food. Easy hold handle and vents to control steam buildup. Fits over most plate sizes. I received this product for an honest review.
Inexpensive mouse that runs on a rechargeable battery. Matte finish- easy on hand. Buttons worked fine. I received this product for an honest review.
Great little device that reads barcodes and identifies products It has a multi language keyboard. Perfect for retail bushiness, libraries and such. I received this product for an honest review.

Great little item for those that like to travel. Lightweight scale that one can take to weigh their luggage to avoid or be prepared for additional baggage fees when traveling. Ideal gift for a travel agent or people who travel a lot. I received this product for an honest review

Lovely novella about a heart torn by two loves. Sally Rayton is a former country girl who has left rural life to make a new one in the city. There she meets Trevor, a hard working student who adores her. When her grandfather dies, she must return to the country to take care the loose ends of his estate. At the reading of the will, she learns that her grandfather has tied her to her lifelong friend and neighbor Jack. Jack will do everything in his power to convince Sally that not only does the country rule her heart, but he does as well.Sweet and full of heartfelt emotion, this is a powerful little short story that will make the reader feel Sally's angst as she considers her options. Sally must dig deep to decide what is best her both her and her grandfather's legacy.
Durable glass face with digital reading. Love this scale. I received this product for an honest review.

Expensive but fin item that turns your phone into a photo booth. I used it for a party with my seven year old grandson and we had a blast printing very small sticker pictures for everybody to take home. Great for schools or classroom projects. Good for labeling for a science project. I recieved this product for an honest review.
Nicely fitted biking gloves. Flexible.Fit comfortably without feeling too tight. Lightweight. I received this product for an honest review.
Strong and durable. Lightweight- fit my head nicely. Didn't move once I had it on. I received this product for an honest review.

Lightweight and portable shower, perfect for my prepping station. I never even knew these existed. Filled it with five gallons of water and the shower head delivered a nice stream of warm water. Perfect for camping. I received this product for an honest review.
Wonderful cooling towel that sops up all your perspiration and cools you off at the same time. Nice size, soft and absorbent. Perfect for biking or yoga. I received this product for an honest review

Great lightweight and strong handle that is not permanent and can be applied to any walls. Suction works great. It will separate eventually, so should be reapplied each time. Works with an easy flip of a switch. I received this product for an honest review.

Luckiest Girl Alive is dark and snarky, just like the main character, New York career woman, Ani Fanelli. Raised by an indifferent father and social climbing mother, Ani is enrolled in a prestigious private school where she jockeys for acceptance from the cool kids. Her brains take a back seat to her ambition and Ani is both abused and shunned. The book has a slow simmer to the supposed climax, jumping from the hard lights of the past to the brittle present. Everything about Ani screams success, from her envious spot as a writer for a magazine, to her picture perfect fiancé and the wedding of the decade. Ani holds onto her superior position, digging her claws into the slippery glass ceiling, and resting her suede, toeless booties on the hordes of women desperate to depose her. She covets her hard won prizes with vicious domination, and the reader is lulled into believing it's the result of her experiences at the hands of her cruel classmates. Then the book takes an unexpected left turn, where the words move out of focus and the reader must reevaluate the entire first half of the book. Ani's sharply defined angles blur, her motives as well as character reshape forcing the reader to rethink the personality, as well as the morality of the character. Just as you can't judge a book by it's cover, so can a reader not judge Ani. She comes barreling back into focus, her irritating competitiveness washing way, revealing the misunderstood victim buried under the dense armor. I loved this book. I loved that it surprised me, enough so I had to finish it in one sitting, reading until 3 A.M. How do you define a page turner- Luckiest Girl Alive.
Solar powered and activated by motion- this is a powerful little light. I put it over my basement door- and it lights up the entire area. I received this product for an honest review.

Nice enough light on a solar powered item. Put it over the basement door and it covered the entire area which is about fifteen feet. Bright enough that the door and the surrounding area was illuminated. I received this product for an honest review.

Lovingly written coming of age story taking place in the 1990's in a small town in Texas. Tessa Palmeri zeros in the struggle and angst of that important time just before a teen is leaving for college. Everything from young love to picking the right choices color popular student Olivia's world, and she must learn to mature fast and deal with her demanding father and question what life has in store for her She has to chose to let her father map out her life, or make her decisions based on her own choices.. Palmeri understands teens, their language, what is important to them. She paints a vivid picture of life in America at the close of the last century with an insiders eye.

Attractive leather wallet that can serve double duty as a small clutch. Saddle color, it has a double snap to keep your credit cards and cash safe. Silk lined pocket with a zippered compartment. A lot of space for credit cards. I received this product for an honest review.

Wider beam led uv flashlight, excellent for finding those pesky stains. Long lasting, and durable, it is a useful tool for all homeowners. Hard metal casing insures longevity. I received this product for an honest review.
Small, metal handheld LED UV flashlight that spots those annoying presents left by pets on the floor. Effective, but a small beam. I received this product for an honest review.

Width swath of light that spots those annoying "spots" left by Spot. You will be shocked with the light shines on a surface and it shows discoloration left by pet urine. I received this product for an honest review.

I have a 10 year old Beagle who is a "walking garbage can". I like to say that he will eat anything that "is or ever was food" if you know what I mean. No matter what I do, he will eat anything. As a result, he gets terrible diarrhea and occassional vomiting. Since it doesn't go away on its own, I end up having to take him to the Emergency vet frequently, to be given fluids and anti-diarrheic meds (like Metronidazole which he has taken many times). This has happened multiple times while away on vacation, requiring for me to end my vacation early which was not ideal for both my dog and myself.While at the vet one visit, my Vet suggested that we try this product - Forti Flora for dogs. I purchased one box from my vet to try it out. One box is a 30-day supply. The box comes with 30 individual packets inside. Each day, you simply rip open the top of one of these little packets and sprinkle the stuff on your dog's food before eating it. It's light brown in color and has a few white speckles in it. My dog is NOT picky (of course) and he gobbles it up on his food like it wasn't even there.The most notable thing is this...this stuff actually WORKS. My dog continues to eat "garbage" on a daily basis, but as long as I am giving this to him each day, he can get through it. He has not had diarrhea since the first day that I started giving this to him! Since that was 5 months ago, that is a HUGE success in my book! He has no side effects at all from this. And, I know that it's working because I ran out of it and he had to go for 2 days before the next shipment arrived. During those two days, he was definitely feeling it - upset stomach and loose stool. As soon as he took this again, he was fine!Yes, this may be expensive for use on a daily basis for some people. But, for me, it's worth it. I now have confidence that I can take my dog on vacation and actually enjoy it and not have to go home early because of his intestinal issues.Fantastic product that I have already reordered many times and plan to continue to this every day going forward. You can buy these in individual boxes instead of this 3-pack if desired.  I vary depending on which has the better price at the time of reorder.

I ordered this basket as a gift for my wonderful Veterinarian to give to her for the holiday season.  The basket came wrapped beautifully in plastic - ready to be given as a gift.  I didn't have to do anything to it other than hand it to her right out of the delivery box which was great.This particular basket has lots of different food products in it - check out the picture and product description for details.In summary, my Vet absolutely loved it and said that the quality of the basket and the products was fantastic.  I am happy that I chose this item, and will definitely purchase it again as a gift for others when needed.

I am a 43 year old female who has a variet of health issues, including extreme muscle tightness at all times.  This issue is most severe in my forearms and my upper back and shoulder area.  I have participated in months of physical therapy and acupuncture which has allowed for me to function on a daily basis.  Although I have tried many, many muscle relaxers (Stay Calm Magnesium powder, Magnesium pills, Formula 303, SalonPas, Thermacare, etc etc etc), the only thing that has ever helped to loosen my muscles at all is acupuncture. For various reasons, I have not been able to attend acupuncture for more than a month, and wow, I am hurting because of this!  So, figured that I would try this out.This is a homeopathic solution, which is great for me, since I take a lot of medications for my various health issues and this type of product is less likely to interact with my other medications (please be sure to research this to be sure, however!).The product comes in a rollerball tube, where you unscrew the top to find a rollerball (just like roller deodorant works).  The product is clear.  You use the rollerball tube to roll the product onto your skin in the desired area and then rub it in with your hands.  It's not thick, but it's not thin - somewhere in between.  I would say almost like the consistency of suntan lotion but in a more liquid form.In regards to the smell, it is so faint, you can barely even tell that it has any smell at all. But, I have noticed that it might smell a bit like menthol, but it's so faint, I would wonder if everyone can even smell any scent at all both during and after you apply the product.It has a somewhat sticky consistency, and it remains on your skin like that for a few hours.  I didn't mind, as I was still able to get dressed with no issues (wearing casual clothing) about 5 minutes after applying it.So, how does it work?  I don't know why it works, but it works.  Seriously.  I don't have muscle cramping issues, so I can't comment on whether it works well or quickly with that issue.  But, for my extreme muscle tightness, it really helps.  And, other than acupuncture, nothing else has ever helped with this problem.  It took about 10 minutes for me to notice something, and it got better ever 30 minutes for the next two hours.In terms of how long do the results last, for me, for the muscle tightness issue, it lasted me for two days until I decided to reapply in order to try to relax my muscles even more.  After using this for about a week, I would say that the results from the initial applications (two) at still holding - unbelievable!  How is this possible?  How it is possible for a topical solution to have the same result on me as an acupuncture session?  I just don't know, but it does.  This product worked so well that I immediately ordered 6 more tubes of it.In terms of the size of the bottle, yes, it's not large.  It's the size of a rollerball deodorant.  I have used this three times in total (and used a lot of product in those three applications) and the bottle isn't even half empty.  Of course, it will vary depending on the size of the area of your skin that you are covering.  But, for me, I don't care if it is "expensive", if it works this well and saves me a trip to the Doctor's office for my acupuncture treatments (which cost me twice as much for one session), sold!I definitely recommend that you try this out, it's worth the risk.

I am a 43 year old female with fine medium brown hair colored blonde and cut in a bob to my shoulders.  My hair is very dry, and does not hold color well.  I have used the Lanza and Matrix hair products and really love them.  But, I wanted to try something new so I ordered this product.Based on the reviews, I really expected to love this product.  A few nice things about it are that for my fine hair, it doesn't weigh it down like some moisturzing shampoo/conditioners do which is great.  Also, the smell is pleasant - unisex smell that reminds me an "ocean breeze" scent if that makes any sense.The things that I didn't like were that the shampoo dried my hair out, even though it was very easy to lather and seemed very gentle to my hair.  The conditioner is very creamy, and did balance out the drying effect of the shampoo a bit.  But, when I dried my hair, it was a bit dry.  For a moisturizing set, I had expected for it not to be dry, of course.Also, this will not apply to most people, but I found the bottles difficult to use.  They are very thick plastic, and since I have arthritis in my hands, I had a hard time squeezing them to get the product to come out.  Again, not really a factor for most people, but wanted to mention it.I think that based on the positive experience from the majority of other people, you may want to try it.  But, for me, I will stay with Lanza as this is more moisturizing for my hair type.

I am a 43 year old female who has asthma, and as a result, I never wear fragrance as it irritates my asthma.  In the past, when I have tried to wear a fragrance, I either put so little on that I can't smell anything or too much that I am gaggling.  I gave up on trying to find a fragrance that worked for me years ago.But, in searching for another product here on Amazon, this product came up in my recommendations.  After reading the reviews, I decided to give it a try.This product is a small glass bottle which contains the perfumed oil.  This is a thicker oil that you rub onto your skin in the desired locations with the rollerball dispenser at the top of the product (under the cap).  I really liked this design, as it allowed for me to control the amount of product very well.Also,  since it was an oil, the scent was much more long lasting that anything else that I have tried - lasting all day which was great.  Since it's small, it's very portable - I could take it with me in my purse if desired - but since the scent lasted all day, I didn't even need to do that.In regards to the smell, although I always have favored any kind of vanilla scent (which is why I wanted to try this product even without smelling it first), I found that it was just too musky for me.  The scent reminded me of my grandmother.  Just a little too musky for my taste.I did purchase the Lavinalla 4 piece mini set at the same time, which contains this exact set as part of that set in addition to three other scents with a vanilla base.  I have found that the Vanilla Lavender, Vanilla Coconut and Vanilla Grapefruit scents are better suited for what I was looking for.

I purchased the Jawbone activity bracelet from UP about 5 months ago.  As a result of cleaning binge that I recently went on at home, I misplaced (aka lost) the charging bracelet that comes with the bracelet with the initial purchase.  Thus, I had to order a replacement.Since I was so disappointed with not being able to use my bracelet due to the lost charger and battery that ran out, I ordered this product which is actually a 2-pack of the same item - 2 separate chargers.This product is identical to the charger that you receive when you buy the initial product which is great and important, since many times, the charger does not work as well or at all, for a replacement charger.  This worked great and I have had no issues.  And, it's nice having an extra charger around so that I never have to run out of batter on my activity bracelet again.

I am a 42 year old female who is really warm all of the time.  This prevents me from getting much sleep, as I am really hot.  Depsite using cooling sheets and wearing moisture-wicking pajamas, in a room cooled by Central Air conditioning, I am still too hot to sleep.  I have tried other projects like a Bamboo mattress pad, Tempurature balancing mattress pad, the new Dual Temp Mattress pad from Sleep Number...nothing worked.For my last attempt to cool myself at night, I ordered the Chilipad.  It is fantastic!  A few important points...Setup:  It took me about 4 minutes to set this up.  You simply unroll the mattress pad and lay it on your bed, connect the hose to the control unit on the floor and plug it in, and fill it with water.  That's it. Super easy.Setting the Tempurature:  As you may know from reading other reviews, you set the tempurature (either on the device itself that sits on the floor next to your bed) or using the remote control.  The design is really good as the hoses are small and they come out of the top of the mattress pad (meaning, the part that is near your headboard or your feet, if you reverse it).  This is much better than the Sleep Number Dual Temp, where the hoses were HUGE and came out of the side only.I have only used this for cooling, of course.  When I plugged it in, the temp was 87 degrees.  It took about 1 1/2 hours to reach 53 degrees (in an air conditioned room).  When laying down to sleep, I decided that it was super cool and adjusted the temp frm 46 (the lowest) to 53.  As I slept, it was actually too cold for me (which is beyond amazing!) so I ended up increasing the temp until I hit 70 degrees which seemed to be perfect.  It held that tempurate all night - I was never too hot for the first time in years!Noise level:  Regarding the sound from the Control device, I cannot sleep with noise so this was my concern when purchasing this product.  But, it is very quiet.  When it is initially reaching the target temp, it is blowing at a higher rate.  But, once it reaches that temp, the fan speed slows down to whisper.  Even though I am sensitive to noise, it really was not an issue.  I am going to experiment with putting the control devices under the foot of my bed to reduce the noise even more, but really, it was not loud at all.  The Sleep Number Dual Temp mattress pad (which blows air instead of using water, like the Chilipad) was much louder.Timer:  Although I have not used these features (as I do not need them), you can set the timer so that it turns off after X number of hours (for example, it turns off in 4 hours). And, you can also set it so that you go to sleep with one tempurature and you wake up with another (for example, you go to sleep at 68 degrees and wake up with 72 degrees).Comfort:  In terms of comfort, this mattress pad is about 1 inch thick and it's very comfortable.  I read a review that said that the person could feel the tubes?  No way.  I can't feel anything.  I also can't hear the water moving through the tubes at all.  Super comfy.I haven't had the need to wash it yet, but apparently, the pad can be washed in your regular washing machine which is great.Update:  It took me three nights until I got it the way that I liked it - to figure out my ideal tempurature (it is 68 degrees, by the way) and also to position the control unit where the noise was less.  I would suggest that you try this for the first time when you don't have to wake up early the next day, as I didn't sleep too well for those first two nights while I was messing around with the temp and the position of the control unit, of course.Also, another benefit that I didn't expect - the sound of the fan on the unit acts like a "white noise" machine.  I have found that I am sleeping better now because I am not distracted by other sounds outside since the fan noise (even though it's very quiet) cancels the other noises out.  My dog slept through a thunderstorm because of this white noise - which he nevers does - great!In summary, fantastic product and well worth the price.  I am planning to order another one for my second bedroom shortly.  Love it!

I am a 42 year old female who is very warm all of the time, due to my nature and the medications that I am taking for my health.  As a result, I don't sleep - at all - due to being hot all of the time.  I have tried so many different products in order to try to keep myself cool at night (including various cooling sheets, tempurature-controlling mattress pads, the new Sleep Number Dual Temp Mattress pad, etc), including the purchase of this mattress pad.A few things to mention...the quality of this product is very good.  It comes folded up and you simply unfold it and put it on your bed just like any regular mattress pad.  It is a bit heavy - without looking this up in the product details, I would say that it's close to 10 pounds when folded up.  But, I was able to carry it without any issues.Part of the mattress pad unzips to come apart so that you can wash it, if you like.  The rest of it is made of this cooling gel that is across the majority of the surface where you would lay while in your bed.  Note:  The cooling gel does not cover the entire surface!  It does not come up to the part where your pillow would lay, for obvious reasons (you don't need it up there since your head is laying on a pillow).The gel itself is only about 1/2 inch thick.  The design is very good, as it is evenly distributed across and doesn't pool or gather unevenly into the cells. The coolness is created due to the gel and chemicals, I suppose - not quite sure how or why it works, but it works well.When you first lay down on it, it's very cold.  It gradually starts to warm up.  I found that I had a good 4 hours of cooling until it got too warm.  This is the best that I have seen in these products, as most won't last one or two hours before getting too warm to use. But, once it's warm, you have to move to another area for the rest of the night in order for it to cool down again.  Again, this is normal for this type of product.In terms of comfort, this was not too uncomfortable for me.  But, since I typically sleep on a soft mattress, this definitely made it feel like a firmer mattress just due to the design.My reasons for not giving it 5 stars...the product has a smell to it, similar to a new Memory Foam mattress.  This typically goes away after a week or two, but you need to be aware of this.  Also, although it cooled great for those 4 hours, it got very warm after that time, requiring me to move to the other side of the bed or actually take off the mattress pad.  For those who only need the cooling effect to fall asleep, this may not be an issue.  But, since I am hot all of the time, this was a problem for me.  Probably not realistic for me to expect this type of product to stay cool for 8 hours so, really not the fault of the product, just with my own expectations.Overall, I feel that this is a high-quality product and would not hesitate to recommend it.

I purchased this item to use as a laptop desk when I am working at home but in a different location than my office (for example, while sitting on the couch).  I have problems with pain in my arms due to overusage, so it's really important that I have my laptop at the proper height.When you receive this product, it is actually compacted into a small square that almost looks like a laptop (it's about the same size).  You slide the back off and inside are the four legs that are able to be pulled out.  You simply slide out one or both of the extension pieces that are built into the legs and turn it to lock into place.  Great concept.  Then, you slide the leg into the opening under the desk and turn it to lock into place.  Again, great concept.The back cover that you slide off to reveal the storage compartment for the legs turns into an extension to the top of the desk for your mouse.  Really, great idea.The only issue is the quality of the product. It's lightweight (probably weighs one pound), which is key as most people would want to travel with it.  But, unfortunately, in this case, it also means that it's not very good quality.  I used this desk a total of 5 times and on the fifth time, one of the legs broke - the connection which is made of plastic broke and thus, it won't extend properly now.  I had to return it, as I could no longer use it at the desired height.One other point...for my intended usage, as a desk that you would sit at, you can't put your legs under it.  It is just way too narrow to actually sit under it as a desk.  Probably not an issue for anyone else but wanted to mention it.Although I am disappointed due to the poor quality of leg design, I really like it and will order a replacement if I can't find an alternate.

I have a very old wooden picket fence on one side of my yard.  This fence belongs to my neighbor.  It is so old and rotting that the wasps love it - at any given time, there are 15-20 wasps flying around and sitting on the fence.  Although they do not bother me or my dog, I have no doubt that if one of them flew too close to my dog, he would try to eat it and that would be not good, to say the least.I don't want to hurt the wasps (they are not making a nest), but I wanted for them to go someplace else.  I never use toxic chemicals in my yard at all and wanted to find something natural instead.  I found this product and decided to give it a try.You are ordering two individual spray bottles of the product with this order.  It smells like orange oil and is a clear liquid with the consistency of water.  I sprayed this generously on half of the fence as a test to see if it worked.  Although the wasps moved out of the way while I was spraying, they immediately came right back to the area as if nothing happened.  And, I watched them over the course of the next two days to see if there was any difference - nothing.So, basically, I just spent almost $35 on two bottles which I will end up dumping down the drain.  Based on my experience, don't waste your money.

I am a 42 year old female who dresses casually whenever possible. In the Summer, this includes my standard wardrobe of shorts, a tshirt and Nike sneakers.  Due to some of the medications that I am taking, I am really, really hot all of the time.  Thus, I was looking for any opportunity to keep myself cooler.  I found these shorts at my local Boscov's department store and decided to try them.I absolutely love these shorts!  They are made of cotton, but it has almost a silken feel to it.  They lay perfectly on your body -not too form fitting and don't cling to any areas that you don't want to highlight (like my stomach which hasn't been flat since I was 12 years old). They are super soft and very lighweight (the inside of the side pockets is actually mesh which allows for superior venting and coolness).  These shorts do wrinkle if not properly folded and stored but I never iron them as the wrinkles come out within minutes of wearing them.The other great thing about these shorts is that it has sun block protection built into the fabric.  They call it "Omni" and it is supposed to prevent the sunrays from getting through to your skin.  For me, this is not really a concern as I have a medium skin tone and tan (and rarely burn).  But, it that effect keeps me a bit cooler, than it's great.  I also noticed that it doesn't stick to my skin if it's really hot outside and I am sweating - you can't even see it on the shorts.  They are not waterproof, but dry almost instantly (I wore these on an amusement park water ride where I was drenched and they were barely wet and dried within 5 minutes!).Due to the factors that I mentioned above, I am definitely cooler when I am wearing these shorts no matter what the heat/humidity is outside.I love these shorts so much, I ordered a dozen more of them from Back Country website (cheaper than Amazon or Boscov's) in various colors.  It's part of my daily wardrobe now - love it.

It's super soft and almost feels like you are wearing your pajamas which is great. They call it "Omni" and it is supposed to prevent the sunrays from getting through to your skin.  For me, this is not really a concern as I have a medium skin tone and tan (and rarely burn). I also noticed that it doesn't stick to my skin if it's really hot outside and I am sweating - you can't even see it on the shirt.Although it's a polo shirt and it has a collar, due to the factors that I mentioned above, I am definitely cooler when I wear this shirt no matter what the heat/humidity is outside.I love this shirt so much, I ordered a dozen more of them from Amazon and the Boscov's website in various colors.  It's part of my daily wardrobe now - love it.

I currently have a Weight Watchers scale, which I have used for many years.  It's not perfect, but I am used to it and it's ok for me.  I spend time in two different locations, thus, I wanted to purchase a scale to have in both places (so that I didn't have to carry it around with me).  I wanted to be as consistent as possible, so I ordered another WW brand scale (since the model that I have is no longer available).This scale is VERY HEAVY.  It is made of glass - the section that you step on is completely glass.  The LCD display is very large, but hard to read at times since there is no backlight on it (t's black numbers against a dark grey background).The biggest complaint is that the scale actually doesn't work.  First, you are supposed to tap the scale in order to turn it on (just like my other WW scale).  But, no matter how hard you tap this, it doesn't turn on.  I physically have to lift the scale off of the groud to get it to turn on!Next, the weight is not accurate.  It changes as you are standing on it!  If you step on the scale, get a measurement, step off, and do this again, you will never get the same weight value.  This is unbelievable.  I was wearing the same clothes, in the same location, standing in the same place on the scale, doing this within seconds of each test, and got different results every single time.  My current WW scale is also not great with this - I have to weigh myself 3 times in a row and try to take the average of those weights to figure out my actual weight.  But, with my current scale, usually, two of the three are the same.  With this scale, every single time, every weight is different (even off by one or two pounds!).  Obviously, this is not acceptable.I returned this product the day after I received it.  Will not order another WW scale again.  Ordered a scale from EatSmart - hopefully, this will work like it should.  Would not recommend this product based on my experience.

I am a 42 year old female who has brown hair that is colored blonde with different color highlights, cut in a bob to my shoulders. My hair is fine, but I have a lot of it. My hair grows very quickly (between 3/4 and 1 1/4 inches a month, depending on the season). Thus, I need to get my hair colored every 5 weeks in order to manage the roots.My hair also starts to "fade out" as I am getting closer to the next color session - my highlights seem to get a bit dim, for lack of a better term. I read about this product and decided to try it - bought it at my local drug store (Rite Aid).I typically use Matrix Biolage Strengthening shampoo and conditioner every day as part of my regular routine.I purchased both the Highlight activating shampoo and conditioner and used them together. This comes in two different types - one for lighter blond highlights and the other for darker blonde highlights. Even though my darkest color would be considered dark blonde, since my lighest highlights are very light blonde, I opted for the product designed for lighter highlights thinking that for me, it's ok if my darker highlights became lighter, but not the other way around.Both the shampoo and the conditioner are light yellow in color, with a bit of pearly white mixed in. The smell is nice - just smells clean and not too strong. No scent remained on my hair after it was dry.I used the same amount of shampoo and conditioner that I normally do. Lather was normal - as expected. My issue is this...this shampoo completely stripped my hair. My hair was so dry and brittle after using this, I was afraid to even comb through it. The conditioner was not overly heavy - I think that it did a good job of preventing tangles but could not compensate for how drying the shampoo was to my hair.My hair was definitely brighter - I could even tell when it was wet after one use! But, even after returning to my regular shampoo, it took a few days for the texture of my hair to return to normal. This product, according to the label, has Sodium Lauryl Sulfate in it, which is apparently really damaging to your hair. This may explain it? Not sure...The effects of the brightening did last over the following week and didn't fade again which is ideal since I shouldn't have to use this every day for weeks in order to get/keep the effect.In summary, I will use this only once a week during the week or two prior to getting my hair colored to help get through that difficult period, but would never consider using this on a more frequent basis due to the excessive stripping that occured.

I had a CaseMate iphone case identical to this (minus the kickstand) which I used for years with my iphone 4.  I recently upgraded to iphone 5, and thus, due to the size difference of these phone models, needed to purchase a new case.  I learned the hard way with my first iphone 3GS that I need a sturdy case at all times since I dropped that phone and cracked the glass.  Not fun.I really like this case for multiple reasons...first, it's very light weight and slim.  I had previously purchased the Otter brand cases and others but disliked them as they were so bulky and heavy.  This case adds very light weight and width to the profile of your phone which is ideal.Next, it has rubber sides which makes it easier to hold and prevents it from sliding.  This is great since I use my phone as a GPS navigator sometimes in the car, and this case allows for me to sit it on my dashboard horizontally for easier viewing but prevents from it from sliding back and forth while driving (the other cases that I had in the past did not do this, and my dash was scratched up as a result!).The opening at the bottom of the case is very wide which allows for easy access to the charging port and earbug plug-in.  Also, the power button sticks out of the top but is covered, but is easily pushed on/off.The things that I would say about this device that could be improved (thus, my rating of only 4 stars) is the size of the hole in the cover for the vibrate button.  It's not very accessible and you may need to use a tool to turn this on or off (my fingers are very small and I struggle with this).  Also, the kickstand on the back - although it is very helpful when I viewing video or typing long emails on my phone (with the assistance of a Bluetooth keyboard that I purchased for this purpose as I use this phone for work) - it is pretty thin and I fear that it will break after just a few uses.  As a result, I have avoided using this for that reason (which is not ideal, of course).In summary, love the quality of the cases from CaseMate - these are the only ones that I will buy going forward.  But, this one could be done a bit better.  I would still purchase this style again, though, if needed.

I have a Black and Decker blender, model BLC12650H (color white).  I am not sure how it happened, but I got a large crack in the glass blender jar that came with the blender (think that this occurred through my misuse/poor storage).  I didn't want to throw the entire blender away, as it still worked just fine, so I searched for a replacement glass jar here on Amazon.The product description is a bit lacking, as it doesn't specifically say which models it fits but this was really my only option so I ordered it to take a chance and hope that it would fit.It does fit my blender perfectly.  It is an inch or two shorter in height than the original blender jar but that is not really an issue for me.  Please note that you are only ordering the glass portion of the blender jar here - the plastic top does not come with this product.  I still had the plastic top from the original, so this was not an issue for me.The price of this replacement blender jar was not cheap, but it saved me the cost of replacing the blender all together so it was worth it.

I am a 42 year old female with life-long allergies. I have the darkest circles under my eyes of anyone that I have ever met. No matter how much concealer and foundation I apply, they are always there. And, they make me looker tired and sickly.I have tried other over the counter products to reduce undereye circles like the roller ball thing from Garnier, and other similar treatments. I tried this product on a whim, with no expectations. The instructions are to use it around your eye area (this would be about one inch below your eye in a circle above your eyebrow...). And, to use it in the morning and at night.Since it leaves some residue (it's a cream, but it eventually absorbs into your skin after about 20 minutes), I only decided to use it at night after cleaning my face and before going to bed. After ONE NIGHT of using this, my undereye circles decreased by 50%! After one week, they decreased by about 70%. And, after two weeks of using it, they have decreased by 90%! Absolutely unbelievably fantastic product!Now, of course, you can guess, for whatever reason, Avon seems to have discontinued this product. So, when I found it here, I just bought 3 of them. Actually, as I am writing this review, I have decided to buy another 3 to hold me over for as long as I can. I cannot recommend this product enough - fantastic!
