Not bad at all! I'm not a frequent drinker of tea. If I ever do drink it, I usually lean towards chamomile with milk and honey to help me sleep. My children LOVE tea though, so we were really interested in testing this one out.The flavor was surprisingly nice! I'm not sure I will ever drink it again myself, but the kids adored it! They will definitely be getting lots of cups of tea. It steeped easily to perfection, with a nice light flavor and delicious aroma. I love good smells, so that was definitely a plus for me. It's a very nice size, so it will last us awhile. I would definitely buy again. (I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)

Nice auxiliary cables bundle! I was immediately drawn to the pretty colors these come in. I also really like that one of them is black, so my son can use one too. The green technically would be okay for a boy, but he said it's too bright for him to be cool..This is a 3-pack of 3.5mm male to male cables, so be sure that is what you need before purchasing. Otherwise, they would be basically useless to you if they aren't compatible with your devices. They are very nice colors, and well constructed. They fit all my devices just fine, and are definitely built to last with great flexibility. I would buy again. (I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)

Super cute set of spiral auxiliary cables! These bright, colorful auxiliary cables are definitely nice to look at. I am big on the cute factor with my accessories, and these definitely fit the bill. I really like the spiral design as well. I haven't seen any other auxiliary cables designed this way before.They are 3.5mm male to male cables, so be sure that is what you're looking for before you purchase. Otherwise, they really aren't going to do you much good if they aren't compatible with your devices. They are very thick and sturdy, so I don't see them breaking on me any time soon. The quality is very nice, and I'm quite fond of the design! They are a tad shorter than I'd suggest using in the car, but great for in the home. I would buy again. (I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)

Nice set of auxiliary cables! This is a 2-pack of auxiliary cables for connecting devices and speakers. These are awesome for playing music with devices that aren't Bluetooth capable, or for using a media device in the car.They are 3.5mm male to male cables, so be sure that is what you need before purchasing otherwise they will be useless to you. I really like the pretty blue shade they came in, and the quality is very good. They don't overheat, and are nicely made so I don't see them breaking on me any time soon. I would buy again. (I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)

Nice car air purifier! I ordered this for my best friend. She suffers from pulmonary fibrosis and emphysema, so clean air is an absolute must for her. With the horrible fumes from trucks, buses, and poorly maintained vehicles on the road, I figured this air purifier would come in handy.It was packaged in a nice little box that made it perfect for gifting. All I had to do was hand it to her and it already looked nice! The blue is a very lovely ice blue shade that is visually appealing. No worries of having an eye sore of a device in her cute little car.The quality is very nice. I can tell it was designed with appearances definitely in mind. She said it makes it much easier to breath in her car, which is a really big deal on these humid, smog-filled summer days. I'm really glad I ordered. I would definitely buy again. (I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)
They work. One goes to the right and one goes to the left - just like politicians. Maybe they should make them red and blue. Not much else to say If you need 'em, buy 'em!

I bought this to use with a security camera monitor that has no nearby convenient place for a mouse or trackball. Being hand held this takes no space and is very easy to use. It fits my hand (I wear a size L glove) perfectly. When I plugged it into the DVR's USB port it worked instantly. You use your thumb on the trackball and for the left and right buttons. However you can also use your index or middle finger to left click the "trigger" without moving your thumb from the ball. It's all very natural and ergonomic. Meets my needs perfectly.

This kit provides a variety of connectors to handle a different configurations. The cable channels can be cut easily to size and are paintable. I have an RG6 coax, HDMI and low voltage power cable with room to spare. The adhesive is strong so be careful during installation as you won't take these off easily! Use a level to make a line and follow it.
Bought these for use with my SafeRacks and they do fit in one direction. Well made and will hold ladder securely.
What make this adapter unique is that it can be plugged in either way so the angle can go left or right (or up or down) as needed. It works as it should an is a clever design.

I already have the TVee 26 which is the same unit with the addition of a subwoofer so decided to get this for another TV in a smaller room. I'm very pleased with it. It is so much better than the TV speakers and really makes the dialog much easier to understand.

The plate has rolled edges adding strength and fits the 2U opening in my rack perfectly. The slots allow pure fresh air to circulate and cool the valuable components in the rack. A wonder of modern manufacturing!
These extend a USB cable 9 feet just as advertised. Perfect for attaching desktop items like a trackball, mouse or hub to a PC on the floor. The cables appear well made and should last a lifetime.
Makes installation of an item in a tight cabinet much easier and without damage to the wires. Well made with heavy duty insulation.

I have a fairly wide "sit-on-top" ocean kayak that I wanted to mount to aluminum fence posts.  It fits great. I used the included stand-off spacers and my own stainless steel pan head sheet metal screws. One tip: during installation keep the pins inserted in the lower bracket when you mark holes for drilling otherwise the pin might not line up when you're done.

If you need a 15' HDMI cable why pay more? This does the trick nicely at a great price. It's not bulky and is very flexible. I placed this in a piece of Wiremold with an RG-6QS coax cable and have no problems. I'd buy again if the need arose.

These are useful for eliminating bends in cables and for putting components in shallow cabinets.  Just be sure to look at the way the HDMI ports are oriented on your components to determine whether you want 90's or 270's
Lightweight plastic but comfortable to use and excellent stream pressure.

Installed easily and went through a software update process. If you don't have your own backup software you can d/l some from the WD site. I used their version of Acronis to do an image backup. Using a USB 3.0 port that I installed for this drive the whole PC was backed up in less than 25 minutes,  I hope I never need to do a restore but it's good to have the peace of mind of having a full and up to date disk image on hand.

There are several cards like this to choose from in this price range and, in addition to the good reviews, I needed one that included a low profile bracket which this does and it takes just a minute to change it. This is the only one I found that has the low profile bracket and 4 USB 3.0 ports. Based on the success reported by others I tried installing it on my HP WIN 7 PRO without running the driver installation disk first.  Didn't work for me so I installed the drivers and rebooted. That got the drivers installed and I rebooted once more to finish the installation.  The instruction manual is printed in very tiny print and required a magnifying glass to read which you should do if you need to run the disk.. TIP: Before installing the card into the PC use that magnifying glass to get the number off the chip as there are two versions and you'll need to know which you have to select the correct driver from the disk.  Mine has the NEC 702xx chip which has a specific driver to install from the disk.I bought this to use with a new USB 3.0 backup drive and I love the speed  It used to take a couple of hours to back up my whole disk and now it only takes 23 minutes!
Not much to say about a splitter cable. It does the job and was exactly what I needed to support a new USB 3.0 card.

The rail makes it easier to install and gives you more flexibility since you can add holes as needed. The hooks are coated cast metal as opposed to many others that are just stamped metal. The rope seems a little lightweight but seems to do the job.

This is hard to beat for the price. The mounting plate will accommodate anything up to 200x200 VESA. A very nice feature is that you mount the plate to the TV and then just hang it on the installed mounting arm so you can easily take off the TV if needed.  There are screws for M4, M5 and M6 TV's included.  There are two lag bolts and sleeves for mounting the bracket to either concrete or wood studs.  If you have metal studs (as I do)  you'll want to buy a couple of 1/4" Toggler brand toggle bolts.  There are also two screws included for securing the TV to the bracket once it's hung they are the wrong size. Although you don't really need those screws, I used a couple of the M5 screws that were included as my TV used the M4's.
Well made solid construction. Holds a ladder safely and closely to the wall.
This is a well made, sturdy hook - much better than others I've seen at this price. It would take a LOT of weight to bend this one.

I've had a number of stud finders over the years that beep and flash as you move them across the wall and they've all had their shortcomings. The Franklin 710 is different from every other stud finder on the market. Press the button and the stud shows up clearly with a minimum of movement and you always know where the center and edges of the stud are. Metal or wood - makes no difference. This is the best and only stud sensor you'll need. You'll save about twenty bucks when you add it to your cart and hit 'checkout' at a certain well known dept store that has a big tool department and starts with S.

Used correctly (NOT as pictured!) the ladder is great for use in tight spaces and for easy portability. DO make sure to read and follow the instructions or you could be hurt from a fall.  One problem with this ladder is the rubber(?) feet. Although I rarely use the ladder, the original feet disintegrated just sitting in the garage. I bought replacements (twenty bucks!) put them on the ladder and six months later when I went to use it the new feet had disintegrated as well!  In doing some research I learned that the feet for the 1600E will fit this model and are much better. Indeed, when I received them (same price) they are completely different and look like they may last. Time will tell.

An extension ladder is great to have around the house when you need it but the rest (most) of the time it's just in the way and gets buried making it a project just to get to.  The ladder lift product makes stowing and getting to your ladder easy.  You lean the top of the ladder up against the hook so the top rung rests in it then fasten the strap around the lower rung and hoist away. All the hardware is included for mounting in line or perpendicular to the joists in the ceiling.

This is a simple 10 second message recorder and it works exactly as described. Put the switch on the back in the REC position then press and hold the button on the side and speak for up to 10 seconds, then release the button. To play, move the switch to PLAY and press the side button to hear the recording.  The unit has no sharp edges and is comfortable to carry.  What's it good for?  When you park your car you can speak the location to help locate your car later or you could say a few items that you want to remember at the store. I bought it for a different reason.  I've been getting a lot of robocalls on my cellphone lately.  Playing a Special Information Tone (SIT) tells the robocall equipment that the line is not a working number and deletes your number from their list. Not foolproof but helpful.  I recorded the SIT to this device and hold it up to the phone when answering the call. Simple! You can search for SIT.WAV and find it easily.

This looks and sounds better than it is. The clunky, industrial look of this nozzle may lead you to believe it's something special. It isn't. While it will produce a steady, narrow stream it does so with weaker pressure than others that cost a third the price. I compared this to a ten dollar Craftsman and this was not as good at cleaning a sidewalk and was not particularly comfortable or easy to adjust. In fact, you can get this same nozzle without the digital books and other stuff for a third the price at a popular auction site.  I know there are a lot of great reviews but this product is more hype than substance. Save your money.

These are very well made surface mount housings with dual RJ45 jacks.  I used two pairs of these to make splitters for different purposes.  One pair was used to use one 4 pair cable to provide both an ethernet jack and a phone jack. The other pair was used to provide 2 ethernet jacks from one cable. The package includes both screws and double faced tape for mounting and a ty-wrap for securing the cable(s).

First, the word "free" is a misnomer. I had been considering Ooma for awhile and then it came up at a great price as an Amazon Daily Deal so I pulled the trigger to try it.  I works well but you should understand the costs up front which are described on their website. The "free" service will cost $4.30/month for taxes and fees (may vary by state) and the premium service will add $10 a month to that. That's still a good price for phone service with all US calling included.  Call quality is as good as a landline as long as you have a good internet connection. There are lot's of features and even more with the premium service.  I've only had it a couple of weeks but it looks like a keeper so far.
This is the recommended product to use with the Terminix AllClear and it works well. A lot less bugs!

I've only used it a few times but it does work well and there seems to be less bugs around when we use it. No leaks or other problems after 3 months. It has a nice long cord so you can place it away from the house.

Seems to be the best value for this type of product. My doctor told me to take Silymarin for liver health so that's what I'm doing. I don't know how effective it is but if my doctor thinks it's a good idea I'll continue to take it.
If you want to mount a rain sensor to a gutter this is the part you want.
Interesting little book of business dealings advice that everyone should read.  Quick easy read. I'm sending it on to my son.

I've been a fan of Brother's laser printers for over 20 years finding them to be very reliable and cost effective.  It was time for an upgrade and when I saw this on Amazon for two bills I grabbed it.  Unpacking and setup took about 20 minutes and after installing the software it found the printer on the network and set it up on the computer and printed a test page. We have two PC's and several Android phones and tablets using the printer. The printer has WiFi but I used a wired Ethernet connection that was convenient.  One feature that I really like is duplex printing - automatically printing on both sides of a page. It's really handy for printing out manuals and other lengthy documents. The colors are vibrant and the text is crisp. As with all printers, toner cartridges can get pricey but I've found some good aftermarket suppliers whose prices are about half and provide excellent quality.
They are exactly as pictured and are what you'd expect. No complaints.

The unit does what it says which is play the three tone SIT (Special Information Tone) when the phone is answered.  When I first plugged it in it didn't work at all. Before just sending it back I opened the case (2 screws on the bottom) and saw that there was a replaceable CR2032 "coin" type battery.  I tested the battery and it was dead. I have some on hand as they're the same batteries used in several other devices around the house so I put one in and the device works perfectly.  The dead battery cost it one star which might be unfair as I bought this at half price from Amazon Warehouse Deals who apparently didn't test it before listing it.
Very good price and works fine. Time will tell how long they last and if there's a problem I'll update. So far the dog is happy with them too. The battery fits well and remains secure.
Perfect fit for our 40"x18" ironing board. Well padded and good elastic holds it in place perfectly.
Nice belt. XL measures just shy of 49" and stretches as needed. Pants haven't fallen down yet so I'm pleased.
These say BELL on the front which is fine, and come with inserts to fit 16 configurations. All metal and well made.
Arrived quickly and fits Athena perfectly.
It is a described and works. What more can you ask for?
I've had Trump shirts before and like them as they are cut generously around the midsection and my midsection is indeed generous!

Seems to be really well made and has a very sharp blade. I have not tested it as I have no desire to cut my seatbelts or break my windows and hope I never have reason to do so. But if I do I'll be happy to have this within reach.

These are cheap - both in cost and in quality. The first thing I did was test each one with a cable pair tester and found that seven out of the ten were defective. The problem is that the conductors on one of the jacks on each of the defective ones are misaligned. Obviously no testing or quality control is is done at the factory before shipping these. The reason I bought these is to run both an Ethernet connection and a phone line on the same cable. A standard Ethernet connection uses conductors 1,2,3 & 6 and the phone line uses 4 & 5 so there's no conflict. Using one of these on each end of the cable does the job nicely - if they work. I've returned the whole lot. EDUCATIONAL NOTE: If you're looking to use these to split an Ethernet (internet) connection this is NOT the product you need unless one of the devices is turned off. To run two internet devices at the same time you either need an Ethernet switch (as little as under 10 bucks) or a PAIR of special splitters (Cables to Go 37133 is one brand) designed for that purpose that actually cost more than a switch.
One of the better brushes I've used. The long handle is a nice touch.
Nicely made brush cleans up the BBQ well and the scraper is very useful.
Sturdy vise with extra wide jaws and serrated pipe holder. Should last a lifetime in a home workshop.
I like the way this fits in the hand and accommodates different types of jacks.
Great for shaving. Perfect level of magnification and the light is very even.
Amazon was offering a $10 bonus for buying a $50 gift card. Where else can you make 20% on your money? What's not to love?

This product is like using chewing gum to fix something except it actually works! Once you put it in place you have plenty of time to shape and smooth it to whatever you want and then it cures to make a flexible and permanent repair.  It's even packaged likes sticks of gum. I used half a stick to seal up some wiring and it was perfect for the job.

These are pretty hard to find is small quantities. I bought an item that required this connector and, short of ordering from China or one US distributor who charges more for just two pieces, Amazon is the only place you'll find them. Don't be concerned by the 5.08mm - if you're looking for the 5mm ones this is it and fits perfectly. Not sure what size you need? Just measure the distance between the center of two pins. I only needed the plug-in (male) half of one of these but buying 10 sets was the least expensive option. To clarify the photo, each piece shown is a male and female plugged in so you are actually getting 10 male and 10 female pieces.

The first one I received didn't work and after talking to AcuRite's excellent customer service they determined that it had a bad antenna and needed to be replaced. The replacement arrived two days later from Amazon and it took some more help from AcuRite customer service to get it working.  It wouldn't register online but they were quickly able to force it on the other end.  Once that was done it started working provided that it's pointed through the window to the sensor about 50 feet away. Much beyond that and it can't pick up the signal from the sensor.  Now that it's working I'm very pleased with it.
Bought this to add to my XBlue X16 system. Works great, just like all the others!

My wife and I each have home offices out of Bluetooth range of each other so I bought two of these units, one for each of our offices so our cellphones are in range of our respective units. We also have a home phone system that can handle 4 incoming lines so we have our VOIP line on line one, her cell on line 2 and mine on line 3.  Now, wherever we are in the house we can answer any of the lines on any phone.  This device has decent BT range and outputs a strong enough ring current to activate ringing on the phone system and cordless phones.  Although a bit more expensive, this unit is FAR superior to the Cobra BT-15 which I found to be virtually worthless (very limited range and not enough ring current to ring even one standard phone (1 REN)).Now the BAD NEWS that cost this review 2 stars:  One of the units was not automatically connecting consistently so I updated the firmware. That did nothing to solve the problem but now all or parts of conversations are garbled to the point of being unintelligible even though the phone is only six feet away from the unit. I looked at the Info n the website and found nothing useful so I called.  Their phone is ALWAYS answered by an answering machine which invites you to leave a message or send an email. I did both - twice. It's been 6 days with no response so essentially, once you buy this product you're on your own - there is NO way to reach customer service if they even have such a thing.My configuration: Cell phones:  Samsung Galaxy S5 & Samsung Galaxy Note 4 VOIP line:  Nettalk Phone System: XBlue X16
I used this to plug a headset into the line out jack on my Tivo. Perfect for the job.
Tears cleanly and is strong. Quality tape.
This is a compact unit that keeps a watch wound and does it quietly. Well made and a good value.
My wife really likes this mirror and the different magnifications it offers. The light is perfect for makeup.
They do the job and you'll have a lifetime supply of test strips!

For a two speaker system, these sound very good. Bass is a little thin but what you'd expect without a subwoofer. Overall I was pleased enough with the ones I bought for my PC to order a second pair for my wife's PC. Her comment about the bass echoes mine. These speakers look good on the desk but are a bit deeper and heavier than most, as you'd expect with Bose, to create a detailed sound from a small system.  The included cable for connecting to the PC is only 40" - not long enough if the PC is on the floor and you need to route the cable at all.  If you don't already have a longer cable, order one at the same time so you can get up and running when these arrive.

I used Miraderm when I had 6 weeks of radiation for throat cancer. This is absolutely the BEST cream to use. It is not greasy and provides great relief. I had some peeling but it would have been worse without it.

This is, by far, the best grill brush I've ever used. I does a very good job of breaking up and removing baked on crud from the surface of the grill. For between the grates, a scraper is still required but this greatly redices the time needed to clean a grill.

I just did a 250 mile trip in what turned out to be a mostly windy and very rainy trip. Although only listed a water resistant (a more expensive water proof version is offered) it did a fairly good job of keeping things dry. We had 5 standard size carry-on roller bags and a few knapsacks and only two of the cloth sided pieces ended up with some damp cloths. So, if there's a possibility of rain on your trip either use hard sided luggage or wrap the items in plastic.  The height of the bag is perfect for standing carry on luggage on their sides rather than laying them flat. That way the bag will easily handle at least seven bags with room to spare.  The bag is well made and has a soft felt type bottom so as not to scratch the roof's surface although I opted to use a non-skid mat as well. The tie down straps seem adequate to the task but I also used a pair of additional tie downs I had on hand.  The bag did it's job and is ready for the next trip.
I like this belt. My pants haven't fallen down yet!

This pad is NOT just shelf liner material like some others It is a rubberized felt pad the both protects the roof and keeps the car top bag from sliding. I recently used it a 250 mile trip in driving rain and it did it's job perfectly and still looks like new.

I needed to tie a car topper bag to the roof of my 2014 Highlander Ltd. but didn't want to install the roof cross bars for a one time use.  These eye bolts screw directly into the fitting for the cross bars and were perfect for the job.

Excellent book for anyone who was, is or knows a "telephone man."  A nostalgic look back at a different time thast those in the phone business will appreciate. The author even signed the book! Great read, highly recommended!

Holds the phone at the top and my MP3 transmitter plugs in below. Sturdy gooseneck won't droop from weight of phone. Using a Galaxy Note 4 with a case which is pretty big and it fits with room to spare and handles the weight. Two USB ports for power. The design of this unit eliminated the need for a power splitter and has a narrow profile which saves space and looks good.  Very pleased.
Good price for fresh batteries. 9 year expiration date (2024)!
Lose or damage the rear cover?. This will fix you up. Exact replacement.

This cover protects the phone and allows for wireless charging with any QI charging pad. hen the cover is closed there's a new screen that pops up in the window which is touch sensitive so notifications can be received and acted on without opening the cover.
I use this to control the volume from the TV headset jack to my earbuds. It works perfectly and there is no static when adjusting the volume. Adjusts the volume from full off to full on.
This will come in handy when traveling. No need to wait for your phone to recharge. Just swap batteries and let the depleted one recharge for later.
Good price for MERV 11 filters. Looks as good as the ones that were installed initially.
If you want to plug a headphone into audio output jacks this is the part you need!

Not much one can say about a cable other than it works which it does well. I use this for earbuds that are connected to the line level audio output of my TIVO box. While the 25 foot extension reduces the volume a bit I still need an in-line volume control to reduce the volume to a comfortable level.  That means the cable is doing a good job and not attenuating the signal too much.
Ergonomically very good with a large lever that's easy on the thumb.  The nail catcher is a nice benefit. Cutting action is very good.
Range is not as good as advertised. Other than that I like it a lot. Increasing the range would  make it perfect.
Keeps a spare battery charged and ready. Battery included. Fully charges the battery quickly.

I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. I have used many Kazu products and find all of them to be of the highest quality. This is no exception. I love to use cinnamon in sweet dishes. This is the most authentic cinnamon which has a fantastic flavor! There is quite a difference between this and the more common cheaper varieties. I also like the zip closure bag it comes in. This is the genuine article!

I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. This tumeric(the basis of curry powder) has a wonderful authentic and powerful flavor and aroma. I use all sorts of spices liberally in my cooking and I love to use this. Tumeric is also known as a very healthy addition to the diet and I try to include this along with other healthy spices in my dishes. I also like the zip closure bag this comes in. I find all the Kazu products to be of the highest quality.

I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. This ginger root powder has an authentic and powerful flavor and aroma. I also like the zip closure bag it comes in. I use all sorts of spices in my cooking and I love to use this since it has such a genuine flavor. You really can't find a better ginger root powder.

I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. This chili powder has a very authentic and powerful flavor and aroma. It is nicely packaged in a bag with a zip closure. This is one of my favorite chili powders and I use spices such as this regularly in my cooking.

I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. I have used a variety of Kazu products and find all of them to be of very high quality and great taste. This tea is no exception. It has a great ginger flavor without being harsh as some ginger teas can be. If you enjoy ginger flavor, you should like this.

I really enjoyed this tea. It has a great refreshing taste that is different from most herbal teas. It is very pleasant. Can't really describe the flavor beyond that. The pyramid teabags work very well also. I have tried other Kazu products and find all of them to be very high quality with great flavors.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review.

As are all the Crescent products, this set is awesome! You cannot find wrenches with better quality than these. They fit very precisely and are unmatched in durability. Even the finish is amazing; they shine like mirrors. The plastic holder is also well designed and very handy. The price is reasonable, too.

This camera definitely delivers what it promises and is well made. First, be sure to download the manual from their website( tomtom.com/cam) because no real useful information is packaged with the camera(there is a quick start guide but don't rely on that). The manual is well written. Let me mention one important feature of this camera that is hardly mentioned in the specs: this does record sound. It has a built-in microphone. If you install the waterproof lens cover(it only comes with the splashproof lens cover which is good for most purposes and permits the built-in microphone to function) it will disable the built-in microphone(it covers it up). One great feature of this camera is it allows an external microphone to be connected(I wish all video recorders did that! You need good sound for professional work), but you will need to purchase the dedicated cable for that. The back end of this comes out for charging, inserting the micro SD card(you insert it with the electrical contacts face up), and for use as if it were a regular flash drive that you could just insert into a computer. So, you don't have to use the mobile app. But the mobile app does give you a lot of great features. One criticism I have(and so do many others) is that there is no desktop app. Obviously, you can't shake a desktop(or a laptop!) but it would be nice to be able to use most of the app features on a computer. You certainly can view the photos and videos on your computer without the app but some data may not be viewable without the app. The camera is amazingly light-weight and small. My only criticism of it is that it uses a fixed focus lens, but I guess that makes sense for an action camera. The image quality, including exposure and focus, seemed good to me nevertheless. I don't know how this camera compares to others on the market, such as the famous GoPro, but this one certainly impressed me. One more note: there is included in the box a strange item with a fuzzy little brush-like piece. There is no mention what this is. It is a windscreen. It has a little picture that shows the self-sticking piece goes over the microphone holes at the base of the lens assembly and then the fuzzy part is stuck onto that by Velcro. It prevents the wind whizzing past the microphone holes from distorting the sound.

My dog has a very sensitive digestive track and I have to feed her a very hypoallergenic diet. This really fits the bill with superb ingredients. It has the type of ingredients that the finest dog foods have. The bottom line is that my dog loves this stuff and it doesn't bother her digestive tract. My only complaint is that my bag(the four pound bag) doesn't have a zip-loc type closure. Maybe the larger bags do, but I don't know. The bag itself is a very high quality foil type of material and keeps the food very fresh.This is a great choice in premium dog foods.

I don't know how you screw up a duster, but this one is pretty screwed up. A duster should be nice and fluffy. This is about as fluffy as a wet cat, and not a long-hared cat. So, it really is only good for dusting rather flat surfaces. For example, it is not at all good for dusting behind electrical equipment like your TV or computer. Also, whatever fluff it has is mostly on the sides so you really can't use the tip as you should for poking into crevices. If that isn't depressing enough, just try inserting the handle into the fluff part. On the package, it only show an inserting motion. On the web page, it further explains exactly where you should insert it: into the white portion and it is not easy to find, especially if you are not told what to look for. I did some dusting and tried to shake the dust off and the fluff part went flying. It was not easy to find the place to insert it especially since I didn't take notice before it flew off. So, you can't even shake this out as you would normally do with a duster. Also, is this washable? They don't say. I suppose they just want you to buy more refills. I gave this three stars because it does pick up dust, but it the world of dusters, this one is a sick puppy and a sick puppy is a very sad thing to behold. Pick a real duster.

I asked to review these because I have always loved bamboo fabrics, and these have not disappointed me. They are super soft and silky. They are bright white and contain no dyes. Each cloth is 10 by 10 inches. These are so silky, they are too good just to use as washcloths! I might even use them as handkerchiefs! It doesn't mention it on the cloths or the packaging, but these most likely are made using the viscose rayon process, with bamboo as the cellulose source. The viscose process is noted for producing very silky soft fabrics. This would make a great baby shower gift or any other kind of gift! By the way, I don't think washing instructions are mentioned, but they should be washable as any cotton fabric. They should not shrink, but it might be a good idea not to dry them on high heat, since they most likely are a bamboo rayon.

These headphone have great frequency response from bass to treble. They fit in the ear very well which helps the sound quality. For those who don't need Bluetooth, these provide a great listening experience.

I received this in exchange for a fair review. I was extremely impressed by the fantastic frequency response of these earphones. The bass is very strong and the higher frequencies also come out with great clarity. The charging and pairing were also very easy. It fits very nicely in the ears and comes with extra ear rubbers. These are really well made with nice, tight moisture gaskets. The controls feel very solid. A great choice in earphones!

1:15 Mins This is a beautiful ultrasonic humidifier with the added feature of a changing color display. All you have to do is plug the cord into the base and snap the cord into the slot so it will allow the device to stand properly without wobbling on the cord, plug the transformer into a socket, fill the reservoir with some water(a measuring cup is included), twist the top on, press the left button(that will turn on the color display) and then press the right button to start the mist. To stop it, just press and hold the right button for a few seconds until it turns off. If you press the left button again, it will stop the color change and repeated presses will toggle through the various colors and you can also turn the light off with the left button. The instructions try to explain(in extremely poor English) that there are other standby states, but the on and off states I mentioned should be all you need, so we don't have to try to decode the mysterious English description. This is certainly one of the nicest ultrasonic humidifiers I have seen.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review.

This is a very high quality bath tissue. It consists of three ply(that is one more ply than I ever heard of for bath tissue) and each ply is very thin and the three plies pretty much "dissolve" together. The result is an extremely soft, somewhat thick bath tissue. It has just the right balance between strength and softness. It also has no center tube. I am not a fan of leaving out the center tube. I find it annoying and a waste of the time it takes to get the roll to work. I think it is overkill to think that is a good way to help the environment. But that is just my opinion. Unfortunately, after coming out of the bathroom there was no gorgeous British blond woman asking me if I wanted to go "commando" as in that TV commercial(Cherry Healey is the British woman in the Cottonelle TV commercial). Oh well, I guess this bath tissue can't work miracles.

The first thing you notice when you get this is the very sturdy, heavy duty case with great hardware. The case is also completely covered in decorative paper glued to what seems to be a wood shell. When you open it, it is dazzling! What a fantastic display of markers, pencils, and crayons! There is also a neat package of full sized sheets to color with Minion themes, each sheet being different. The sheets are on sturdy bright white bond paper, so you cannot reuse them. I suggest buying lots of drawing paper for your young artist. Of course, coloring is very popular among adults also these days and this would be good for artists of all ages. The crayons are genuine Crayola crayons and are made in the USA. The pencils are made in Brazil. The set is assembled in Vietnam. I am no longer a kid but I remember my Crayola crayons. In fact, I still have them! So this type of set forms very lasting fond memories.

This set is very pretty and just the right size for a woman. Both the watch and bracelet are 8 inches long when open but can be shortened. Both the watch and the bracelet can be shortened a half inch by just unclasping one section, using no tools. To shorten it further, you need to push pins out with a tool. Only let someone with experience(like a jeweler) do that. If you needed to make it longer, links of one of them may be used to make the other longer. The watch back is a snap-back type so unless you are very experienced, I would not suggest you try to change the battery yourself but should take it to a jeweler who can assure you he will not mar the watch changing the battery(I have had many such bad experiences, including one jeweler who completely ruined my watch!). The crystals really shine brightly and are very tightly mounted so they should be secure. The gold tone also has great luster and looks like real gold. The clasps also work well and are secure. Being from a trusted brand, hopefully, this should last a long time.

My initial experience with this DAW was not good. But after giving it another look(and finding some useful instruction which is scarce), I can see that it has some good features. It is not the easiest DAW to become comfortable with and setting up a midi keyboard was more difficult that any other DAW I have used, but once you learn how to do it, it works. For example, in Ableton, just one click on an icon gives you midi from the computer keyboard, which is nice for setting things up. If you connect a midi keyboard in Ableton, it will most likely work instantly by default. The same is true with Mixcraft and Magix. But here it is much more complicated. To get a keyboard to work, you must select it as in many other DAWs but then you must open the mixer, which is unusual just to set up a midi device. Anyway, after getting through this nonsense, it works. It is still not my first choice in DAWs, but some may like this. It costs more than double Mixcraft but a lot less than Ableton. To download all the supplemental files will take you many hours. I found that very frustrating. I think their server is very slow. I fault this for its lack of ease of use, but the features are there if you are willing to learn them. I would take off a star for excessive complications but it then gains a star for a wealth of supplemental material(more than 30 gigs worth! Have fun downloading that!). This would not be my first choice in DAWs. My first choice is Mixcraft Pro Studio 7 and Ableton Live. I prefer Mixcraft over Ableton not just because it costs so much less, but because it provides the best workflow for my purposes and has all the features I need as well as being very accommodating to plugins. The nearly free(it comes free with some midi keyboards and devices) version of Ableton Live Lite provides excellent features to compliment other full blown DAWs. I like Native Instruments products as well and their free demo version of Kontakt 5 is awesome(the time limit of a session can be easily overcome by simply using a different mapper to compose and then when ready to mix to audio, quickly set up Kontakt 5 and mix down; the same is true using other time limited free plugins)!By the way, unlike many other DAWs, you cannot use this on as many of your computers as you like. You may install it on as many computers as you like but only authorize use for a maximum of five at a time(which most likely will suit your needs). You can always un-authorize a computer so if you get a new computer, you will have no problems. Each time you authorize, your count out of five goes down, and each time you un-authorize, your count out of five goes up; this occurs in the account you set up with Presonus.I am also not very impressed with their Youtube channel. The videos offer some help but often seem more interested in advertising features than actually explaining their use. In fact, the speaker actually says that he doesn't understand some features! Welcome to the club. For example, he mentions setting up keyboards but says he rarely does so and really doesn't explain the entire process. In fact, in his presentation we see his keyboard shows "port not found". The PDF manual is pretty good, though.I should also point out that this is the most unfriendly to third party plugins of any DAW I have used. Supposedly, the 64 bit version will only accept 64 bit plugins. I tried and could not get it to accept one(most third party plugins are 32 bit). The 32 bit version is supposed to accept only 32 bit plugins. I tried a myriad of them and could not get it to accept a single one. Compare this to the 64 bit version fo Mixcraft Pro Studio 7 which will accept both 64 and 32 bit third party plugins. In fact, it is very rare for Mixcraft to refuse a plugin. Plugins are important and this is a serious drawback of the Presonus. Now you know one reason why I prefer Mixcraft. I would say that the Presonus does offer quite a selection of instruments, loops and sounds, so how much of a drawback that is I will leave up to you. I like the ability to use plugins. As far as Ableton goes, it will accept plugins of the bit type of the Ableton version, but I have never had Ableton refuse a normal plugin. Magix also has a very good plugin system. Even LMMS is good with plugins. To make matters worse, it will not accept video formats unless you have QuckTime player, which is a problem for most Windows users. I tried loading an MP4 video and it was rejected. How many obstacles does this program present? This DAW has some nice features that a professional would like, such as nice mastering in the Project view, but I can't see serious professionals going for this, except as an adjunct to their other DAWs(as I do). I am being kind keeping this at five stars.

I received these washcloths in exchange for a fair review. I asked to review them because I have always loved bamboo fabrics, and these have not disappointed me. They are super soft and silky. They are bright white and contain no dyes. Each cloth is 10 by 10 inches. These are so silky, they are too good just to use as washcloths! I might even use them as handkerchiefs! It doesn't mention it on the cloths or the packaging, but these most likely are made using the viscose rayon process, with bamboo as the cellulose source. The viscose process is noted for producing very silky soft fabrics. This would make a great baby shower gift or any other kind of gift! By the way, I don't think washing instructions are mentioned, but they should be washable as any cotton fabric. They should not shrink, but it might be a good idea not to dry them on high heat, since they most likely are a bamboo rayon.

This scanner certainly works very well. The only problem with it is the instruction manual. There is no explanation at all. I didn't think it was worth taking a star off for that, though. Basically, you don't have to do anything to set this up. You just plug it into your computer. It will input a character string from a UPC symbol the same way your keyboard would if you typed the character string in. So, for example, if you are at Google.com and the prompt is in the search bar, just scan a UPC symbol(you have to pull the trigger while you point at it) and the character string represented by the UPC symbol will be placed in the search bar and Google will look up the product for you. I found that Google actually does a far better job that sites labelled, "UPC Database". Every time I tried a UPC database, it returned that the item was not in the database. Every time I used Google, it gave the correct result. So, all you probably need is the default settings. Also, when I plugged it in, there was no setup screen or anything like that. Just nothing. It just worked. I am using Windows 10 and the driver loaded instantly; there was no noticeable load period(I was looking out for that). If you are an expert with UPC scanners, I suppose you will have no problems. If you are a beginner, as I am, you will have to do some research(like reading this and other reviews!). So, now I know a little about UPC scanners. Of course, it would be so nice if a real instruction manual was supplied written in proper English, but I suppose that is too much to ask for. After all, after spending years to develop a fine product, why bother taking a few days to find someone who speaks proper English to write a complete manual? Seems pointless.I should also mention that this will only read linear(called 1-D) UPC symbols, it won't read 2-D symbols(those funny looking ones that look like strange postage stamps).I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review. I sure hope they are not sorry! Well, it isn't so bad, all things considered!

I enlisted the assistance of the women in my family for this review. First of all, the material is very stretchy, being 7% spandex(the product page says 6% but the product label says 7%; the label is printed on the fabric, there is no tag) and wears very cool, having a special weave similar to a waffle weave. This gives a very comfortable, accurate fit. They are not all that low-rise, actually wearing just above the hipbone. The waistband and leg-opening edges are very flat, minimizing panty lines, but these are not panty-line free. These are a great quality at a reasonable price, exactly what you would expect from Fruit Of The Loom.

Being the only disc on Hayden lieder, we are very lucky to have one so robust and gorgeous! Anne Cambier sings with an angelic vocal quality and an informed interpretation. Jan Vermeulen plays the fortepiano with great sensitivity and accuracy, giving us an equally great interpretaion, blending wonderfully with the singer. He plays on a reproduction by Chris Maene of Brussels built in 2000. It has an uncharacteristically light, charming quality, midway between a piano and harpsichord, very appropriate for this kind of chamber work. Included lieder are those originally written in German and English and sung as such(recall that Hayden spent a few years in England, so English was not strange to him). This is an essential addition to any lieder collection!I was able to obtain this brand new for under six dollars from a source other than Amazon.com. If you search, you should find it.

These are really gorgeous! They look real from both far and close up. The stones are very well cut and well set. The post is off center so you can wear them either high or low(low is the usual). The keeper slides onto the post and is held in place by rubber inside the keeper(you don't see the rubber unless you look inside the tiny hole in the keeper). Many people think cubic zirconia is just cut glass. That is not correct. Cubic zirconia is actually a mineral very similar to sapphire. In fact, jewelers tell me it is extremely difficult to determine whether a stone is sapphire or cubic zirconia(diamond is also hard to tell apart but easier to distinguish from cubic zirconia than sapphire is). It just so happens that cubic zirconia is extremely inexpensive to produce(fortunately for us!). What is important is the cut. The cut decides the beauty. The cut with these produces great fire and beauty.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review.

This is a great compact USB charger. All the latest USB charging technologies are available on this. It is also safe to use any port on any device. You don't have to worry about some device drawing more current than a standard USB port should provide, since each of these ports can handle anything. It is simple to use, just plug it in. There are no further instructions supplied.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review.

I haven't heard better sound coming from any other earbud than this! The bass is very strong but the high frequencies also come out very energetically. It is a very lively sound. These are also among the best looking earbuds and they appear to be extremely well made out of machined metal. They come with additional ear rubbers and a nifty drawstring bag.  The price is also unbeatable.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for a fair review.

Professor Arthur was my teacher and mentor and when he taught me undergraduate mechanics, we went through his book. It is a great book with a well thought out presentation as well as being extremely thorough. It reflects his love of the subject and of teaching, which he continues to do. This is a great book for a well prepared undergraduate student.

I received the yet to be released Series III version of this to review(without cost through the Amazon Vine Program, which requires that I review it), so I thought I would share this with you. One big improvement with the Series III is Bluetooth, so that gives you an additional option. Here is the review I wrote for the Series III which otherwise is functionally the same as the Series II:****************************************************************************First of all, the quality of the sound produced by this system is amazing! It is about as good as it gets. The only improvement would be to get better stereo separation, since the left and right speakers are only as far apart as this device is wide. There are very sparse instructions in the box, only a quick start sheet that tells you to plug it in, download the app(for any type of device including desktop or laptop computers), and that you can use auxiliary input. That is all. There is also a sheet of safety precautions. But once you download the software on your computing device, it will guide you through the setup and if you click on "Help", it will open your browser to the complete PDF manual(all instructions are available in a wide variety of languages) and you can download the manual to your computer if you wish. There are several ways to use this system. You can just use it as computer speakers(some call them monitors) by just connecting it to your computer with a 3.5mm to 3.5mm audio cable(not included). This device draws 150 watts so be sure to plug it in without overloading an outlet. Another way to use it is to connect it to a Bluetooth device. Finally, you can use it with WiFi. If you connect it with WiFi, it can work without turning on any other device as long as you just use one of the six presets. To use a stored library, you must turn on the device that stores the library. This device will NOT store music libraries as a stand-alone. That is one of my criticisms of this. Why couldn't they included some gigs of storage in the SoundTouch system? Of course, you could always load a little MP4 player with a playlist and plug it into the AUX IN port with an audio cable and play a playlist that way, just showing that Bose could have done this internally by including a circuit the size of your thumbnail.  At the moment, I have all six presets set to internet radio stations. For those, the Bose doesn't need any other device other than your WiFi. Another criticism I have is why only six presets? That is very inconvenient. There should be more like a hundred at the very least. This device is pretty heavy, over 25 pounds and it isn't easy to find a place to put your hands to pick it up safely. You must be careful not to place your hand on the cloth covered front when picking it up to avoid tearing the cloth or damaging the speakers. The best way is on the bottom of the sides. It would have been nice if they had handle inserts on the sides to make this easier to pick up. Another omission seems to be setup B. They only explain setup A. I believe setup B is for smaller controlling devices such as smartphones which don't have USB A ports. In that case, you reverse the cable as used in setup A by plugging the USB A end into the Bose and the USB micro end into your smartphone. This might be explained if you download a smartphone app but it certainly isn't in the PDF manual which can also be downloaded directly from Bose.com.In summary, this is a great system with superb sound and a big price tag. Make sure this has the features you want.*************************************************UPDATE(9/13/2015): The Series lll is now available.

These are great, super soft, almost silky, lightweight blankets(they are lightweight as far as blankets go, but heavy as far as general fabrics go). They are also larger than the average baby blanket. These are made from 70% bamboo viscose rayon and 30% cotton. What is bamboo viscose rayon, you ask? It is a type of rayon where bamboo is treated so it dissolves in a chemical solution and then spun into fibers as it solidifies out of solution. That process produces very silky material and bamboo is noted for producing very silky cloth from this process.(Some have complained that it is deceiving to connect this to bamboo since it is so highly processed, but the truth is, it certainly can come from bamboo, so reach your own conclusions.) Is viscose rayon safe for babies? There are differing opinions on this, so I can't tell you it is completely safe. Personally, I would say it is safe "enough". Of course, you can use these for many things other than baby blankets. I am sure you can think of some uses. As far as swaddling babies goes, there are differing opinions on the safety of that process but I am firmly against it. Infants need to explore their limbs and the space they move through for their proper muscular and neurological development. You can use these as baby blankets but to use them as baby straight jackets(that is what swaddling is, in case you didn't know) is not advised. These are very well made in China(the bamboo should have been a clue!).

Reynolds Wrap has been the aluminum foil of choice in my house for decades. With that in mind I decided to give these new Grill and Oven Bags a try. After trying them I am a bit underwhelmed.In the "olden days" to cook in foil you laid out a sheet of Reynolds Wrap, arranged your food, folded up the sides, then folded over the edges to form a pouch. Sometimes you may have to spray the foil with Pam first, but that's not particularly hard to do. The pouch then went in the oven or onto the grill.Now we have these ready-made pouches. First of all, they are somewhat small (10" x 15.5") and are flat. Since they're not pleaded, and don't expand much when you open them, your limited as to the thickness of things that you can put in them. Since they are a bag you fill them (obviously) by sliding the food into the bag through a side opening. That means if you want your fish fillets to come out looking like the picture on the front of the package, with your veggies neatly arranged on the top, it probably won't happen, especially if you have to tip the bag up and add a quarter of a cup of liquid.The size of the bags limits the amount of food you can cook at a time. Another oddity is the instructions that advise you to add "a tablespoon of flour to protect against bursting." Huh?The foil seems thicker than even the heavy-duty Reynolds Wrap, but two layers of foil would accomplish the same thing using the "old-fashioned" method.As expected, using the bags is not as economical as using plain foil. At the time of this writing the cost about $1.20 apiece when purchased here on Amazon.The Bottom LineFor me, there's not enough new and different here to justify the extra expense of these bags over traditional aluminum foil. After trying these I'm convinced the old-fashioned way still works better.

I am always amazed by the reviewers who will evaluate snack items as though they were part of a "healthy diet," and the snack is vilified because it contains "unhealthy" ingredients. These, along with other snack items, when enjoyed occasionally and in moderation aren't going to hurt you any.Now for the prerequisite ingredients check of these snack chips. Nothing strange or unusual or unpronounceable here. Other than the (expected) fairly high sodium levels these aren't all that bad for you.This is a two layered snack chip with a rice layer and a seaweed layer. As expected, the rice doesn't add any flavor. The predominant flavor is, as you might expect, seaweed. If you don't like seaweed you won't like these crackers. They have a nice crisp snap when you bite into them and are crunchy when you chew them. They taste like seaweed with a slightly salty flavor. Overall, I like to flavor and the texture. What's missing, however, is an indescribable "crunch satisfaction" that I get when I eat a more substantial snack such as a corn chip or snack cracker. My mother used to describe this sensation as, "like eating the south wind."Even though the sample I received was well past the "Best By" date of June 15, 2015, the crisps were still crispy, crunchy, and delicious.The Bottom LineThese are crispy, salty, if somewhat insubstantial snacks. If you like seaweed you probably like these.

Like most of the reviewers here, the candy in this selection goes back to my childhood — Hershey's milk chocolate bars, Reese's peanut butter cups, Kit Kat bars, and Almond Joy (when they were made by Peter Paul). These miniature bars are the perfect size for a quick afternoon snack.Normally when I review a food item I carefully scrutinize the ingredients and comment on them. Not so with this assortment. It's candy. I don't expect any healthy ingredients and I really don't care what they're made of. And these are small enough that there is not much room for calories.While some reviewers had problems with the packaging, the bars in my selection were not squashed, melted, broken, or smooshed. The bars that I have opened so far have been perfect. I like the way the box opens up so you can all grab a couple of bars. This would be a good package to put on the receptionist's desk so your clients can enjoy a small treat while they're waiting their turn.I find it hilarious that the Hershey bar is actually divided into four parts. Nits to pick? Okay, there's no Hershey with almonds, and no Mounds bars. Other than that, what's not to like?The Bottom LineIt's hard to go wrong with this assortment of favorites, and the size of each bar is just right for a quick chocolate fix. If you like Hershey products, this is a good choice.

One of the reasons I like my Keurig so much is that I can avail myself to a wide variety of blends and have a different blend every day if I so choose. It also gives me the chance to try new blends such as this one offered by Vine.A quick check of Café Diario's website reveals that they are a Mexican brand that only recently began marketing in the Houston, Texas area, where they serve both the commercial and retail markets. This Classic Blend appears to be their primary product, and is available in several retail formats. Since the K cups don't appear on the website, I'm assuming this is a new format for them.The website advertises a "Fair Trade" logo, but there no further mention of Fair Trade compliance on their website. Normally when a company purchases their coffee to "Fair Trade" standards it is prominently mentioned and used as a selling point. Likewise, there is no mention of "Fair Trade" compliance on the packaging I received.The capsules are standard K cup design (as opposed to the open mesh style cups) which the company states are Keurig 2.0 compatible. I couldn't verify this, as I have a 1.0 machine. All the capsules pierced cleanly and brewed properly.We first tried this coffee using an 8 ounce cup. While brewing there was no discernible aroma, and very little aroma in the cup after brewing.With sugar and half-and-half, my cup was "okay" but it seemed to lack the body that I like in a cup of coffee. The flavor was okay but nothing exceptional. It's very mIuch like the coffee I get at a good diner. There were no harsh, off, or bitter flavors, and there was no unpleasant aftertaste either.Drunk black, as Mrs. Boilermate does, the assessment was similar. Her comment was, "It's okay, nothing special." She said this might be something she would drink at work.Brewed with 6 ounces of water the body was improved some, as was the flavor, but not by much.At the time this review is being written this product is being offered as an Amazon Add-On for about six bucks for a box of 12 cups. At $.50 a cup they are priced at the lower end of the scale, and about right in our opinion.The Bottom LineTo us this coffee tastes like just what it is — standard supermarket or diner coffee. That's not a bad thing, but it's nothing special either. We have gotten used to the richer blends that are regularly available, and while we were pleased to have had the opportunity to try this coffee, it's unlikely to be added to our rotation.

These bags showed up in my Vine queue at just the right time. Less than an hour earlier, Mrs. Boilermate said to me, "Put tall kitchen trash bags on the shopping list." While neither of us is particularly keen on adding extra scents to our environment and our trash goes out often enough so odor is seldom an issue, we decided to give these a try. Besides, as Mrs. Boilermate said, "We can always use them for the cat litter."The Sniff TestI was expecting a fairly strong fragrance when we opened the box and from each bag. However, even held right up to my nose I could barely discern a fragrance, and Mrs. Boilermate said the same. In our opinion, this was a good thing.In UseAs expected, these fit our tall kitchen wastebasket perfectly. We really like the drawstring closure which makes it quick and easy to cinch up the bag for disposal in the outside trash bin. As I noted above, it's hard to tell how much "odor blocking" we get because we change the bag soon after we put something potentially stinky in it.As with their other bags, these Hefty bags are sufficiently strong to handle anything we can throw at them. I can't remember the last time we had a Hefty bag split or leak. That includes at least 20 pounds of "used" cat litter.ValueWhile they are slightly more expensive on a per bag basis then "non-odor blocking" bags, compared to other brands of odor blocking bags, the price is competitive in Prime Pantry, where these bags are listed.The Bottom LineHefty is one of our trusted names in trash bags, and these bags do nothing to sully that reputation. They will continue to be one of the two or three brands that we buy.

I've been using power strips for a variety of reasons for decades. Just like most medications, they are safe when used as directed. If you don't try to overload them they are perfectly safe.This particular power strip appears to be well made with a sturdy metal cover, built in 15 amp circuit breaker, and sliding covers over the outlets. However, it only has a 3 foot power cord that does not have a right angle plug. The back of the power strip is key-holed to allow for wall mounting with your flathead screws. (Most power strips I have ever purchased came with mounting holes but none came with mounting screws. This is not a complaint, but a comment to the reviewers who complained that mounting screws were not included.)When it comes to surge protection, bigger is always better. This power strip provides 1000 joules of protection which even the back of the box tells you isn't that much more than "basic protection." I'm not connecting anything too sensitive to this power strip.UsageThis power strip would be good in a workshop or garage (as depicted on the front of the packaging) where you could plug it into a bench height outlet to expand your available outlets. This would be particularly good for plugging in those countless battery chargers for all those handy battery-powered tools we have, none of which use the same battery.The Bottom LineThis is a sturdy power strip with a built-in circuit breaker and built-in surge protection. However, the surge protection rating is fairly low and the power cord is fairly short. I expect it to find a home on the workbench of my workshop.If I were buying a power strip today, however, this would not be my choice. While this power strip works as designed, in my opinion it is not a very good value for your money. Here on Amazon you can buy several models of power strips with a higher surge rating, more outlets, and varying combinations of the following: USB connections, telephone/fax connections, and coaxial cable connections. Most come with longer cords (some with right angle plugs) all for the same or less money. And even better protection is only a few dollars more.

Unlike most of my food reviews, I did not read either the ingredients nor the nutritional information before trying the product, or even after. It's candy. I don't really care what it's made of. I don't expect any wholesome ingredients or any redeeming social value whatsoever. So, let's eat!These were just what I expected from a chocolate covered caramel, perhaps even a bit better than expected. Make no mistake about it, these are not gourmet chocolates. They're just plain decent tasting supermarket/drugstore confectioneries. The chocolate tastes like the milk chocolate I have come to expect from Hershey's and the caramel interior is smooth and creamy. In fact it was a lot softer than I expected. I was expecting more of the hard caramel. Sometimes when I have milk chocolate or caramel there is a harsh aftertaste in the back of my mouth. Not so with these caramels. Overall this is a fine product.Unlike some of the reviewers, my chocolate covered caramels were fresh (exp. June 2016) and undamaged. Not a single squished candy in the bag.The only complaint I have is with the packaging. Not only did I have to cut the nuclear safe bag open with scissors, but I also needed scissors to cut the individual wrappers open. The thick plastic wrapping on each piece had no notches or anything on the ends to allow for easy opening. Maybe that's what is needed to ensure they arrive safely from Mexico. Preppers will appreciate the disaster proof packaging.The Bottom LineThese are delicious sweet treat I would indulge in on occasion. While I wouldn't buy them from Amazon (I don't need 15 bags of these to tempt me.) I will definitely pick up a bag of these or their dark chocolate companions occasionally when I'm in the grocery store or the pharmacy.

I'm a sucker for new razors and electric shavers. Over the years Vine has offered me Remington, Norelco, and Panasonic electric shavers. I've also been offered the original Gillette Fusion Proglide, King of Shaves, and the Gillette Fusion Proglide Flexballl razors. And I have grabbed them all. So when Vine offered these new BIC Flex 3 razors, how could I resist?I have also learned from these trials. When used for shaving cream, the Norelco shaves as close as a blade, and the Gillette Fusion Pro Glide really is the best razor on the market, price not withstanding.So, how do these new BIC razors stack up?Once I broke into the nuclear safe packaging and extracted one of the razors I was surprised by how lightweight it was. Compared to the Gillette and my Schick Quattro Pro razors, this one is not only lighter but the handle his about an inch shorter. The handle is smooth plastic with grippy over mold to make handling easier. The shaving head (the bit that holds the blades) is about the same size as other three blade razors.The GoodI like the little slide on cover that each razor has. This makes it easy to toss one of these into your shaving kit for an overnight stay away from home.For my first shave I lather up with my trusty badger brush and my favorite Musgo Real shaving cream. While lightweight, the handle is well shaped and the grippy over mold is in the right places. The shorter handle is not an issue. Maneuvering is easy and I can get into the tight places like under my nose. While not "Gillette smooth" the first shave is acceptable. My face definitely knew the difference, however, and a soothing after shave was a must.The BadThe very first thing I notice is, unlike other multi-blade razors, shaving cream does not pass through the spaces between the blades, but clogs them up. This razor is extremely hard to clean. While the back of the razor is fairly open it does not "back flush" when you try to flush it with water from behind.By the third shave I'm already noticing a lot of "pull" and "drag" with this razor.As with any disposable razor, there is considerably more waste from one of these as opposed to a single disposable cartridge for any razor of any brand. To me that's a big issue.The Wife TestIf you read my other razor/saver reviews, you will see that The Wife Test is an important part of any evaluation of a new shaving product. I shaved half my face with this BIC razor, and the other half with the Gillette razor with a cartridge that had been used about three times. When Mrs. Boilermate compared the two sides, the Gillette side was deemed smoother every time, and considered to be "less scritchy" two days later.ValueAs I write this, these razors cost about $1.25 each (in a package of eight) here on Amazon. By comparison, a Gillette Fusion Pro Glide cartridge will set you back between three and four dollars each, depending on the size of the package and how lucky you are to find a sale. So these are clearly a less expensive option.ConclusionCompared to the Pro Glide, these razors cost considerably less. The quality of the shave is acceptable but not up to the Gillette standard I have gotten used to. I don't expect to get more than 4 or 5 shaves out of each one, and then I have to toss the whole razor, which is a considerable waste. Also. it clogs easily and is difficult to clean. While I don't hate the BIC Flex 3, I don't like it enough to make it my everyday razor. But if I was away from home without a razor there is a good chance I would choose one of these to "tide me over" until I got home.

Mrs. Boilermate Says:This cream has a pleasant scent that fades quickly. With continued use, my skin feels softer, and less dry.  It also appeared to reduce any redness and lessen the wrinkles around my eyes.I gave this four stars because of the price. I am not convinced that a lotion with a more moderate price would not work just as well. I will continue to use this moisture gel cream, but I will probably not replace it when I run out.

I first purchased this peanut butter alternative because it was more reasonably priced than those made with sunflower seeds, almonds, cashews, etc.The label says, "Tastes just like peanut butter" and many of the reviewers here have agreed. Always the contrarian, I will respectfully disagree with that assessment. I did a side-by-side comparison between Wow Butter and Jif creamy peanut butter, and while I like Wow Butter, there are distinct differences. First of all Wow Butter has a slightly thicker and drier consistency, as well as a slightly grainy mouth feel. While the taste is somewhat reminiscent of peanut butter, there is a distinct roasted soybean flavor particularly at the front end. That is not a bad thing, however. While I like the flavor and consistency of Wow Butter, Mrs. Boilermate doesn't care for it.I also compared this product side-by-side with our other peanut butter alternative, SunButter. As I noted in my review of SunButter, compared to peanut butter, SunButter has a thinner, runnier consistency but has the same smooth mouth feel as peanut butter. This assessment applies to Wow Butter vs SunButter as well.The Bottom LineI like WowButter and will put it into my rotation. The good news is, since Mrs. Boilermate doesn't care for it, I don't have to share.

I was looking for an LED equivalent to replace conventional 7 W incandescent night light bulbs. All the bulbs I found prior to this had such a low light output that they were virtually worthless.These bulbs look like a conventional night light bulb and are just as bright. The only reason for getting four stars is because they can't be used in night lights with photocells. As a result, I have to buy some new night lights to replace my photocell units, but that's a small price to pay to be able to use the bulbs.

I am generally not in favor of unitaskers, but sometimes a dedicated gadget can make a potentially messy job faster and neater. This is one of those gadgets.We purchased this pitter to process 3 pounds of fresh cherries. Working as a team, Mrs. Boilermate removed the stem and placed the cherry, stem end up in the pitter that I held over a stainless steel bowl. I pushed out the pit into the bowl, and dumped the pitted cherry into another bowl. We had all 3 pounds of cherries pitted in about 20 minutes. There were no missed pits or mashed cherries and no fingers permanently stained red.This pitter was comfortable to hold and use, and the action was smooth. The little shield around the bottom of it contained what little juice squirted out during the pitting process and there was no mess on the surrounding counter.While you can put this in the dishwasher, I just went ahead and washed it by hand. The little shield twists off and cleans easily with a bottle brush. I like the fact that it has a lock to keep it closed for when we stash it in the junk drawer.If you do larger amounts or pit more often it may be worthwhile to spring for a higher volume pitter such as this one. But for the occasional job, this OXO pitter is fast, neat, and easy.If you only have a small amount of olives or cherries to pit this is the gadget to buy! Highly recommended!

I've been a fan of the Obus Forme back support for years, and have relied on it to give me rigid back support in my recliner. But I also need lumbar support, and the only thing I didn't like about the original version was that the lumbar support was a small separate pillow that stuck on the back with Velcro. I never could get that small pillow positioned correctly so it provided any support.The adjustable pneumatic inflatable lumbar support is the perfect addition to the original Obus Forme. The lumbar support adjusts easily and then stays in place once it's adjusted. It inflates with a small hand bulb that is then stored in a little pocket on the side of the back support. I've had this one for about two months and the lumbar support has not leaked out any air.This support is about 18 inches at its widest and narrows to about 12 inches at the top. That may not seem like much, but I'm one of those full figured guys and I have no problem getting comfortable using this.The Bottom LineIf you need a good solid portable back support you can't go wrong with this one. Yes, it's a bit pricey but, as they say, "You get what you pay for." The first one I bought lasted almost 20 years, and I expect a similar lifespan out of this one. At the present time, this model cost quite a bit more than the original model here on Amazon. In my opinion, it's well worth the extra cost.

About 20 years ago I decided to convert my kitties from run-of-the-mill store-bought dry cat food to a healthier brand. I tried them all: Iams, Science Diet, Eukanuba, Nutro, and Royal Canin. Of all the brands, Nutro was the only one that they would eat, and that's what I have fed my kitties ever since. I immediately noticed a reduction in the waste in the litter box, so at least some of the claims were accurate.In the intervening years more "healthy" brands have hit the market, but Nutro has kept 10 kitties healthy and happy in those years. At this time we have a 10-year-old male, a three-year-old female and a two-year-old female. Their normal kibble is NUTRO MAX CAT Indoor Adult Roasted Chicken Flavor nuggets, which is dispensed in an automatic feeder, so they can eat anytime of the day or night.With that in mind, I was pleased to have the opportunity to try this cereal free variety of Nutro. To test it, we placed a bowl full of this food next to their feeder and kept an eye on it. Given the choice, all three kitties eat from the bowl with this new variety first, and only ate their normal variety when this bowl was empty.This food is made in little rabbit turd sized pallets, as opposed to an extruded shape of their regular diet. This also seems to make a difference. With the regular food, when they crunch it about half that turns into crumbs that they leave in the bottom of the bowl, only eating it when there's nothing else left. With the small round shape of this test food they seem to be able to eat it all without making any crumbs.With three kitties, including an 18 pound male, cost has to be factored in when selecting a cat food brand or flavor. At the time of this writing, a large bag (16 pound) of the Indoor Adult Formula is about $25 here on Amazon. A large bag (only 14 pounds) of this cereal free variety cost $38. That's enough of a difference for us to keep using this as our regular variety.The Bottom LineThis is a first rate premium brand cat food that all three of my kitties like, to the point of choosing it over their regular brand. But at this time it cost almost a third more than what were feeding them now. If cost is not an issue for you, I highly recommend this variety.
