I was surprised that it actually still works with the Samsung wireless charger. The only downside is losing the s-view window, but I knew that before I ordered it. While I may not use this case every day, it is a great option when I want to fully protect the phone since the case is magnetized or if I want to only carry my phone and leave my wallet behind. Overall, a great deal at this price.

This is a great headset for gamers. I have never used the Afterglow brand, but I will in the future for sure. The headset is adjustable so it fits comfortably, and that includes over the ears. You can wear these for hours without them bugging you, something that can rarely be said about most headsets. They have noise canceling built in, which is a nice touch. The sound quality is of course important, and you will not be disappointed with Afterglow. While it may not be a Bose headset, it's not meant to be. For gamers, this is a great headset.

Hasbro usually makes decent toys, but this is not one of them. This is very cheaply made and does not do the Transformer name justice. I would advise you to buy a different toy, even if it is smaller. This may be big, but it's not something your kids will enjoy playing with.

This cat fountain is replacing a non-fountain but larger water bowl / reservoir. My first impression is that this is quite smaller than my original water unit. It holds 100 ounces, but I guess my other one held 250 or so. I only have 1 cat now so it should not be an issue. The fountain is easy to setup as the filters are already in place. You just fill it up and plug it in. The box says it comes with additional filters, but mine did not. However I doubt I will use the filters anyway because I usually fill up the water from the kitchen sink which is already filtered. Your cat may take a little while to decide to drink from it, mine took a bit but now is fine. I do wish it held more water, so keep in mind that it's fine for 1-2 cats, but if I had moe cats or a dog I would get something a little bigger.

As an IT person, I am always fascinated with true tales of this kind of hi-tech crime. It is truly sobering to realize how much of this goes on every single day, and this book is most likely just a grain of sand in a beach of crime. The author did a great job of telling the story, and while it may not get many reads due to its technical subject, it should be a must read book for any CEO or IT person. I would say all the politicians need to read this book as well, but we all know the likelihood of that. Great job Mr. Hall.

I usually buy the cheap stuff at Dollar General, and had never heard of this brand. I was impressed by it's softness and strength. It is similar to name brand paper that cost a lot more. If you have a large family, buying it in this larger package is an easy way to save money and time,

I use similar cards in my Canon 6d camera and also for some game cameras as well as transferring files on my Windows 10 laptop. On the Windows 10 laptop, the card took about 3 seconds for Windows to configure it using the "driver". It was already formatted out of the package and has about 59GB of free space on it.Write Speed: On my Windows 10 laptop it copied a 750MB file in about 10 seconds and averaged about 48MB per second.Read Speed: When copying from the card back to my hard drive it averaged over 100MB per second and sometimes as high as 750MB per second when filing the temporary memory (I assume).Overall, it is a Class 10 card that performs as expected. Just be aware that the speed on the card is the Read speed and not the write speed.

If you are a caramel lover, these Lancaster caramels will have you eating dozens in no time. They are very good, truly soft and will honestly melt in your mouth. This 2.25 tin is a lot of candy (more than it sounds like) so hopefully you have some help eating them or your doctor and dentist both might have something to say. Seriously, the candy is great and reminds me of old fashioned caramels that were soft and sweet. The packaging is nice enough to give this as a gift to a friend or neighbor. I have no complaints at all, but of course I love candy :-)

I usually wear a 10.5 EE in boots and shoes. My current Justin Boots are my usual size. I ordered these Ariats at the same size, and they are more like a regular 9 or something. Way too small and way too narrow. Not sure why the size difference, but I am unwilling to take a chance on another pair. They are "free" to return but still a pain to have to drop it off at UPS, print label, etc...

This is a good game camera that takes quality photos. The menu is kind of clunky, but you figure it out pretty quick. That is probably something they should work on in the future. The quick start is just that - but I don't see it as a big deal as using the regular start takes about 10 seconds to configure my options. The photos and videos are good for the price, and while it's not perfect as far as IR and Motion go, it's good enough for this price range. If you are looking for perfect IR and longer range motion detection, you will have to spend a lot more money!

If you are into Internet Music streaming such as Itunes, Pandora, etc this system will be 5 stars to you in my opinion. I don't often use those services, so the bluetooth connection was a must have for me. That being said, this is a bit of overkill for a bluetooth only system, but since I got it for review it's not that big of a deal to me. I have used it with some of the streaming services and it works great. The wifi setup was easy and the connection has been fine. The sound is Bose quality (which I expected) and you won't be disappointed. I think it would have been 5 stars is they had included some small storage space to store some music locally - storage is cheap these days so I would have like to have seen at least 16GB of on board music storage capability.

I really like this business classic Lucien Piccard watch. It is easy to set the time and operate due to it's simplicity. The watch looks great with almost anything from a full blown suit to a weekend wear jeans and t-shirt. Very classy and priced right. The suggested retail price is a joke - I do think they should get rid of that or at least make it a bit more reasonable. You are not really saving 500% on this watch!

The food looks fine to me, but my Cat doesn't like it. Not sure why, she tried a bit but just wouldn't eat anymore of any flavor. She does like the other Nutro food I have given her, so maybe she doesn't like the texture of this...not sure.

I'm usually an Tylenol pill type of person for headaches, but the quick relief aspect of the product was something I was looking forward too. Goody's is a big brand and I've seen there products in the pharmacy but never tried it.The Good - The pain relief does seem faster than a normal pill (which makes sense). If you already take something similar but want quicker pain relief, this will get the job done.The Bad - Oh that taste. It may be a new formula or improved formula but to me the stuff does not taste good. It's not as terrible as some other medicines, but it's not something you want to ingest without having a glass of water handy to wash it out of your mouth with!

I'm usually an Ibuprofen pill type of person, but the quick relief aspect of the product was something I was looking forward too. Goody's is a big brand and I've seen there products in the pharmacy but never tried it.The Good - The pain relief does seem faster than a normal pill (which makes sense). If you already take something similar but want quicker pain relief, this will get the job done.The Bad - Oh that taste. It may be a new formula or improved formula but to me the stuff does not taste good. It's not as terrible as some other medicines, but it's not something you want to ingest without having a glass of water handy to wash it out of your mouth with!

I grew up and always enjoyed playing monopoly as a child. It was one of the special games that when family got together (and had time) the kids would break out monopoly and spend hours trying to bankrupt each other. The last time I played the original was a few years ago, and I haven't played many of the newer editions of Monopoly.  This Here and Now version is almost like a brand new game to me. It has some similar characteristics to the original but most of it has changed. However they have done a great job of changing the game play and strategy. Overall, this newer version is a different game but still quite enjoyable to me. If you enjoyed the original, you will also enjoy this one, just in a different way.

First, this watch is absolutely beautiful. It does have a fairly big watch face so if you are not into those, you may want a different model. The photo on Amazon showing the watch face on the wrist is quite accurate. This must be a newer model because the original instructions don't show how to set all the options on this watch (the new options on this watch are the date and 2nd time feature). However they have included a 1 page instruction sheet specifically for this model. Even with that, it may take yo a few minutes to figure out how to get all 3 set correctly. The watch comes in a fancy looking box so if you are buying this for a gift, it can easily be presented in the box it comes in. It truly does look like a watch that should cost over $500 if that kind of thing is important to you. It is water resistant so no worries about washing hands with this watch, but don't go swimming with it or have it on in the shower! Overall it is a nice quality watch that looks great (and looks more expensive that it really is) and functions wonderfully.

This is truly a toy that will inspire your child to increase their mechanical skills and imagination while they have a load of fun. I think the minimum age is around 5 years old, but to be honest I don't see a maximum age as even I was having fun while building it and playing with it! It has lots of movement and should provide for many hours of enjoyment for your kids.

This is a good toy for toddlers, and although it does not function great as a learning toy, it does provide fun with pushing buttons and making noise. For the price, it is a good value...meaning it may only last you one kid and is probably not something that is going to be around to be passed on to the younger siblings.
The dog seems to enjoy it, and while it is more expensive that what is normally used, I think the Nutro brand is a good brand and worth the extra money if you can afford it.
My cat likes this so far...I am also using the Chicken flavor and she likes that as well. It is pricey compared to other brands, but if it is healthier for her, it's a price I am willing to pay.

My cat has enjoyed this Nutro cat food. It is expensive compared to others and I am currently trying out many different brands, but she likes this one. I will update this review once the bag is finished, but so far so good.

This was an okay book, but wasn't quite what I was expecting. I really expected a lot more text regarding the Codex itself. It is a fast paced action book with plenty of booms and bangs if you are into that sort of thing. If you are looking for a fictional history story that has some action, you won;t find it here. You will find a pretty decent action story about terrorism and extremism that has a small part of fictional history included.

My first piece of advice upon receiving this item is to make sure you calibrate it correctly!  It will take a few minutes, but the data is almost worthless if you don't calibrate it. The amount of data you will be able to record is quite impressive. I would suggest using in during practice sessions alone a few times to understand how it works and the different options. While this type of analysis may seem like overkill to casual players, the price is not bad considering the data and "advice" this device and app can give you to improve your game. However if you are looking for a finished and polished product that will be perfect, I would probably wait for the next generation.

I am using this to replace a slightly slower 32GB card in my Note 4. While it may not make a noticeable difference in speed, it will be nice having all my stuff backed up on a separate sd card that can be changed quickly. I used my laptop with Windows 10 to copy everything over. The card was already formatted fine for my computer and my phone. I am pleased with the card, and the price is amazing considering how much this much storage cost only a few years ago.

I don't normally use body wash, but I liked the moisturizing effect this has on my skin. The scent is okay - not exactly a totally manly scent, but no too flowery either. If you use a body wash - this one is worth a try. I prefer the Dove Men Bar Soap to this body wash, but I am still old school I guess.

This case is by OtterBox, so you can be sure it provides pretty good protection. I was surprised that it actually looks very good. It doesn't look like an OtterBox case - it looks much more fancy. The case is easy to open and features a multi-position stand. It is very easy to take on and off so if you already use something else when taking your Air 2 out of the house, you will have no issues there. Overall a good buy and an attractive case.

This electric shaver is a good deal for the price. If you have never used an electric shaver before, give it a week to let your skin adjust to it, because it does take some time. The shaver is quite basic, but gives a decent electric shave. Do not expect a razor close shave with the Remington or you will be disappointed. However for emergency use or to keep in the truck, this a good value and will get the job done in a pinch.

I really wanted to like this case because of the protection it offers. Dust proof and water proof sound great in theory. However, once the case is installed there are two big issues with it.- Speaker is a muted quite a bit with the case on. This can have a big effect in certain situations.- The screen protector feels quite cheap and seems to cause some issues with touch, etc..If you are needing this for a specific reason - say you will be near water or in a dusty environment, it is probably great for those instances. However as an everyday case I think the trade off is not worth the benefits.

I usually have a hard time drinking water because I prefer either Sweet Tea, Cokes, or even Lemonade (with sugar!).I have also tried all the Crystal Delight water additives, etc...  I have even tried numerous so called "Lime" water and they are always "carbonated water" which to me tastes like a fountain drink where the syrup has run out. So, I happened to run across this product and figured I would risk $10 to try it. First, I am using 1 packet to a 16 ounce bottle of water (Nestle Pure Life aka the Cheap Stuff). While the Lime is not very strong using 1 packet, there is enough taste that I actually enjoy the water. I have gone from drinking almost no water a day to 4-5 bottles a day. Yes, I still indulge in soft drinks and sweet tea occasionally, but I figure every time I use my water instead is a small victory and better for my health. It's only been about a week, but so far I am really loving this product.

I bought this laptop for my mother over 2 years now and it is still gong strong. The battery still has good life and everything still works like it did when I got it. I am impressed with HP. I used to have Dell laptops, and they would usually not last this long without something going wrong. I had also purchased my own laptop around the same time and it is still going strong too.

I have owned this laptop for over 2 years now, and recently upgraded it to Windows 10. My battery still has good life and everything still works like it did when I got it. Sure, it's not the fastest thing around anymore (far from it) but since it has lasted this long, I am impressed with HP. I used to have Dell laptops, and they would usually not last this long without something going wrong. I had also purchased my mother a different HP laptop around the same time and it is still going strong too.

This case looks great - it has genuine leather that gives in a high quality finished look. I always like the S-View cases because of the screen protection, and while this is not the same (no window on front) it does the same thing. It provides great protection since it covers the screen while it is in your pocket or purse. This case also features a slot you could use to hold your license and credit card (it's not big so it won't replace your wallet!). Overall, I really like the case.

This case looks great - it has genuine leather that gives in a high quality finished look. I always like the S-View cases because of the screen protection, and while this is not the same (no window on front) it does the same thing. It provides great protection since it covers the screen while it is in your pocket or purse. This case also features a slot you could use to hold your license and credit card (it's not big so it won't replace your wallet!). Overall, I really like the case.

This is my first experience with the Home Styles brand, and I have been impressed. I expected it to be somewhat nice considering the price, but it was much better than I thought. First, it is pretty heavy - not your home improvement store type furniture that falls over easily. It also happens to look great with nice color and metal. It looks more expensive than it is, so if that is important to you, you will like it.  It does take about 20 - 25 minutes to put it together and you will need a few tools, but it's not rocket science. I am very happy with the functional side of this wine rack as well as the aesthetics.

This is the gold standard in phone protection. Yes, you trade off size and weight among other limitations when having this type of case. However if you are more concerned about protecting your phone then about losing a few features, this rugged case provides top quality protection.  If you find that you don't like the weight or other aspects of this case for daily carrying, it is still a good investment to protect your phone when you go out running, hiking, or anything else that might be a "danger" to your phone. While it may seem expensive, with the price of smartphones these days, it is good insurance.

If you have anyone in your family with heart disease, you will be interested in this book. The history of cardiovascular surgery is absolutely stunning in regards to the flat out "trial and error" without any oversight era. It may sound hard to believe and gruesome today, but in those days doctors and hospitals didn't need FDA approval to try something new. This was probably a good thing at the time as now it takes a long time to actually get permission to try something "crazy" that could potentially save many lives. Forrester covers a lot of the history of heart surgery. The chapters on war time surgery were very interesting as doctors were put in an almost impossible situation and forced to do whatever they could. Some of the names in the book you will recognize if you have read any other books on the same subject. It is a truly fascinated read and some of the characters were quite colorful.

This VTech Baby Monitor is a good option for monitoring your baby via video.  Setup is quick and easy, and the menu is fairly straightforward to use so you may not even need the manual. The pan & tilt is a nice option if you have never had that before. The battery on the parent unit seems to last quite a long time before it needs to be charged. Overall, this is a good option for a video monitor for your little one.

I have always loved Otterbox for the protection they give. This series is lacking screen protection of any kind, and while the back and side protection is what I expect from Otterbox, I think the price is too high when compared to other products. They should have thrown in some type of a screen protector at this price, even if it was a minimal one. If you are looking for a slim case that protects the back and sides, this will work great, but if you need full protection, either choose a different style such as Defender or choose a different brand.

I used this product on my finger at the knuckle joint where my skin was dry it had cracked and would bleed daily. I had previously tried regular moisturizing lotion, but to no avail. After a few days with this TriCalm Cream, I am seeing results. If you have tried other products that have not worked for your dry skin condition, this is one worth trying.

This little set is a lot of fun for the young ones (2-4 years old). It has a remote control which is simple to use to fit the age group, and the track is long enough to keep their interest. You will want to buy another RC car though because kids (specially boys) will want to race them and the set only comes with 1 car. The fun features include the track building and for the younger ones the noises as the car passes certain points on the track. It is fun and should keep them entertained for a while.

I wear boot everyday, and it's important that a sock not only be comfortable, but that is stays up.  While these socks are comfortable, they do not stay up very well and by the end of the day have fallen down quite a bit. I would suggest instead the Fox River Adult Military Maximum Over-The-Calf Wick Dry Mid-Calf Boot Socks. I have had better luck with them.

"I bought a Grumpy Cat shirt off Amazon once.  It was awful!"GRUMPY CAT! Does it get any better than Grumpy cat? I mean, really!In all seriousness - it's a great quality shirt.  It is a nice, thick material, yet is breathable so you can really wear it anytime you want. The material is very durable so it will hold up through many washing/wearing cycles. There was no shrinking after washing it either which is great.  The sizing really does stay true to size - it was a perfect fit when it came.Keep it for yourself - give it to a friend - give it to an enemy because you hate them.  No matter what you do with it - GET IT. EVERYONE needs more Grumpy Cat in their lives. If they tell you they don't - cut them loose. You don't need that kind of negativity in your life!Discount received for review purposes.

I didn't even realize when I ordered these that there was a little gem in the ear buds themselves. HOW CUTE!The sound quality of these are actually quite nice. The bass is pretty good.  I listen to music all the time - cleaning, walking, 4 wheeling, laying outside. I always have ear buds in it seems.  These are really comfortable to wear for long periods of time.  I love that they have the built in mic too - so I can answer calls while using these if I need to.  Most often I don't need to - but it's nice to have that option.Overall I really like these! I would recommend them. Discount provided for review purposes.

I think I must have a big head because whenever I buy headbands, they always feel really tight to me.  That was the very first thing I noticed about these headbands - they are not tight at all! Don't get me wrong - it isn't because they were too big.  They are just a really nice stretchy material - but not an elastic "tight" stretchy if you know what I mean.  The material itself is extremely nice.  They are super soft - and are very light so if you use these while working out, running, walking, whatever it might be, they still breathe and don't cause your head to get all sweaty.There are so many different uses for these as well.  My husband and I recently splurged and bought a pair of 4 wheelers.  Needless to say I am quickly learning about dirt and dust in the face.  These double as a really nice face guard as well. Again, the material is thin enough to still be able to comfortably breathe through - but keeps all that dirt and dust out of my mouth and nose.  that being said - the fact that I could put them on my face - I did not have a bad chemical smell with mine when they arrived.  I did wash them right away just because I tend to do that with new clothes or anything that I am going to have touching my face - but they didn't need it due to smell.  They did hold up really well through the washing a drying process as well. I'd recommend them for sure!Sample provided for review purposes

This scarf is absolutely adorable.  It was even more cute when it arrived than I expected it to be! A lot of the scarves I own are rather thick and not really something you can wear in the summer.  This has a rather thin, almost sheer quality to it which is really nice.  It is really light and not bulky at all. I couldn't get over how soft it was either.  The material really is nice and not itchy like many other scarves I own.The infinity loop style is one of my favorites. There are so many different ways you can wear them and use them.  It makes this scarf really versatile!  I had a really hard time deciding on a color and may need to come back and re-order because I am still struggling with it. I went with the white with navy anchors - but the pink one is absolutely adorable as well!  this very quickly became one of my favorite scarves that I own! I really love it!Sample provided for review purposes

I don't know if maybe I am just not built for something like this or what - but it doesn't exactly look the best on me.  However, that doesn't really mean it is the maker's fault - just not really my cup of tea I guess. I ordered this in the coffee/wheat color.  The colors themselves are very pretty.  It does seem to be made from a really durable material even though it is see through. I have dogs and cats (the cats especially love trying to chase after me when I have this thing on) I have had plenty of sheer things in the past be ruined because of the dogs or the cats, but this is holding up well even around them.  It is really nice to have to wear around the yard in the summer when laying outside relaxing, or even when going to the beach as a coverup.One of the other reviewers is absolutely right - it is just material with a hole in the middle. That being said - look at all the different options that brings.  This can easily be worn as a scarf as well - it doesn't just have to be a coverup - which is most likely what I will use this for in the long run. Overall it isn't my favorite - but I still really like it!Sample provided for review purposes

I was pretty darn excited to receive this Quadcopter.  My husband and I have wanted to get a drone for a long while - but honestly we didn't NEED one which is why we never put our money into one.  Of course everyone is going to want the biggest and best, but these bad boys can get pretty pricey.  It was nice of one to come along in a very do-able price range.  Definitely a great one for the beginner!It is extremely easy to operate. I was too excited about this to even bother reading the directions before taking it out.  I know it's is a totally different ballgame - but we have had RC helicopters in the past and those things were not only pricey, but hard to operate. I really did question whether or not I would be able to control this and operate it.  I had nothing to worry about.  From the very first use, it is extremely user friendly and pretty much self explanatory in how to run!We have a large, open back yard with a hay field behind it so I didn't have to worry about maneuvering around trees or anything like that.  Once the batteries start to drain down, it slowly becomes less and less responsive, so there were a few crashes.  However, it is built really well and was able to withstand those crashes.My only complaint - THE BATTERY LIFE. It sucks.  Let's just be honest. that is the only thing holding me back from the 5 stars.  I will definitely be looking into getting some additional batteries for this.  I didn't actually time it - and I know this listing says it lasts for 7-9 minutes - but it seemed shorter to me than that.  I would have guessed 5 minutes - maybe. BUT - you get what you pay for too. For the price range this is in - it is definitely better than I expected it to be! Once we get the extra batteries I can see us having a whole lot of fun with this!Sample provided for review purposes

First off let me say that Lightning Guides are great in themselves.  I have two of their books, and I love both of them, even if one of them isn't exactly "my thing".  The other book I have is about Mars - which is right up my alley.  This book I thought would be really great for my husband - but I actually really liked it as well!Him being the car person, I thought I might have to go to him with technical questions while reading this book.  However, it really did a great job with putting everything in to very easily understandable terms.  I have always been more of a Ford person and a Model T is definitely one of my favorite cars.  There is plenty of information in this book on both the Model T and the Ford corporation in general.This book really has everything from the humble beginnings of the automobile to where they may be going in the future. It is so much fun to think about where our vehicles will be in the next 100 years.  Look how far we came in that short time in out past - the future will be crazy!Absolutely a must have book.  Definitely would recommend this! Sample provided for review purposes

I am a complete and total space nerd.  I am interested in pretty much anything having to do with space - and with so much action on Mars lately, I think this book came along at just the right time for me!This book may be small - but it is full of SO much information on Mars.  Everything is in here from what the planet's atmosphere is like, to what a person might expect to encounter being on the planet without a space suit, to the concept of building a colony on Mars.  It even discusses the possibilities that farming on Mars could bring.  How cool is that? Back when I was a kid these ideas were something out of SciFi movies - and now we are discussing REALLY making a one way mission to there?? Insane!I love that this book really spells out all of the history of how the interest in a mission to Mars came about.  There is so much that we already know, but there is so much more than can be learned. Things that can ONLY be learned actually being there.  The Mars Rover was a huge step for us!Excellent little book about Mars!  I would definitely recommend it!Sample provided for review purposes

Being that I had never worked with vinyl before, I was a little bit nervous about trying this for the first time.  Honestly - I really had no reason to be. This vinyl is a great quality vinyl that is extremely easy to work with! While I think the majority if people would be looking at this for their car, I decided that it would be great for my ATV to break up some of the overwhelming blue color.When it arrived, it was packaged nicely and each sheet was wrapped with a clear plastic to keep it wrinkle free during transport.  Prepping the surface is pretty simple to do.  Make sure you clean the surface down really well as that contributes to how the vinyl adheres to the surface.  If you leave dirt or wax behind, this vinyl will not stick nearly as good as with a clean, dry surface. surface prep is definitely one of the most important steps in my opinion.  Also - USE A HEAT GUN.  Don't waste your time with a hair dryer.  buy a good quality heat gun with different temperature settings.  This vinyl responds well to heat, but I don't think a blow dryer would be enough heat. Most often I used the higher of the 2 settings on my heat gun when applying.  The vinyl responded well without burning holes in the vinyl or stretching it too thin.I originally wanted to wrap the entire surface but quickly learned that the curves and edges are pretty tricky.  Perhaps for someone who has more experience with vinyl it would be possible, but it was way out of my abilities being this was a first time use.  I decided to do it in pieces rather one full wrap. Working in the smaller sections was much easier to do! Overall I think I like the look the way I did it over a full wrap.  A car, of course, I would want the full wrap.Once the surface was clean and I had the vinyl cut to the general shape I wanted it, it was time to apply the vinyl.  There is a paper backing on the vinyl.  Tear that off, and for me I found it easiest to start from the middle and work my way out.  Make sure you are working in the proper environment too, away from dust and debris and the right temperature.  If it is too cold, this isn't going to stick as well.  While working my way outward I would heat the vinyl with the heat gun, stretch the material, and use my hand as well as a squeegee to work out any air bubbles and make sure the vinyl sticks firmly to the surface.  If there happened to be a difficult spot or a mistake, it was very easy to pull the vinyl back up, reheat it and re-stretch it, placing it back where I wanted it to be.  I would then come back to trim and cut out the more detailed shape that I wanted once I had the vinyl stuck down where I wanted it. There was absolutely no damage to the surface underneath, and even though it was applied to a plastic ATV body, I would be 100% confident applying it to the surface of a car and not worry about doing damage to the existing paint.I think having this vinyl applied to an ATV really tests the quality.  It is constantly being beat on by rocks and dust, water, and mud.  I have had no chipping or peeling whatsoever.  I don't have to do anything different to clean the surface with this vinyl wrap on it - I simply use soap and water to wash it.  It is holding up really well through everything I have put it through so far. It really is quite impressive! I would highly recommend this for any projects you may be working on.  I could see this being great for covering laptops, cars, video game consoles, pretty much anything your mind can think up!!  I absolutely LOVE it and would HIGHLY recommend it!

I am a lego nut.  It sounds silly considering I am a grown adult, but when I saw these, I HAD to have them.  They are just too much fun!My first attempt at doing anything with these were a complete and total failure.  I think I had high hopes, but didn't really know what I was doing so the problem was mine.  I attempted to use Jello in these.  EEK.  Needless to say - they did not pop out nicely.  Lesson learned - no more Jello for me in these.Then I decided to do ice cubes since, well, they are always necessary and fun.  WOW!  Just wow! Fill them with some water, let them sit for a little bit and you have adorable little Lego men or brick ice cubes!  What a fun idea for a child's birthday party! You could do punch in the trays to have colored and flavored ice cubes to match their drinks and have that fun touch of color.  The ice popped out super easy!I also have done candies and crayons with these, and so far they have worked great! The only fail I had was the Jello, and based on how it handles everything else, I think that was my mistake.  These are super fun, super easy to use, super easy to clean, and just too stinkin' adorable!! Definitely would recommend!Sample provided for review purposes

This has quickly become my go to "toy".  Let's be honest - most women will use it as a vibrator at one point in time or another.  For that - it works freakin' AWESOME!! The 10 different settings really do give you a lot of options depending  on your mood at the time of use. The vibration options range from light to very intense - and holy cow is it ever intense at the highest setting. I love it.I was expecting it to be smaller.  It isn't a bad thing - just bigger than I expected it to be.  It took me a bit to get used to that because it is just - well - big.  That being said - this is the toy that stays in my nightstand drawer right next to my bed.As far as use for tense muscles - it works great for those too. It isn't just a toy.  I have definitely used this on my tense shoulder muscles after a long day at work.  I guess that would be where the power  and size comes in with this - it is powerful enough to even work the tense muscles back to being relaxed.Really great product and I would DEFINITELY recommend.  It is one of my favorites!Sample provided for review purposes.

I don't know why - but I have a thing for the glass toys.  I think they are pretty! Yeah, yeah - I'm a girl. I like pretty things.  Anyway - I really like this little guy! One of the perks of the glass toys is how easy they are to clean and disinfect.  I feel they are a lot more sanitary than their silicone or plastic counterparts.  They can be heated or cooled depending on what you are into - as well as be used as an anal toy if that is what you are into.  The thought of glass might scare some away - but honestly they are not fragile at all.  That being said - you should keep an eye on it for chips or cracks just incase.  I have dropped mine a few times and it held up nicely, so they definitely are strong and not fragile at all.Overall - pretty great toy! Honestly for the price point - it is one of the best.  Try looking at some other glass ones out there and they are extremely expensive. This one is a great value for sure!Sample provided for review purposes

One of the better toys I have tried - which kind of says a lot.  I have a lot of them. *blush*Anyway - the style is very realistic.  The size is nice , and the varying speeds for the vibrations definitely adds to the pleasure from it.You can have it as low or as intense as you prefer.It is very easy to clean and store - something that can easily fit in the nightstand next to your bed.I also like the material.  While it is a silicone type material - it isn't a sticky silicone.  If you have spent any time around toys I think you will know what I mean by sticky.  I have pets so the sticky kinds collect every little hair and piece of fuzz - but this doesn't have that horrible stickiness to it.  You can wash it when done and put it away without it collecting any dirt and hair.  Overall - really nice toy.Sample provided for review purposes.

It was a bit bigger than I was expecting it to be - not necessarily a bad thing since more often than not the reverse is true.  It seems to be well made - there was no overpowering odor to it which I find with a lot of silicone made toys.  The different speeds are a nice addition - and on the highest setting is definitely very powerful.Very easy to clean up afterwards.  One of the downfalls for me is the fact that it is the material it is - because it likes to collect every little hair or piece of fuzz.  I have two dogs and two cats so I definitely need to clean this before use! Overall though - really nice toySample received for review purposes.

I actually really like this waist trimmer belt.  I have been using it during my workouts, and it really helps to support my back while working out, or even just in going about everyday activities while wearing. It helps to improve my posture as well as working at losing some of that stubborn extra weight.The design is great. It is soft on the skin, and fits really well! It is definitely adjustable for all kinds of body shapes and sizes.  I am fairly small, while my husband is more husky - and we can both use this. It is well made with strong stitching so you don't have to worry about it falling apart with heavy use. It will definitely hold up for a long, long time.Overall, really good product! Discount received for review purposes.

We have two dogs - a sheltie and a cairn terrier.  The cairn is a barking machine! Every little noise she hears or THINKS she hears, she goes nuts.  We have had her for 5 years now and I have yet to find anything to help calm her down and stop the barking. So when I was able to get this dog training collar to review, I was willing to try it!It is well made and strong. I could see how this would work great even on big dogs with how strong the collar itself is.  There are different sized electrodes for use with different types of animals.  My sheltie would require a longer one to work through all that hair, where the cairn can use the smaller ones.  You can change the strength of the "shock" as well. I would recommend starting out with the smallest strength and working up from there.  There really isn't any pain with it, more of a surprise to the dog to let them know HEY, this behavior isn't ok. It is easy enough for a younger child and challenging enough for a 7 or 8 year old any age after that it will be quite easy!

This was a really enjoyable game challenging enough that the adults enjoyed playing and easy enough that a four year old could play and have a great time as well. whether you were a fan of the film or not. The game play is addictive, great to sit down and play in short bursts, It starts out very strong, but quickly falters due the constant repetition in the game-play. Also features a co-op mode which makes it a great game to play along with the kids.

This was a fun play graphically not the greatest but the game play is impressive and the play by play is a step up from previous years! Not the biggest hockey fan but have always enjoyed the games and this one was great!

Really great graphics on this one, fun game play the character is a super being set in the very real city of Seattle in an open world game play. Only drawback was it was exceptionally easy to beat and far to short for my liking. The open world format does allow for an extension of the game.

Once you master the controls this is a really fun game I really like playing in creative mode with my 4 year old he gets a kick out of destroying anything I attempt to build. I really like games that push the imagination and this is one of them from creating your own personal worlds to exploring worlds made by other users although you do have to be careful with online game play with little ones. I highly recommend this game for all ages.

A great family game love playing this one with the kids, and they are pretty fond of it as well same basic lego theme as the other games but here you get to play and batman and robin along with a slew of other great characters. These games have had the added benefit of rousing a love of building blocks in my 4 year old has really help build his imagination. What can I say it is batman and lego pick up a copy and get building!

This is a fantastic zombie slash and shoot game, even after beating the game there is still so much to unlock and do, the Easter eggs are an added bonus. Features a nice story Bi-line, as well as the ability to craft and build your own weapons and supplies is a nice touch. The game is a bit graphic, so maybe not for the younger crowd but teenagers to adults will really enjoy this game.

Great game play very challeging and easy to catch on to the controls! Really enjoyed the graphics and story line. Awesome selection of weapons and the carnage is so authentic with enemy's losing limbs from Katina chops.
this is my sons new favorite game, The graphics are great. The story line is awesome as well. Keep his attention for a good amount of time and its always his go time game. very entertaining.

Best game since The Last of Us and Far Cry 3!  amazing story line grips you till the last minute, very emotional and compelling,Gorgeous graphics Best story line i have ever played,I actually got emotional. This is one of the finest first-person-shooter games I've ever played

Eager for some new low-budget high fantasy, I ordered a Blu-ray version from Amazon's UK site for dirt cheap. Chagrintastically, I then discovered this film already in my collection under a different name, so...As a public service announcement, let's clear up any confusion right here:(original title) -- SAGA: Curse of the ShadowUK (English title) (DVD box title) -- Rise of the Shadow WarriorUSA (alternative title) (English title) -- Curse of the Dragon SlayerUSA (alternative title) (English title) -- Dragon Lore: Curse of the ShadowUSA (English title) (new title) -- SAGA: Curse of the ShadowWorld-wide (alternative title) (English title) -- SAGA: The Shadow CabalIf I were feeling cynical this evening I would say a crafty filmmaker changed the name around to cause absentminded geeks like me to purchase the same flick twice. Maybe it was changed to have "dragon" in the title because "dragon" is a choice marketing term for this genre, but then they got sued by somebody and changed the name back to something about shadows?Below, I'm just going to refer to it as "Curse" (short for "SAGA: Curse of the Dragon Lore Slayer Shadow Cabal," or alternatively, "Curse of the Many-named Movie").So is it worth watching? That depends on your viewing needs. Here are some details:*Cinematography*OUTSTANDING. Somebody cut their teeth with Curse, and Hollywood may take notice and scoop up the talent involved. Granted, Utah is intrinsically beautiful, but it still takes talent to scout out the perfect spot and to use camera angles that will make the most of natural splendor. The topography caught on film is lavishly varied, with forests, wetlands, and plenty of mountainous terrain. Going above and beyond the call of duty for a B movie, they even bothered to do some underwater scenes (featuring mermaids who curiously wear bikini tops made of synthetic material). On top of this, serious color grading during postproduction resulted in saturated landscapes and artificial darkness to provide for an otherworldly vibe.*Actors*"They cursed the wrong elf, and they're going to regret it," says Nemyt Akaia. Because she is just so damn telegenic that I don't want to imagine this flick without her, I'm reluctant to admit that Danielle Chuchran as the elf named Nemyt was perhaps miscast. According to IMDb, Danielle was "born in Upland, California but moved to Utah shortly after." Upland is dangerously close to actual Valley Girl territory, and at times you can't help but think of Nemyt Akaia as being a California elf. Anyway, she was competent in her scenes, and there's something oddly alluring about a girl like that who can spit so well (her elf spits at whomever she's currently disgusted with, which changes frequently). According to the final credits she had a body double, but humorously she also served as a "Booty Double" for the treacherous mermaids.I will be seeking out Danielle Chuchran in leading roles elsewhere, and I selfishly hope that she doesn't gain fame and leave the B movie circuit.Curse was Richard McWilliams' screen debut, and Richard did very well indeed as the protagonist Keltus the Wanderer.Paul D. Hunt, who already had experience on the screen, also brings life to Curse as the frenemy orc Kullimon the Black, and he deserves extra credit for wearing what must have been uncomfortable facial prosthetics.The stunning Bailee MyKell Cowperthwaite (she'll need to change her name if she wants to be a starlet) plays the prophetess, although by "plays" I mean she stands there looking solemn (nice work if you can get it) while another woman does her telepathic voice. Come to think of it, Bailee looks more like she belongs on the cover of Vogue than in a movie overflowing with orcs.*Plot / Script*Not mind-bending in the least, but if we're going to be charitable we can say it goes beyond simplistic and keeps the audience engaged. I'm just glad there was no actual ring involved, keeping Curse from being The Frenemies of the Ring (since it borrows so much from FotR already). The dialogue was written by two dudes who make it abundantly clear that Curse is concerned with genre and cinematography over launching the career of a screenwriter.*Soundtrack*A bit grandiloquent for a B movie, but I'd rather hear ambition than afterthought. Well done.*Special Effects / CGI*Hit or miss, but mostly adds to the credibility of Curse rather than detracting from it. There was a big fail in attempting to portray an undead minotaur (or demon or something) that had papier-mché hands, but that was the only disaster.Family friendly? Well, if you are fine with your kid witnessing multiple decapitations but can't abide bare breasts on mermaids, then you've come to the right place. The mermaids are fully clothed and there are plenty of melee scenes that end with heads flying off.Final thoughts: Somewhat superior to the Mythica film series, Curse is amusing if you're willing to overlook obvious but expected low-budget flaws... would have been a lot less fun without Danielle Chuchran as the valley girl elf.

That's the announcer describing El Angel Blanco and Renato el Hippie flattening Blue Demon in a tag team fight (1 of 3 lucha libre matches during the movie). Renato the Hippie is a giant unmasked opponent, taller than both Santo and Blue Demon.Anyway, this is one of the best Santo y Blue Demon flicks I've seen, and my first ever encounter with a Dracula who speaks Spanish. As a vampire purist it pains me to see el Hombre Lobo thrown in with a vampire, but what can you do...Notable humor:👹 Dracula, who's apparently crappy at fist fights, was mainly a threat through hypnotism. But he gives Lina (the lovely Nubia Martí) fair warning that he will hypnotize her. Gotta love those villains who talk long enough for the hero to show up.👹 Blue Demon, hands tied behind his back, is made to walk a plank over a pit full of upward jutting spikes. Too bad he wore his shoes with tall heels that day! (what a horrible decade to be stuck in...) Of course Santo saves him from peril, and then Dracula and el Hombre Lobo stand frozen while their henchmen have a wild fight with Santo and Blue Demon. Dracula doesn't seem to have a plan B for most situations...👹 When Santo tells Lina (Santo's girlfriend) to stay at home because he's going into a dangerous situation, she tails him to the dangerous rendezvous and promptly saves both Santo and Blue Demon from a grisly death by fire.

Like early John Waters flicks, Nightmare On Elmo's Street (NOES) will make you throw up in your mouth a little. Yet such a comparison is an insult to John Waters (aka the Prince of Puke), who was capable of going beyond shock value by making educated statements about society in his films. If you don't know who John Waters is, then please do yourself a favor and check out his filmography.While the technical side of NOES is passable, it is otherwise mostly devoid of aptitude in other facets:PROs✔ The music. A well-picked selection of metal, mostly of the blackened doom variety: Satan's Host, Shape of Despair, Tristitia, The Skull, Esoteric, My Dying Bride, Woe Unto Me. The dark neoclassical band Elend was a nice way to break up that monotony.✔ The scantily clad Erin Brown wields a cross to fend off a puppet vampire; a bit offbeat, but what makes it sardonic is that [puppet] Jesus is still nailed to said cross.✔ Lots of unscripted cats. Literally, cats wandering around in many scenes. And if you don't like cats, there are slow-mo scenes of a dog running toward the camera in the snow. Yes, NOES is random.✔ There are a few lines capable of inciting any reaction whatsoever, such as: "Can I kiss you where you pee?" However, one good line every 5 or so minutes does not a worthwhile movie make.✔ Lots of extras. If you want more of Erin Brown, Dangrr Doll, Scarlett Storm, etc., it's there on the disc.CONs✘ Other than its pleasantly anti-theistic overtones, NOES is largely pedestrian. Akin to an insular high school boy imagining what "non-conformist" would be like, NOES ends up less subversive than The Matrix.✘ The script is wretched. I think Bill Zebub may have been trying for pseudo-philosophy, but the musings are vaguely reminiscent of listening to a dim-witted teabagger explain how much of a rebel he is, as if saying or doing something that isn't labeled (or subjectively perceived as) "mainstream" has intrinsic value simply for that reason. Not only has decrying "mainstream" become mainstream, but the very idea conveniently serves as a red herring, keeping us from asking questions such as: "Regardless of budget, is the film worth watching?" Being politically incorrect just for the sake of doing it is worse than pointless since it creates a snooze fest; perhaps if you live a sheltered and unhappy life, doing so feels avant-garde.✘ NOES is to erotica what feces is to fine dining.✘ I am wondering if you need to be under the influence of something to enjoy this flick; a movie shouldn't require drug use to be entertaining.⚖ Final thoughts ⚖The actors got a paycheck, director Bill Zebub got another notch in his belt, and I got an awful taste in my mouth (and have a little less money and time in my monthly entertainment budget). I support independent film by buying in, but sometimes it just isn't worth supporting.Don't watch NOES unless [1] you have a thing for one of the actresses, or [2] you hate humanity, including yourself.

Due to my reviewer ranking, I get numerous daily email requests to review items, usually with the terms of receiving the item for free in exchange for an honest review. Occasionally I take the offer if the item is of interest, and I always provide an honest review.Surely there are folks who LOVE this product, but take the 5-star reviews for this one with a grain of salt. Why? This seller didn't ask for an honest review, he asked for a 5-star review:"You can get a Free Waterproof Case. if you like our waterproof case when you get it, you can give us a 5 star Customer Review and seller feedback and we will give you free code again when we have new product.thank you very much."Crappy practices like this make Amazon reviews bad for the consumer.

If you sent your kid off with their grandma to watch Inside Out, grandma and your kid got the better end of that deal. This is not only for "kids of all ages," but also for any adult who likes a little brain tickling. Did you take Psychology and/or Anatomy & Physiology classes in college? All the better for watching Inside Out if you have!No need to review this when there's already 525 reviews, so I'll just leave you with this: Joy, after knocking over a box of Facts and another of Opinions (their contents spilling out and getting mixed up), comments on how people get them mixed up all the time anyway. That one wasn't for the kids.

And LiteXim said, "Let there be light," and there was light. And I saw the light, that it was good, and I was like, "Hey, this LiteXim divided the light from the darkness!" It's all about context. Okay, actually I wasn't all that excited, other than for this item being rechargeable via USB.What this light is good for:✔ Setting on the floor so that you can actually see what you are doing when you trim your toenails✔ Illuminating paperwork on your desktopWhat this light isn't good for:✘ Helping you lose 10 pounds✘ Getting you a date with a supermodelThe instructions are useless since they are in Chinese, but if you don't know how to operate a lamp, I am bemused by how you've managed to make it this far in life.I received this item in exchange for an honest review, which you have just read.

I have to agree with the first person to review this item:- Has a "good grip" handle- Comes with a hard plastic snap-on cover to protect both sharpness and your hands when digging around in your kitchen drawerI've only used it so far for hard cheese and chocolate. If you only want a tablespoon of high-fat cheese on your plate, or chocolate garnish to make your dessert perfect, this is the grater for you.The length of this zester makes it superior to other zesters because you can get more zest per stroke of the tool.I received this item in exchange for an honest review, which you just read.

Although it appears to have been rebranded as "Before the Storm," the literal translation of the film's French name is Bad (or Ill) Wind.I'll be honest, I ordered this from Europe because Aure Atika stars in it. As it turns out, the entire cast is wonderful.The plot:Franck (Jonathan Zaccaï) is a very underemployed tech temp worker who takes a gig that entails traveling to a coastal town to work on a computer system at a mega-supermarket that has gone on the fritz following a storm. As he starts working for Hopquin (Bernard Le Coq), the unpleasant man who manages the store, he notices some irregularities in the system that lead him to discover embezzlement. Meanwhile, back at his hotel, Franck has an eye for Frédérique (Aure Atika), who runs the place in its off-season. She has little interest in him unless she happens to be bored or the recipient of a gift from Franck.While this doesn't sound especially enticing, there's something about the way it comes together, with Ill Wind's seamless mingling of romance, humor, danger, desperation, and scheming. The script is solid and the actors know their craft. While the outcome of the romance is not surprising, the outcome of the scheming is not predictable, and remains the strength of Ill Wind. Perhaps I am biased towards liking French film, but I feel that this is a well-spent 92 minutes.A strong 4 stars.

2.5 stars at best...with the Beginner's Guide to Sex (BGS), you get basically what you'd expect from characters with names such as Principal Hyman (Tom Arnold), Coach Bush (Lucius Baston), Roberta the Squirter (Danie Coleman), and Marci Cox (Jackie Moore). I was more annoyed than amused for the first half but kept watching because Whitney Moore made the most of her role as the 30-year-old virgin Sex Ed teacher, Laci Cox. Hmm, writing this got me wondering if Jackie Moore is Whitney Moore's sister (Marci Cox is sister to Laci Cox in the movie).BGS is juvenile to the point of being idiotic, yet somehow you don't necessarily need to be an idiot to savor this kind of stupidity (or I could just be an idiot and not know it). Featuring students who jump off buildings competitively (is that a thing IRL?) and truly slimy school faculty and staff, BGS is surely beyond the pale and barely tethered to reality, with characters mostly being caricatures of themselves. It takes a minute to realize that Whitney Moore is not overacting, but rather playing the role flawlessly to fit the tude of the flick.If you can make it thru the first half, the second is better. The gay Coach Bush is a pleasantly surprising role not only because the script successfully walks the fine line between fun and denigration, but also because Lucius Baston excels at bringing his character to life. Other than Baston, the true talent on display is that of Whitney Moore (which is a relief considering that she is the protagonist). The other actors are hit or miss; I would say breakout roles for some, except that they probably don't want to be too much associated with BGS in the future.Final verdict: I'd wager the actors had a better time making this than we get in watching it. Proceed at your own risk.

↷ In the interest of not spoiling the plot, very few details are given below ↶If you read the Amazon blurb, then you know Meadowland takes place "In the hazy aftermath of an unimaginable loss." Two children are part of this tale of misfortune, with the adults as equally tragic figures. I'm not a parent, yet Meadowland did an outstanding job of forcing me to feel their struggle. The mother deals with her grief very differently than the father, providing a central premise in Meadowland.For most of its duration I felt a dull tension; as a passive observer, you are suspended in a heightened state while waiting for the other shoe to drop. You hope to see the characters find some light in so much darkness, but you also have a strong suspicion that the predicament will get worse before getting better. The raw humanity in this tale of woe is plausible and nearly palpable, with a very fine collection of actors bringing it together (including a few minutes cameo by Elisabeth Moss aka Peggy Olson aka Zoey Bartlet).*Abrupt ending alert* If you can't abide films that don't neatly tie up loose ends right before the closing credits, you've been warned. Despite no Standardized Hollywood Happy Ending (SHHE), Meadowland doesn't leave you with the urge to slit your wrists. In fact, the final minute or two is almost a relief, and very much not what you expect.

An apologist for war? It's simple to label Ian Morris as such if you are unable to get beyond the cognitive dissonance induced by a thesis like the one proposed here. Even more troubling, especially perhaps for libertarians and anarchists, is the approach taken by Morris in holding up Leviathan (Thomas Hobbes) as the desirable endpoint of war. Be prepared also for reading many instances of terms like "the invisible hand," Rumsfeld's "unknown unknowns," and "globo-cop," all of which are used with relish.Since it was written by a notable scholar rather than a radio talk show host, a college try in wading through the slippery denseness of his argument seemed reasonable to attempt. Morris at least attempts to view his thesis from more than one angle, while also providing implied (and possibly explicit, I can't remember) disclaimers so that the reader understands he is not a bloodthirsty sod who is clueless about how awful war is and the horrors that come out of it. The reasoning of his thesis is sound, drawing from disciplines that [at least theoretically] don't place moral judgments on topics."War. War never changes." That's how the opening dialogue from the game Fallout 3 commences, but in reference to human nature, not methodology. While Morris definitely discusses how war methodology has changed throughout history, his experience as an anthropologist and historian (rather than philosopher) doesn't lead to much talk of human nature per se, although nature is more or less implied by proxy in the extensive discussion of world history and archeology. Could most of the world's violent conflicts have been prevented (i.e., could differences have settled amicably)? Morris didn't intend to answer that question, and it's a moot point anyway.Morris provides a convincing argument that many won't want to acknowledge because it may be seen as weakening our convictions about the wrongness of war. If only life were black and white. The bottom line is that you can read this book in the morning and go to a war protest in the afternoon. ☮

While nudity as protest is old news in the West, FEMEN made some waves in Eastern Europe (2008-2013). The Ukrainian group's éminence grise ironically was a man (Victor Svyatski) who purportedly chose attractive young women likeliest to draw attention to the issues FEMEN would go on to champion. Inna Shevchenko, among the core original members in Ukraine (now heading their Paris HQ, as FEMEN is understandably in self-exile), posits that the patriarchal system is so ingrained in Ukrainian women that FEMEN may never have come to fruition without Svyatski (not stated in this documentary, but in another titled "Ukraine is not a Brothel", a slogan used by FEMEN at one point). This is only one of many controversies around a protest group most controversial for its preferred mode of raising awareness.During an interview in "I Am FEMEN", Anna Hutsol (the principal organizer of FEMEN in Ukraine from its inception) states:"...we need women who look aggressive, beautiful, and sexy, because Femen addresses another paradox in our society: How can such a beautiful woman, who you normally see in a beauty salon, be a feminist? People ask: Why is this sex object protesting? I'm used to seing her in porno films, in newpapers, in my bed, or in the kitchen. I'm not used to seeing this object protesting."Statements like these obviously open up a can of worms for many people, including some feminists. Regardless, there is no denying that the young women of FEMEN had some guts in opposing various wrongs in a region with many wrongs to right. In one of the tenser segments of "I Am FEMEN", a trip to poke a stick in the eye of Alexander Lukashenko (the dictator of Belarus) in front of the Minsk KGB office predictably leads to three FEMEN members being swiftly disappeared, albeit temporarily. I won't spoil the details of this story for you, or those of their trip to Moscow to shame the tyrant Putin. Suffice it to say, you don't want to get on the wrong side of the secret police.A shortcoming of the documentary is a failure to look beyond the insular group and evaluate if FEMEN had a positive impact in Ukraine (again, a controversial issue). Still, while many won't agree with their methods, standing against political oppression and the designation of women as 2nd class citizens is something worth taking your shirt off for, even in freezing weather. "I Am FEMEN" is a good watch, regardless of whether it is viewed for academic pursuits, entertainment, enlightenment, or inspiration.

↷ In the interest of not spoiling the plot, very few details are given below ↶Dirty Weekend is a relatively low-key, dialogue-rich dramedy that takes place over the course of a day (and was supposedly filmed over 15 days). Two strikingly different coworkers (portrayed by Alice Eve & Matthew Broderick) who are due to give a business presentation the following day find themselves delayed in the Albuquerque airport indefinitely, when they decide to go into town. What follows is a peculiar bonding that leads to the duo egging each other on until secrets are revealed.5 points to ponder beforehand:1. Alice Eve is the MVP of Dirty Weekend, very convincingly bringing her character to life with nearly perfect attention to detail. Next to her, Broderick comes off as a novice. Gia Crovatin can probably be considered as giving the second best performance in Dirty Weekend.2. Was Matthew Broderick being too heavy-handed with the deadpan? Was he miscast? Apparently the critics liked him in Dirty Weekend, but I can't see why. About halfway in you sort of just surrender to the choice of him as the male lead; I'm saying this as someone who in 1983 enjoyed Broderick in his breakout role (WarGames) on the big screen, so I certainly wanted to like him here.3. When people say of a movie, "it isn't for everyone," they are speaking of films like this. If you need action, a Hollywood Happy Ending, or cue cards to tell you when to laugh, then skip this. Dirty Weekend also portrays some unorthodox relationships, so if your mind is easily blown by that type of thing... you've been warned.4. Dirty Weekend is about self-discovery, and about how an acquaintance can be instrumental in the process. Basically: life is full of surprises (and so is this film).5. The story may seem an improbable scenario, but trust me: a business trip with a coworker can absolutely lead to all kinds of possibilities (results may vary). Dirty Weekend is not so predictable as to be mundane, but you also don't need to suspend disbelief in order to watch it.Final thoughts: I was grinning for the majority of Dirty Weekend, and was pleased that it ended on a slightly more serious note; the characters experienced growth but didn't neatly resolve their issues in one day. A fondness for Matthew Broderick is not the best reason to watch this. Alice Eve in the role of Natalie, Gia Crovatin as Dylan, and the cab driver who "likes Shakespeare" are among the best reasons to watch. ✈

I was so looking forward to an offbeat vampire flick, but I'm going to have to agree somewhat with the reviewer who simply wrote "Man is bitten by a foam rubber likeness of a colon in a fishbowl attached to flexible air conditioning duct which makes him want to kill." In fairness, the bowel in a tank is only the genesis of the troubles faced by the two protagonists, one who becomes deeply disturbed and vampiric, the other who remains mortal for longer, desiring to impose salvation on the mad scientist.Strange Blood reminds me of something you would see at a science fiction short film festival; the problem here is that it isn't short.ACTORSMan. I'm going to be unkind and state that Robert Brettenaugh was probably not born to be an actor. He is better in Strange Blood after he shaves his head, but mostly because he looks awkward and truly stark raving mad to fit the part (too bad he couldn't match it with convincing thespianism). There's a somewhat fine line between coming off as a madman and looking like you're trying to pull it off; unfortunately, his performance was over the top.Woman. Alexandra Bard does well with what she was given, but warming up to her occurs only after a quarter hour of acclimating to the anemic script and vibe of Strange Blood. You may or may not feel empathy with her character at times, but you'll also lose respect once too often, which leaves you in no particular mood to continue watching Strange Blood. This is an actress worth looking out for in future productions (I would watch her already released shorts if I could find them).PLOTSimple, and mostly shot at one location (barely qualifying as a disjointed movie set). The whole idea of how a vampire might be created by something other than another vampire was at least an ounce of originality. Prepare yourself to be fine with extensive scenes of the doc flitting back and forth in his tighty-whities, which are often dirty in spots that make you cringe. A fun aspect of the plot is in the last minute AFTER the closing credits, so be sure to watch that (if you can make it to the closing credits).SCRIPTNot worth mentioning. I've seen worse, but that's about the best praise I can offer. The "love story" is just horrible in every way. There's one good line Alexandra Bard proffers at a diner: "If you can't have dessert for dinner, what's the point of being an adult?"CINEMATOGRAPHYThe saving grace of Strange Blood, if you are charitable enough to recognize it, is competent and even creative cinematography. There are flashes of inspiration, but more instances of ideas that don't pan out (such as the use of red lighting). In the beginning, you might say "Oh no, not another found footage movie!" Not to worry: it isn't one (that's only a gimmick to get to the real story).ADULT FACTORMale and female nudity, sex scenes, coarse language, abusive/violent behavior, and bloodshed.EXTRA FEATURESNone. The nail in the coffin for low budget flicks like this is when they couldn't be bothered to put anything on the DVD other than the feature film. An interview with Alexandra Bard or Robert Brettenaugh would have been choice, or even one with the filmmaker (discussing for instance where the ideas came from, what challenges were encountered during shooting, etc.; such details are of interest to film buffs even when the movie is not good).Final Thoughts: I paid $10 for Strange Blood and Strangely I don't regret it, probably because I collect vampire films (no matter how bad). For the casual viewer, however, you'd need to *really* like vampire and/or bizarre films to justify this price.

Don't judge a DVD by it's cover in this case, because the artwork doesn't reflect Mythica: A Quest for Heroes (MQH) very well. In this first of three Mythica movies, the woman front and center on this DVD cover is indeed the protagonist, but she is a magic user who wields no swords. Ignore everything else except for that ogre on steroids in the background. ** Note: this particular release of the movie is on a Region 2 disc. You can find the Region 1 DVD release on Amazon, it's just not on this page **The total budget is unknown to me, but 1,527 backers pledged $94,294 on Kickstarter towards the production of Mythica: A Quest for Heroes (MQH). Even if the total cost ended up as high as $3M, that's still a paltry sum for a movie that requires shoots in semi-remote locations, special effects in numerous scenes, and the creation of specialized sets, props, and costumes. The 1st Hobbit flick (2012) had an estimated budget of $180M, which is maybe 60-150x the price tag of MQH. Was the 1st Hobbit flick 100x better than MQH? Not by a longshot. That said, don't buy into MQH if you expect anywhere near Peter Jackson quality, obviously.THE GOOD✔ Cinematography. Waaaay better than expected. Not super-creative, but someone knew what they were doing behind a camera.✔ Locations. Utah is not only a poor man's New Zealand, it's a fairly spectacular place to shoot this genre.✔ Actors. Christopher Robin Miller (Hammerhead), Adam Johnson (Thane) and Nicola Posener (Teela) have numerous previous credits to their names, and relative newcomer Melanie Stone (Marek) did an admirable job as the lead. Thane was added to the story in a clever manner and remained likable; Marek and Teela are foxy without wearing clichéd skimpy high fantasy garb.✔ The soundtrack. Yeah, it's a bit high-flown for a B movie, but it's surprisingly inspired.✔ Special effects / CGI. Yes, I'm on record here as saying the effects were decent *given the budgetary constraints*✔ No dragon. Thank gods, I'm bloody well tired of dragons.✔ The "To Be Continued" at the end is actually a truthful statement (there's a completed sequel and another in post-production).THE BAD✘ Despite occasional inspiration in the script and character development, MQH doesn't challenge the audience. The dialogue was ho-hum, with far more misses than hits in the humor dept.✘ Generic plot. Rescue this or that person, run away, get caught, escape...✘ Combat. It's clear the crew was lacking an experienced fight choreographer. Personally, this didn't much matter to me since I often find melee combat tedious no matter what, but I know this can be a deal-breaker for some viewers.✘ Kevin Sorbo. Not that he was bad in MQH, he just wasn't necessary. I hope he did that cameo as a favor to the filmmaker rather than getting paid like $2k for the part so that he could remodel one of his bathrooms.✘ At times MQH seems to be pandering by trying to emulate the vibe of Peter Jackson films. Perhaps this is simply homage (if so, then ignore my complaint).THE UGLY☠ The dialogue was occasionally cringeworthy rather than just bland.☠ The dwarf (Hammerhead). Someone must have insisted that a high fantasy movie needs a dwarf... which is, of course, a completely ridiculous notion (see above, "pandering to Peter Jackson fans").If you understand budgetary limitations in filmmaking of this kind, then you should be able to appreciate MQH and maybe even have fun. If you can't abide non-multiplex flicks, then skip this.

The total budget is unknown to me, but 1,527 backers pledged $94,294 on Kickstarter towards the production of Mythica: A Quest for Heroes (MQH). Even if the total cost ended up as high as $3M, that's still a paltry sum for a movie that requires shoots in semi-remote locations, special effects in numerous scenes, and the creation of specialized sets, props, and costumes. The 1st Hobbit flick (2012) had an estimated budget of $180M, which is maybe 60-150x the price tag of MQH. Was the 1st Hobbit flick 100x better than MQH? Not by a longshot. That said, don't buy into MQH if you expect anywhere near Peter Jackson quality, obviously.THE GOOD✔ Cinematography. Waaaay better than expected. Not super-creative, but someone knew what they were doing behind a camera.✔ Locations. Utah is not only a poor man's New Zealand, it's a fairly spectacular place to shoot this genre.✔ Actors. Christopher Robin Miller (Hammerhead), Adam Johnson (Thane) and Nicola Posener (Teela) have numerous previous credits to their names, and relative newcomer Melanie Stone (Marek) did an admirable job as the lead. Thane was added to the story in a clever manner and remained likable; Marek and Teela are foxy without wearing clichéd skimpy high fantasy garb.✔ The soundtrack. Yeah, it's a bit high-flown for a B movie, but it's surprisingly inspired.✔ Special effects / CGI. Yes, I'm on record here as saying the effects were decent *given the budgetary constraints*✔ No dragon. Thank gods, I'm bloody well tired of dragons.✔ The "To Be Continued" at the end is actually a truthful statement (there's a completed sequel and another in post-production).THE BAD✘ Despite occasional inspiration in the script and character development, MQH doesn't challenge the audience. The dialogue was ho-hum, with far more misses than hits in the humor dept.✘ Generic plot. Rescue this or that person, run away, get caught, escape...✘ Combat. It's clear the crew was lacking an experienced fight choreographer. Personally, this didn't much matter to me since I often find melee combat tedious no matter what, but I know this can be a deal-breaker for some viewers.✘ Kevin Sorbo. Not that he was bad in MQH, he just wasn't necessary. I hope he did that cameo as a favor to the filmmaker rather than getting paid like $2k for the part so that he could remodel one of his bathrooms.✘ At times MQH seems to be pandering by trying to emulate the vibe of Peter Jackson films. Perhaps this is simply homage (if so, then ignore my complaint).THE UGLY☠ The dialogue was occasionally cringeworthy rather than just bland.☠ The dwarf (Hammerhead). Someone must have insisted that a high fantasy movie needs a dwarf... which is, of course, a completely ridiculous notion (see above, "pandering to Peter Jackson fans").If you understand budgetary limitations in filmmaking of this kind, then you should be able to appreciate MQH and maybe even have fun. If you can't abide non-multiplex flicks, then skip this.

I use this ipow in the kitchen while cooking: it keeps my phone off the counter (away from potential disaster) while I listen to podcasts, audiobooks, etc. The jaws of this holder are large enough for my Nexus 6 in its Case-Mate Naked Tough Bumper (it's a BIG phone). Seems to me worth the $12 asking price on Amazon (I received mine for free in exchange for an honest review).I will update this review if I run into any problems, but so far there is nothing to complain about.

Season 2 flashes forward a bit to 1873, still in the early days of the French Third Republic, when many were glad to be rid of the monarchy, yet others pined for its reestablishment. Much to the chagrin of Hortense, Le Paradis is now run by its proletariat residents, but it doesn't take long before the bordello is caught between the vice squad and a small band of hoodlums, leading to such scenarios as a picnic becoming a bloodbath.Season 2 features a magnificent reprisal of Rose by Jemima West, who now ranges from feisty newly literate Marxist to withdrawn lovestruck drug addict. In reviewing Season 1, I stated that somehow Maison Close "doesn't leave you in a pool of misery"; the same cannot be said for Season 2. Yet despite the emphatic tragedy of it all, Maison Close is well worth watching in its entirety, rivaling the best of dramas about the disenfranchised.There was industry chatter in 2012 about HBO picking up Maison Close for a remake; I can only hope that it didn't happen and that such a series doesn't come to fruition. This show about a sliver of French history was meant to be produced by the French, and it was done so here without room for improvement.

Caveat emptor: Self/less is an action flick... but unfortunately not a Green Lantern sequel.PROs✔ The first 34 minutes are actually decent. Sure, there are plenty of things (large and small) that don't make sense, but suspending our disbelief for the sake of some good science fiction is not too much to ask, right? If only it had remained science fiction...✔ Lady Mary Crawley!! I mean Michelle Dockery! Granted she doesn't get enough screen time, but it was a pleasant surprise for a follower of Downton Abbey (she is arguably even more fetching as Ben Kingsley's activist daughter in Self/less). The heartfelt, cathartic, but predictable scene with Dockery towards the end is one of the few believable moments offered by Self/less.✔ Ben Kingsley doing a NYC accent. Wait, maybe that's a CON.CONs✘ Oh, where to begin.
