But at half the price of the SanDisk Extreme PRO, this SDXC card is good enough for most consumers.DSLR:These are the numbers on a D7000:-JPEG (Fine): 6 fps for 21 frames, then 2 frames at ~3fps captured every second (approx) up to 100 frames total.-JPEG (Normal): 6fps for 31 frames, then 4 frames at ~4fps (sometimes sped up to ~5fps) up to 100 frames.-RAW: 6 fps for 10-12 frames, then 2 frames at 2fps captured every 2-3 seconds.-RAW+ JPEG (Fine): 6 fps for 10 frames, then around a frame every 2 seconds.These were almost identical to the PNY Elite 64GB U1 version.BENCHMARK:Using Disk Speed Test, I got the following average numbers out of three tests (Updated 2015-06-26):Read - 86MB/sWrite - 52MB/sThese numbers are similar to the older U1 version (Read 86MB/s, Write 51MB/s), tests were performed sequentially (U1 then U3, repeated three times) on a MBP.  However, compared to the SanDisk Extreme PRO 64GB (90MB/s Read and 82MB/s Write) this PNY Elite Performance has slightly slower Read (5% slower), and significantly slower Write speeds (~40% slower).  This is only relevant if, for example, you use a DSLR and shoot in burst mode that often fills the camera buffer (ie. Wedding, Sports, Events photography).  For me, this PNY is sufficient.At the cost of about half the cost of PRO cards like the SanDisk Extreme PRO 64GB, this 64GB SDXC card has excellent performance for the price point.Highly recommended.  Deserves the 5-star rating.

Great set.  Comes with mesh bag for easy transport.  I used this on a recent trip to Cabo San Jose.Fins:I use the fins with Tilos Neoprene Fin Socks, which help keep these foot-pocket fins from falling off (not necessary, but it helps me).  The fins have a quick-release strap system, so the fins are easy to get on and off your feet.  The angle of blade is optimized for "maximum thrust with minimal effort."Mask:This is a very good mask, and fits my face well.  It is easy to clear, and provides a surprisingly wide field of vision, due to the beveled sides (ie. Patented single-lens design with seamless side window for a panoramic field of vision).  It also has an adjustable head strap with quick-release buckles.  It is soft and wide so it doesn't twist as easily when putting on, and flexible/stretchy enough to put on and off.  It has double-sealed silicone skirt for fit and comfort.Snorkel:Large exhaust and purge valve at bottom for easy water clearing.  Specialized dry top prevents water from entering snorkel even if submerged (this is quite accurate).  One of the best snorkels I have used!  It clears in a small breath, is comfortable to use, and water does not get in my mouth from wave splashes.  I haven't used it to free dive so can't comment on it.Not the best I've used, but definitely a very good set for snorkeling.  I still prefer the Cressi Frog Plus Fins, Mask, Snorkel Set, which cost twice as much as this Phantom Aquatics set.Highly recommended.

These pens are great for everyday use.  This will work well for note-taking, making lists, or just doodling around.  The rubber grip makes writing comfortable.  The retractable tip is great for storing the pens, so that it doesn't accidentally write on your clothes, notebook, etc.Eight colors:  Four standard colors (Black, Blue, Green, Red) and four brighter/lighter colors (Aqua*, Mint Green*, Hot Pink*, Purple)Don't expect these to replace a Mont Blanc or a S.T. Dupont or even a Cross Pen and you'll have fun with these pens.  I wouldn't use these to write checks, since I would prefer to use pens with special ink like the uni-ball 207 Pens.For me, the only thing to worry about with these pens is when they start growing legs.  Somehow, they "crawl" away and manage to makes their way onto my daughter's desk.Five stars.

As a measuring device, this works, period.  I've used this to measure rooms, windows, hallways, garage space, office space... almost anything that I can measure.  It works best to measure the height of a room, where one might need a ladder to reach the ceiling.  With this toy... errr, device... you just stand it on the floor, point up to the ceiling, and it gives the measurement.  I've checked the measurements against a tape measure, and up to 100 feet, the difference is less than 1/8 inch.  Simple.  Easy.  Works.Select what you want to measure.  Distance, Area, Volume.  Press the red button to turn on the laser, then another push takes the measurement.Product Description:-"Measure up to 130 Feet with accuracy of 1/8 Inch or better over entire range."  Absolutely correct.-"Its small size makes it easy to use in hard-to-access areas."  Yes, this is small and compact, and easy to carry around. It fits in small areas.-"Measure distances in Feet-Inches, Decimal Feet, Inches or Meters."  Easy to change out with a push of a button.-"Large, bright, color easy-to-read display."  Easy to read in the day or night.-"Includes a protective carrying case, wrist lanyard, 2 AAA batteries and a 2-year warranty"

This square pan has a solid build, and you can tell when you pick it up.  It is heavier than the non-professional version of this pan.  The 9x9 dimension is for the top lip.  The pan tapers in at the bottom, so the dimension is slightly less than 9x9 near the bottom.  The non-stick feature is nice.  This is great for baking brownies, and for making rice crispy treats.  The only potential drawback is that this is heavy.  I like it so muchHighly recommended.

Pros:-Arkon mounts are excellent, and this one is no exception-Easy to mount the phone onto this holder-Strong suction for mounting onto glass or supplied mounting plate-Works well with an iPhone 4S/5S/6 in their respective casesCons:-Max supported weight is 6.3 oz; this is barely enough for the iPhone 6 Plus (6.0 oz) and Note 4 (6.2 oz), and not enough for Nexus 6 (6.5 oz), and these are weights without a case-Comes with only two plates (round and rectangle), and as of this review there are no spare plates available for saleThis is decent if you just want to mount your phone and do not plan on touching the screen much.  For example, you can set up your favorite mapping app and then mount it.  It is not good if you are, for example, constantly changing the songs on your phone's playlist and have to touch the screen a lot.  The phone will come off the mount.Otherwise, this is a decent mount.  Easy to to install and easy to use.  The Cons were significant enough to keep me from giving this a 5-star review.  However, if your uses are limited to the basic phone mount and you want an easy on/off mount, this can be a 5-star product.Recommended.

This review is for the iPhone 6 case.This case is made of a nice leather material.  I like the bright yellow color of the "Sun Ray", but it also shows the dirt more easily.  The brown "Mud Slide" is more muted, and does not show the dirt as easily as the yellow case.This case provides a degree of protection from scratches, dents, scuffs, and dirt.  However, it will not protect from significant drops and dings.  If you need a more rugged and tough case, I recommend the LifeProof Fre Series case, which is water proof, dirt proof, shock proof, and snow proof.  But at 70 dollar pricepoint, you also pay a premium for the protection.This product has a slim profile (it doesn't add much weight or bulk) while maintaining functionality (buttons and ports are easily accessible) and improving grip.  What is unique about each ullu is that each case is handcrafted by a single artisan from the first cut to the final stitch!It also comes with a screen protector that you apply yourself.  It can certainly help with protecting the screen from minor scratches, but I don't like screen protectors.If you accept that this is just a phone cover and not a protective case, then this is the product for you.  It will save the back of your phone from minor scratches and dings.  It does not add significant weight or bulk, and the leather looks classy.Highly recommended.

This DSL modem/router is very good.  The setup with AT&T took contacting tier-2 support, who suggested 1) firmware upgrade, and 2) manual info entry of advanced settings.Pros:-Works with AT&T DSL-wireless speed is decent with one device connected-Decent coverage of two-story house; but wireless coverage not as good as NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 or even the NETGEAR AC1600Cons:-Does NOT work with AT&T U-verse-Wireless speed slows down significantly when more than one wireless device is connectedIn the end, I am using this as a DSL Router, but not using the wireless mode.  I am using another wireless router (the Nighthawk AC1900) as an access point connected to this modem/router.Router Specs:-Supports 802.11ac-Simultaneous transmission of 2.4GHz band (300Mbps Max) and 5GHz band (433Mbpx Max)-1x USB2.0 (not 3.0); You can share a printer with multiple computers and devices on your network and can also share files and media at home or via the ftp server while away from home-IPv6 support-Guest network; Provides secure Wi-Fi access for guests sharing your home or office network in a controlled manner without exposing private Wi-Fi access codes or other personal data-Parental Control

Good quality material.  It is durable enough to handle the exercises designed for it, yet soft enough to create the instability needed to challenge your balance.  In addition to a balance pad, I've used it to as knee, elbow, and butt support for various floor stretches and exercises.  It is small enough to be tucked away behind the TV console, and does not take up too much space in the living room for the exercises.Two negatives are the size the the price.  It is not wide enough for normal push-ups, but good enough for diamond push-ups.  And it costs at least twice the amount as other similar balance pads.  However, I cannot attest to the quality of these other balance pads.-Soft Foam Creates Instability.  Dimensions are 15.75 inch L x 13 inch W x 2.5 inch-Ideal for Squats, Lunges and Push-Ups.  Great for strengthening the hips, quads and ankles - also easy on your joints.-Combines Benefits of Exercise and Balance.  Improves coordination, ankle stability & lower leg strength.-Exercise Guide Included.  Perfect for conditioning, rehabilitation, physical therapy and injury prevention.Overall, a very good and durable balance pad.Manufacturer's Notes:"Improve coordination, ankle stability and strength no matter what your fitness level. The SPRI Balance Pad combines the benefits of exercise and balance moves in one tool. The soft foam creates instability; great for strengthening the hips, quads and ankles with moves like squats, lunges and push-ups, and it's easy on your joints. Perfect for conditioning, rehabilitation, physical therapy and injury prevention."-Combines the benefits of exercise & balance training in one tool-Improves coordination, ankle stability & lower leg strength-Great for squats, lunges, push-ups & more-Exercise Guide Included

This suspension system works like the TRX training in that you use your bodyweight as the "resistance" for your workout.  This is a light, portable, full-spectrum training tool that utilizes your body weight during the exercises to build lean muscle, boost core strength and increase flexibility.  Portable enough to bring when you travel, and easy enough to install in your hotel room (ie. bathroom or room door) and you have an instant workout system in your room.  I've also brought this in my office to workout during lunch.  My only gripe is that the nylon straps seem a bit flimsy, and I don't anticipate this lasting more than a year (I hope I am wrong).Recommended.From the manufacturer:-Two independent, sturdy nylon straps with reinforced stitching-Attach to a door or any sturdy overhead anchor point-Unique 4-point door anchoring system allows you to safely and easily modify resistance levels-Comfortable foam handles and padded contoured foot straps-Perform multiple exercises that work the entire body

I like the smaller sized backpacks for everyday use.  I don't like them too big or bulky, only becausethey tend to get filled up with unnecessary things and weighs the bag down, and it is a lot easier to navigate downtown SF with a smaller pack.  This backpack is small enough to maneuver around the city, and large enough to carry my MacBook Pro (15 inch) and iPad in one compartment, and some papers in the other compartment.  It is approximately the same size as the Case Logic Case WMBP-115Blk, with some differences.I also like the mint green ("Anthracite") highlights to break the monotony of an all-black backpack.What I like:- Clean design- Ingegrated compartment for laptop (up to 15.6") plus sleeve for tablet- Flexible laptop storage doubles as a stretch-fit pocket to keep shoes or clothes separate from other items- Cash-stash pocket on back panel provides hidden storage for money and ID- Quick access front pocket stows go-to items such as your phone, keys, gum, etc.- Interior cord storage pocket keeps small power cords handy and prevents tangling- Mesh side pockets store water bottles easily and within reach- Organizational panel keeps smaller accessories easy-to-find, two pockets (about 4x4") to store smaller items (cords, change, cards), and built in pen loops assure easy access of writing implements- The bag and straps are comfortable.  No corners or anything that sticks you in the back, shoulders, arms.I don't like:- the bag material seems thin and flimsy, and does not seem durable.  This is more subjective, and only time will tell.This is great for everyday use.  This may be a bit small for school use, but can work if you don't carry large books.  It will work well with notebooks and essentials (lunch, snacks).  This may be a tad small for a business traveler.Highly recommended.

This is a very good yoga towel set.  The large towel is just under 6 feet long, and can be laid on a bare floor/mat or can be used on top of a yoga mat.  Underneath the microfiber towel (yes, there is a difference in sides) has a rubber non-slip dotting, which helps a lot with keeping the towel in place.  The small towel is nice to have to wipe yourself down.  The microfiber cloth feels nice, we'll see how it holds up over time.Nice set to have.  Highly recommended.

This works well.  Has nice ergonomics, fits all of my acoustic guitars, and is easy to use.  No adjustments are required for my guitars, but it is nice to know that the options is available for this capo.This capo comes with a pick holder.  And, it is expandable with a D'Addario NS Micro Clip-On Tuner that attaches onto the lower arm.  I do not use a pick, and I use my own tuners, so neither of these two features is applicable for my needs.This capo has moved up as one of two highly used capos for my guitars, the other one being the G7th Performance Capo.  The G7 capo goes with my Takamine New Yorker, and this Planet Waves goes on everything else.  If anyone needs to use a capo, I loan out my Kyser Capo.Recommended.

I used cycled this drive as one of my backup drives for work.  It works decent enough, and I like the slim feature.5400rpm HDUSB 3.0, backwards compatible with USB 2.0 and 1.0HD Tune specs:USB 3.0 - Average Read/Write speeds 89/85 MBps (limited by HD speed)USB 2.0 - Average Read/Write speeds 28/22 MBps (limited by USB2.0 speed)The backup software is decent.  However, I use a script in windows for my backups, which I've been using since the XP days.  I modify the script as needed, and I have yet to encounter any problems with it.  Basically, I backup to two separate portable hard drives (including this one), and I bring one home and I lock the other one in my desk.  In the month I've been using this drive, I have not encountered any issues.On my first backup attempt, about 580 GB of data of various file types and sizes took about 3.5 hours to copy onto this drive using a USB 3.0 connection.  The average data transfer speed was 45 MB/s.  It took about 5 minutes longer to copy onto this external drive than copying the same folder from one internal SATA HD onto another internal SATA HD.  Not bad.I've encrypted the entire volume using TrueCrypt, so I don't have to worry about privacy issues if I accidentally misplace this drive... or if it grew legs.Overall, this is a highly portable yet very usable external HD.  Light enough to carry in my shirt or pants pocket, yet large enough to carry a large amount of files.Strong 5-star rating.  Highly recommended.

What I liked:-Full HD-4K support (4K is 3840 x 2160); also able to upscale from 1080 to 4K-64-bit power is faster and more powerful.-Includes 7 professional quality special effects-support up to 21 tracks-UI and functionality is similar to X5, but A LOT faster-Lots of extras:  Hollywood-style titles, handscript animation, proDAD Mercalli SE to stabilize video footage, cinema quality effects, etc.What I didn't like:-Installation was not as smooth as I would like.  I have X5 installed, and installation of X7 did not uninstall X5 (amongst other installation issues), thus starting X7 ended up opening X5.  I had to uninstall both X5 and X7, and then reinstall X7.  Afterwards, all went well.Bottom line is that this software is a lot faster and more stable than Adobe Premiere Pro (1.5) which is 32-bit, and 2) Corel VideoStudio Pro X5.  I liked both of these programs, and I would say that the VS X7 is far more superior than these two programs.  Plus lots of extras, plug-ins, video effects, customizable options, AND faster and more powerful, this is an excellent consumer/prosumer video editing software.  5-star rating.  Highly recommended.

What I liked:-Decent knuckle protection.  That's about all it protects.-Easy on and off.-Long wrist wrap provides some wrist support.What I didn't like:-LARGE size is bordering on uncomfortably clumsy, even for my large hands.-LONG wrist wrap was too much when used with my 16 oz gloves-Got uncomfortable when wearing for too long-Stitching starting to come undone on fingers-insufficient padding-no metacarpus support-no support for thumbWill I use these?  Sure, for light bag work, but not for heavy sparring or heavy bag work.  I prefer using hand wraps.  Call me old fashioned.

I received the small 8oz purple/white gloves.  I normally use large 16oz gloves.  These barely fit my unwrapped left hand but I absolutely cannot fit my right hand into the glove.Firstly, 8oz gloves are not useful for sparring/training.  8oz gloves are good for cardio-boxing or the like, but not for hitting things (heavy bags) or people (sparring).They feel soft inside, but I worry about the padding for heavy punching.I actually don't mind the color, since they are easy to see, and therefore easy to see if I am making any mistakes.I let my 8yo daughter use these to practice Muay Thai at home.  She doesn't mind them.So for boxing or cardio-bag, I would give these 3 stars (or less).  For cardio exercises where you don't have to hit anything, I would give these 4 stars.

The Oreck Signature Collection Vacuum is a stylish yet functional vacuum cleaner.Distinctive, colorful inter-changeable bag covers and easy-to-use features makes it the must-have swivel vacuum.Easy to use all over the house.  From the runway to your living room, this lightweight, upright vacuum has it all.  What I like best is that it stores flat enough for me to keep it under the family couch.  Keep in mind that this is more of a traditional vacuum cleaner, so there are no hoses or extensions to work with (if you want to use a hose+attachment to clean the stairs, this is not the vacuum cleaner to use).  But for flat areas all over the house, this vacuum works great!  The suction is strong, and does not get clogged up like other vacuum units.  For most daily cleanups, I use this vacuum unit.PRODUCT FEATURES-The 360 Glide Unique ball-joint and pivot connection design makes it easy to steer and maneuver around the house and around furniture.-It Comes With 4 Colorful Front-Panel Bag Inserts to match your cleaning style.-Low Profile Design lets you gets in tight spots and under furniture.-The Saniseal System Automatically seals shut, locking the dirt in the disposable filter bag.-Direct Suction 5,600 revolutions per minute of suction power draw dirt into the bag for effortless cleaning.-Twin bright LED Lights illuminate dark corners and under furniture.-Two Speed power switch; HIGH speed cleans carpet, while LOW speed is gentle enough for Oriental and Persian rugs.-Weighs only 10 lbs. making it easy to lift and maneuver.  I've used it for upstairs and downstairs, and carrying it around was not an issue.-Long-lasting Endurolife Belt Protects the motor from unexpected jams and never needs changing.-HEPA Inner Bag Capture 99.97% polen, dust, smoke, animal dander and mold spores particles as small as .3 microns from the air.Overall, highly recommended.

This backpack is a very nice laptop/bookbag for everyday use.Notable features of this backpack:- Back compartment holds up to a 15.6" laptop, plus files, papers, folders, etc.  It easily fits my MacBook Pro 15 inch retina display, plus my working files.- Main compartment has a sleeve for your 10" tablet (stores my iPad 4 quite well), which sits right next to the laptop compartment so that it all the weight is close to your back- There is a top loading small zippered pocket.  This can hold your phone, sunglasses, small change purse, etc.  I use it for my lip balm and coin wallet.- The lumbar padding on the lower portion of the backpack that goes against your back also has a hidden pocket to protect small valuables.  I used this to keep my flight itinerary, just as an easy access without going through the rest of the backpack.- Front pocket panel provides basic organization for small daily accessories.  I use it for my pens, charging cables, and powerbar storage.- Pass through along the back panel easily slips over the handle of rolling luggage.  This helped with my recent trip, where I rolled my backpack on my check-in luggage as I ran through the airport to make a connecting flight.- Side pockets can accomodate a water bottle; or you can store your MP3 inside and easily thread your headphones through the designated slot- Top and bottom grab handles assist easy loading into daily storage and overhead binsWhat I don't like:There is a lack of significant padding on the bottom of the backpack.  I have to be very careful setting this backpack down on the ground, so I end up putting it on a padded chair or on the couch.  I also wished there were more color options.Overall, a decent backpack.

This video camera is a top of the line consumer camcorder.  It has an Exmor R CMOS sensor (1/3") with Sony G lens for high-quality video and image capture.  It has 32GB built-in memory, and a memory expansion slot for SD/SDHC/SDXC cards and memory stick micro.  It sports a Balanced Optical Steady Shot (BOSS) image stabilization, which gives a decently steady image even at full zoom (60x), which works good enough for home videos.  Built-in projector with 50 lumens for up to 200" projection.  Coupled with an HDMI in so you can project from a tablet or phone (with the proper cable connectors), or any other device that projects via HDMI.  This works quite well to project movies from my iPad.  HDMI out port is also available, if you want to play your videos onto an HDMI TV.  The 5.1 channel surround-sound mic is a nice addition.This camcorder is the replacement for the Sony HDR-PJ650V and not a replacement for the Sony HDR-PJ790V.  If you go to either product site on Amazon, it would recommend this PJ810 as a "newer model" which is not entirely accurate for the PJ790.Unboxing:Top compartment of the box revealed the instruction manuals (English and Spanish), warranty information, mini pamphlet on available accessories.  Inside the box was the camcorder body, NP-FV50 battery, AC adaptor, power cord, micro HDMI cable, USB cable extender, remote control RMT-835 (with battery).First thing is to charge the battery.  The battery has to be mounted on the camera to charge (no separate battery charger).  There is a USB cable, about two inches long, with the USB connector mounted onto the strap.  I used the USB cable extended to connect the camera to the AC adaptor and let the battery charge overnight.The camcorder body on the side of the strap (where you slip your hand to hold the camera) has the feel of a DSLR.  This side also has the microphone input and headphone jack (both stereo minijacks) on this side.  The other side is smooth black plastic that has the flip-out LCD touchscreen.  Opening the screen also the HDMI in and out ports, as well as the external memory slot under a plastic sliding cover.Wi-Fi support is used for connecting to smartphones.  NFC (near field communication) provides "touch connection" convenience when transferring images to Android smartphones and tablets.  With this feature, users need only touch devices to connect; no complex set-up is required.  In addition, when using Smart Remote Control -- a feature that allows shutter release to be controlled by a smartphone -- connection between this camcorder and the smartphone can be established by simply touching devices.Video quality is excellent.  I've used it to record outdoor and indoor functions.  I like the dual format video recording, and I record AVCHD and MP4 at the same time.  Overall, an excellent consumer camcorder.  I would say it will give my go-to camcorder (Canon HF S10) a run for its money, which has been my go-to camcorder to record significant events.For better image quality, I would recommend the Sony HDR-PJ790V or the Sony HDR-CX900.  The PJ790V has a larger sensor (1/2" -vs- 1/3" for this PJ810), but it will add another $500+ to the cost.  The Sony HDR-CX900 has a 1" Exmor R CMOS Sensor, has a resolution of 14MP(video) and 20MP (still images), and with similar capabilities as the PJ810, minus the projector.  For 4K video capability, I would recommend the Sony FDR-AX100/B 4K Video Camera, which has a larger LCD at 3.5" (-vs- 3" for the PJ810) and a 1" Exmor R CMOS sensor (-vs- 1/3" for the PJ810), but also costs about $1K more than the PJ810.Included in the box:-NP-FV50 battery, AC adaptor, power cord, instruction manuals (English and Spanish), micro HDMI cable, USB cable extender, remote control RMT-835 (with battery), step down ring for 37mm lens accessories (filters, etc.).  As mentioned by previous reviewer, this does NOT come with a lens hood, which I always use for outdoor daytime shooting.Noteable features:-32GB embedded Flash Memory-Slot for full size SD/SDHC/SDXC and Memory Stick Micro memory expansion.  However, on paper the description says that expandable memory only supports Memory Stick Micro (this is correct) and Micro SD/SDHC/SDXC (this is incorrect, since it supports full size cards).  The picture on the Sony site even shows a full size SD slot, but the specifications state micro cards are used.  Wrong information on Sony and Amazon sites.-1920x1080 Full HD 24p/60p with 24.5MP Exmor R CMOS Sensor-Project ~200" videos with 50 lumen built-in projector via HDMI.  Projector is built in to the LCD panel. HDMI multi-terminal allows you to connect external devices that have an HDMI output (smartphones, laptops, tablets, etc) and use the camcorder's projector to enjoy other forms of entertainment such as video games and streaming videos.-Does NOT have night shot.  Or at least I haven't found it yet :p-Has a video light, but it does not function as a flash for still pictures.-Multiple Format Recording:  The PJ810 can redord in AVCHD and MP4 at the same time!-F1.8-3.4 aperture size.-Wide Angle G lens:  Sony G lenses are professional grade, and deliver brilliant, accurate color reproduction and sharp, detailed images.  The 26.8mm focal length offers broader perspective for enhanced wide angle shooting.-Balanced Optical SteadyShot image stabilization:  Moves the entire optical block at once, instead of moving a single "shift lens"-5.1ch surround sound mic: Records audio in Dolby Digital 5.1 channel.  Also features Auto Wind Noise Reduction.-Color electronic view finder (EVF):  EVF 0.27" with 201K  colors-3" LCD display:  The 3" 16:9 Xtra Fine LCD screen (921K) displays sharp, bring, and vivid images.  Bright enough to shoot daytime outdoors (for me).-Manual controls for Iris, Gain, and Shutter Speed-7 picture effects for video and still photos(edited 2014-04-24 for grammar and corrections)

Pros:-Soft leather cover-Soft lining-Hook-and-Loop closure-Thumb attachement-Fits my wrapped handCons:-Don't care much for the designVery nice entry glove.  Higher quality boxing gloves for its pricepoint.  Highly recommended.

These gloves were starting to grow on me.  Nice feel, really good grip.  I was using them daily for softball, and until the seams started to come apart (first the left glove, then the right glove the next day), they were slowly becoming my new favorite set.  I ended up getting the Cutters Power Control gloves and like them even more; has lasted more than a month now and still going.

Received the package.  Unboxed the mic, receiver, and wires.  Installed two AA batteries into the mic.  Plugged in the receiver to electrical outlet and sound system (ex. karaoke box).  Turn on, and you're ready to go.  Going wireless is that easy.  Maybe because I am only using one mic?!  Once I get add-on mics, I'll update my review.

Performance:  ExcellentPrice:  Very good (a bit cheaper than most SSDs of comparable size)I didn't try the NTI Echo migration software because I used a time machine backup on a Mac.  I installed the OS onto this drive, and then used the TM backup after.  Easy.I found that this drive is significantly faster than the Kingston SSDNow V Series 128 GB SSD that it replaced. On paper, the read/write speeds (in MBps) are 200/160 for the Kingston, and 554/512 for the Toshiba.  I don't get these theoretical sequential speeds, but I do get the double rate (ie. Toshiba moved data nearly twice as fast).  For example, a file that took 46 seconds to write onto the Kingston took 25 seconds on the Toshiba.Highly recommended.

I like the black and green color.  I'm not into green, but this color combo stands out.  The 5S took a bit of effort to get in, but that just means the case will stay on.The silicone core acts like a shock absorber, while the polycarbonate hard shell adds some extra protection from bumps and bruises.  When used with a screen protector like the Tech Armor Premium HD Clear Screen Protector, you'll protect your iPhone 5S from significant injuries (except from drops from a few feet high onto a hard surface maybe).Don't expect it to perform like the Lifeproof iPhone 5S Case and you will be quite pleased with this basic case.  As such, it is a "very good" middle-of-the-road case, but for the price it bumps it up to "excellent."For under 10 dollars, this case is recommended.

This fits my iPad2 well.  As a privacy filter, this works quite well in landscape mode.  There is approximately a 60-degree field of view (30 degrees on either side of looking straight down the screen), beyond which the screen looks dark.This privacy filter does not work when the iPad2 is held vertically (ie. home button is at the bottom), which is another screen.  But because we pretty much use the iPad2 in landscape mode (watching movies, surfing the web, playing games, etc) this filter works best.Recommended.

In my opinion, Pinnacle Studio 17 (basic) is an average software that can perform basic video editing functions.This version is the most basic version of the Pinnacle Studio lineup. This "basic" version is suitable if your video editing uses and requirements are relatively simple, and if you have no plans to tackle more complex projects in the future. For example, you only have up to 6 tracks/layers to work with (three video and three audio).  Also, you can't author BluRay discs with this basic version.This software makes it relatively easier for users to create, export, or share their video files.  You can share your finished video project to Facebook, YouTube, and Vimeo.  You can export the videos in compatible formats (such as Flash, DivX, AVCHD, MPEG-4) for use on an iPad, Apple TV, Microsoft Xbox, and more.The new version was designed to run on 64-bit OS, such as Win7 and Win8.Some of the key features that I like:-  10x faster video rendering (from previous version)-  Access video and photos from HD camcorders and digital devices-  Built-in media library-  Storyboard quick first drafts allows you to create movies automatically-  Edit with frame accuracy on a 6-track timeline in HD (3 video, 3 audio)-  Over 1500 2D/3D effects--even green-screen superimposition-  Layer animations and titles easily with included Montage templates-  Use the trim editor to set source clip in/out points, then send to the timeline to include in your project-  Create custom-fit soundtracks with Scorefitter-  Easily archive and restore your work with Project Packages-  Zip through projects via 64-bit, NVIDIA(tm) CUDA(tm), and Intel(tm) Quick Sync Video optimizationWhat I don't care much for:-  Store projects and clips in the cloud to access anywhere, anytime--includes 50 GB of cloud access free from Box.  I need a lot more than 50GB of storage (my current library is well above 10 TB...yes, 10 terabytes).-  Import clips and movie projects from Pinnacle Studio for iPad.  I don't use Pinnacle Studio for iPad, and I don't plan on using it.-  Share HD videos on Facebook, YouTube, and Vimeo with a few clicks Create DVDs and export to your favorite digital devices and formats.  I upload videos myself, and I do not need this "automated" for me.I found that Studio 17 is still a bit buggy, especially when using MP4 videos (from GoPro cameras).If you want live screen capture and absolutely need to use Pinnacle Studio 17, then you need to upgrade to either the Plus or Ultimate versions.  If you want 4K Ultra HD support or you are into BluRay authoring, then you need the Ultimate version.If you are still running Windows XP (or earlier), then you are SOL because Studio 17 will only run on 64-bit OS (Win7 or Win8).IMO, Studio 17 is not a significant upgrade from 16.  However, the jump from 15 to 17 is huge, and if you are using 15 or older, then using Studio 17 can be much like using a new or different editing program.The similar program for cyberlink would be PowerDirector 12 Deluxe, which IMO is cheaper (50 dollars) yet more capable for various things, such as 100 track timeline (-vs- 6 tracks for Studio 17 Basic), more support for video input formats (MOV, WMV), and can run on Windows XP.Would I recommend it?  If you have used Studio 16, then yes.  Otherwise, I don't know if it is on the top 3 of my list.  I would recommend Adobe Premiere Elements 12, Cyberlink PowerDirector 12 Ultra or Cyberlink PowerDirector 12 Ultimate.Average at best.  Solid 3-star rating.

What I like:-According to the company, these are made with Polypro, which is "PVC Free and recyclable"-clear view covers allow you to put a cover paper (and also along the spine)-two inside pocketsWhat I didn't like:-only one binder was shipped; I was expecting a 4 pack-not as "Heavy Duty" as I expected;-my binder looked dusty and used; had a few marks that looked like it had already been used-cover feels fine, but the hinges look and feel weak-raised ring set has a 1/8" gap; makes the binder rings not look sturdy if filled with paper-I was only able to get 170 pages into the rings (not the 200 as advertised); I have other 1 inch binders that can hold 200 pages-front cover was bent in the middle, raising the two corners up when closedObviously, there are lots of QC issues with these binders.  It may be time for Wilson Jones Co. to evaluate their control/quality assurance plan and create a corrective action plan.  Overall, I've seen better regular/standard 1" binders that I would rather purchase, such as the Avery Economy Binder.  For heavy duty use I can recommend the Avery Heavy-Duty binder or the Avery Nonstick Heavy-Duty.  I'm not partial to Avery, but I have yet to be disappointed with Avery binders.2-star rating... and I'm being generous.

Firstly, this case can only accomodate the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 inch models in either color.  Neither the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (10.1 inch) nor the Samsung Galaxy Note (10.1 inch) in any color will fit this case.This bluetooth keyboard pairs and works very well the Tab 3, as well as the Tab 2, Galaxy Note, various iPads, and various iPhones.  Pairing is easy.  The keyboard is really thin yet responsive.For my use, I charge it over the weekend (I used the included micro-USB cable).  During the first week, it was able to go from Monday through Thursday on a single charge.  Battery life slowly increased to about two weeks in between charging.  I use it in daily meetings (which is about half my day) for taking notes and moderate email.  I've used it with various devices.What I like:-micro-USB charging port- I was able to use various micro-USB chargers for this keyboard, as long as it can provide at least 2.1 amps.  I've had a few micro-USB chargers that did not work (ie. those to charge bluetooth headsets).-light padding does not add significant bulk to case-easy pairing with devices-Supposed 3 month battery life (at about 2h daily use)-Decent protective case that protects against scratches and minor bumpingWhat I don't like:-space key is sometimes not responsive; I probably get about 3-4 of this error in 10 minutes of typing.  Not too bad, but definitely not perfect.-keyboard is not detacheable-single viewing angle-keyboard is slightly slimmer then my preference (though I can make it work)-battery life is closer to two weeks when used 4-5 hours a day; I should have gotten at least a month out of the battery life.-light and plasticky feel (a highly subjective opinion that may be a plus for others)The tablet can be set at a viewing angle, held in place by magnetic tabs that keep the "feet" of the tablet from slipping.  Unfortunately, this setup limits to only this angle.  This setup does not work well when sitting on my lap, but works very well sitting on a flat top (table, desk, floor, etc).Overall, a very good bluetooth keyboard for the Tab 3 and also for other devices that require a keyboard.  If you have a Tab 3 (10.1 inch), this is a very useful accessory.  If you have a Tab 2 (10.1 inch) or a Note (10.1 inch), this case will not accomodate your tablet (even though the keyboard will work, the tablet will not fit in the case).Recommended.Note:  I took almost two months to get to this review because I wanted to see if the battery life actually lasted 3 months in between charges.  The most I got was two weeks (twice) with only double the usage (I used it for 4h a day), and I should have gotten about a month to a month and a half.Disclaimer: As noted above, I received this product through the Vine program in exchange for an objective and impartial review. I do not receive monetary compensation from Amazon or its affiliates. I spent my own free and valuable time testing and trying out this product and providing this objective review.

My Sony DSC H50 fits in this case well.  However, it will not fit if I mount lens peripherals (ex. lens hood).  This also accomodates the Sony Cybershot H200, or a Canon G15.A shoulder strap comes with this case.  There are two side pockets.  One side pocket has my two spare batteries, the other pocket has a couple of SDHC cards and a lens cloth.  Unfortunately, the battery charger for my DSC H50 does not fit in either pocket, so I have to rely on my spare batteries and hope that I do not have to charge them when I am out and about.Padding seems decent, and will protect your camera from mild to moderate bumping.  I keep my camera in this case while and then stuff it in my backpack when I go out.  This case may be enough to protect from a low fall (a foot or less).  I am not comfortable with this case protecting from a drop from a table top (three feet) or higher.This case is good for carrying your camera on an outing, but I would go for a case with more protection if you are hiking, climbing, or out with lots of kids.

This is a review of the Western Digital 2 TB SATA III 7200 RPM 64 MB Cache Bulk/OEM Desktop Hard Drive, Black, WD2003FZEX.This is part of the "Black" desktop series.  WD Black drives feature a dual core processor that offers twice the processing power to maximize drive performance.  According to the manufacturer specs, this 7200 rpm drive has a 64MB cache, advanced format 4K sectors, 6GB/s interface.  WD Black drives come with a 5-year limited warranty (vs the Blue drives, which come with only two years).  In brief, this is a very good/excellent hard disk drive.From what I've seen with this drive, I would not hesitate to use it as a performance or data drive.  It is fast enough to run the OS, and large enough to store tons of data files.  Don't expect break-neck speeds, and certainly don't compare it with solid-state drive (SSD) performance, and you will be quite pleased with this drive.Overall, highly recommended.(Warning:  Geek alert!!!)I tested an OEM version of this drive, and not a retail package (boxed with cables, screws, etc.) on my workstation PC.  First thing I did was format it to NTFS using PartedMagic (multiple partitions).Using CDM 3.0.1 and HD Tach as benchmarking tools, I got the following specs:Average Read - 107 MB/sSequential Read - 133 MB/sAverage Write - 115 MB/sSequential Write - 117 MB/sI'm not sure why I was getting relatively "low" benchmark values.  Clearly, these benchmark numbers are impressive.  The benchmark numbers for this drive are less impressive the Seagate Barracuda 2TB model Seagate Barracuda 2 TB SATA III, (which posted numbers at 249, 258, 126, and 136 MB/s, respectively) even though both utilize the fast 6GBps interface (SATA3) and the larger cache (64MB).Interestingly, performance on the outer 25 GB partition was the same as the inner 900 GB partition.  For example, sequential Read/Write on the outer partition was 132/122 while the inner partition was 134/118 (in MB/s).Results from real-world tests are pending.One other thing is that this drive can be noisy when used on a docking station, but not too noticeable when placed inside a computer.  My Hitachi 1TB 7200 and my WD Raptor are louder (though this is obvious).  On my PC, the boot drive (Raptor) is noisier because it is a 10K rpm drive.After seeing the performance of this drive, I would consider using this drive either for a boot drive or for backups.  Only time will tell how reliable they are.My current setup is with Win7 on a SanDisk Extreme SSD 120 GB SDSSDX-120G-G25 and data files (photos and videos) on this WD2003FZEX.Disclaimer:  I received this product through the Vine program in exchange for an objective review.  I do not receive monetary compensation from Amazon or its affiliates. I spent my own free and valuable time testing and trying out this product and providing this objective review.

... or any other bluetooth-enabled device.  Only the iPad Air can fit in the case, but the bluetooth keyboard can pair with any device.  I use it with iPhones (4S and 5S), various iPads (2, 4r, mini) and other tablets (Tab 3).What I like:-micro-USB charging port- I was able to use various micro-USB chargers for this keyboard-light padding does not add significant bulk to case-easy pairing with devices-chicklet style keys are compact yet manageable.  A lot nicer to work with than Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard for iPad mini.-keyboard is detachableWhat I don't like:-though not bulky, this case/keyboard is heavier than the iPad Air alone; may be a deal breaker for some-space key is sometimes not responsive; I probably get about 2-3 of this error in 10 minutes of typing.  Not too bad, but definitely not perfect.Overall, a very good/excellent keyboard and case for the iPad Air.  Highly recommended.

Billionaire Alberto Graziani rose all the way to the top after living a measly life during his younger years. Now every woman wanted him. But he's no fool, he knew that they want him for his money and fame. One night while driving home, he accidentally bumped a woman on the street and her memory was lost. Day by day, Alberto slowly fell in love with her. He wished she won't remember anything else again so she could be his for the taking. Until, he discovered her dirty little secret.The story was quite predictable, a little too mushy for my taste, but the concept was fast-paced and plot was promising. Would love to read what happens next when the billionaire finally learns the truth about the woman he graciously helped.

Sicily Moretti had hurt Drake DeMarco's feelings when she lashed out at him after he almost killed a boy in her bakery. The same boy who burned down her competition's building and had declared his love for her. Seeing red, Drake did what he deemed was right but Sicily only saw the monster he used to be.This is the last serial in the Judged series and I loved how it ended. Sicily finally learned more about Drake and she was forthcoming about her final decision accepting him despite his flaws.Seriously, I wasn't really into Sicily on the first two books in this series, I thought she was too judgmental and uncomfortable with her own skin and exuded negativity. But the more I got to know more in the last book, the more I liked her. There's really something about Drake that made her realize her mistakes and changed her for the better.Once again, Ali Parker had written a wonderful serial that is not only intoxicatingly hot but also downright engaging and endearing. I wasn't really into Mafia-related stories before, but somehow, somewhere, some thing in me had changed my heart.  Thumbs up to Ali for another job well done!I received this book from Hurricane Readers in exchange for an honest review.

What would you do when you realized someone knows about you, what you do, where you live, and how much money is in your bank account? This might shock the hell out of you but Rachel knows what to do.Rachel witnessed the kidnapping of a young boy near her place but the police officers weren't doing their jobs due to conspiracy. It's up to Rachel and her computer skills to help the concerned families and put the abductors in their place. Too bad, the tables turned and now she received an email from someone who knew the boy's whereabouts and who knew a whole lot about her.Threats had been issued, guns had been fired, intels had been hacked, and death had been imminent the moment Rachel meddled with the abduction. With the help of new found friends and a hacker love interest, they uncovered a mystery deeper than they could handle. Expect a lot of twists and turns and major surprises, this thing could break your defenses and question the people around you.I enjoyed every minute of reading this book. It's got a lot of action, mind-boggling situations, heart-stopping scenes and a hint of romance that will leave you gushing. Lee Ness was able to come up with a high-stakes crime novel that is engaging, provocative and sure to delight its readers!

A short story about a man who doesn't believe in love but willing to get married for the sake of his family. And the woman who wants to be loved more than anything else. The romance factor is there, but I felt that the story was a bit lacking and rushed. There were a lot of narrations about family histories and background stories, but I didn't feel the connection with the characters. If this was made into a full-length novel, the feeling of romanticism and satisfaction would have been achieved. I didn't get to enjoy it enough to want more.

Oh gosh, darn it. This series just ripped my heart out. I felt a lot of emotions reading Sicily and Drake's roller-coaster relationship. One moment I was sighing because of Sicily's lack of self-esteem, the next moment I'm swooning over Drake's cheesy lines. Then I go gaga on their date and casual talk and the next minute, I got hot and bothered with their steamy scenes. And then whoops, here comes danger and the cops and obsessed employees.. Yay!Ali Parker did it again.. and again... This girl really rocks! She always knows the buttons to push which make readers go wild with anticipation. Part 2 of Judged sure made my heart jumped! I can't wait to read part 3!I received this book from Hurricane Readers in exchange for an honest review.

Everyone's aware of Superman's origin, right? Well, the premise of Oleah Chronicles is somewhat similar to Kal El's. Angel, the daughter princess of the Tribal Queen of Oleah, was sent to Earth to protect her from the evil fallen angel Sindrell. Coral, the cherub from Urofika, was the one who opened the portal to planet Earth and would stay close until Angel fulfiled her destiny. (So far, that's where the similarity ends).Angel didn't know anything else about her true identity, so she grew up to be as human as possible. She had a bestfriend named Julie who meant the world to her. She was living a normal life, until she felt chills ran down to her bones the moment she met the hot guy but cold-blooded transfer student, Zander. Suddenly, she could feel him whenever he was near. Suddenly, she had this feelings she couldn't describe. Suddenly, she heard voices in the middle of the night and caught her parents talking to the bright full moon. Suddenly she became aware of the shadows that prowled in the dark.It was only a matter of time before Angel finally learned the truth about her. About her claws. About the chills. About her gold and hazel eyes. About her dreams at night. Zander was a big part of the revelation, but could she trust him after she learned about his cruelty and allegiance to Sindrell? After he admitted that he was originally sent to kill her?I just had a grand time reading the Truth and it was awesome!Oleah Chronicles is a whole new frontier for me. While I have read a lot of books featuring shapeshifters (wolves/werewolves, bears and cougars) this is the first time I read about mountain lions shifting and coming from another galaxy. And vampires from another planet. Quite intriguing, huh?I liked how the story unfolded right before my eyes. The world building was consistent and imaginative. I thought I would get bored to death because of the wordy descriptions and history of the Kindren and Oleah and fallen angels, but surprisingly, I was hooked and drawn to their world. I thought I had this out-of-my-body experience and had traveled beyond galaxies just to be able to have a feel to be an Oleah.Michelle Johnson had created a unique world that felt like home and I'm loving it. This is her debut novel and I must say, she rocks her first time! Now I have this longing as I await for the release of the next book in the series!

Who said Love makes the world go around? Not in Elizabeth Madrid’s world, no, this isn’t true. Absolutely not. Because in this world, Elizabeth does not love. She uses. She lies. She steals.  And she sure makes everyone believe in her and has everyone wrapped around her finger. Even notorious celebrity Chrysalis Magnolia feeds on her hand and takes the bait. She’s that good!But are these people even aware of her? Apparently, Saucy Socials blogs and rants about her but she’s got no idea about her. Of course, no one really knows Elizabeth Madrid. Simply because she doesn’t exist.A few months ago, I’ve read book 2 (Properly Scandalous) from this series and admittedly, I wasn’t entirely connected with the main characters. Maybe because I wasn’t able to read this first book first. But now, I fully understand “Elizabeth’s” hot and cold personality, her power of persuasion,  and the power of her Midas touch. And this deceitful girl is a little too much!Mina V. Esguerra has come up with a believable and thought-provoking story of trust, lies, love and deceit, a story that had me all twisted and cautious of the people around me. The author, as always, breathed life to her characters that had let me peeked into their unscrupulous world. Now I wonder if the people I encounter really gave me their real names and weren’t ex-cons? Ugh, just thinking about it makes my head ache. But overall, this had been a very intriguing book!

Chris Slater is a catch, the the type of guy every girl would want to have. And for this main reason, Devon decides to stay away from him. To move to some place where he is out of reach. But the more she distances herself from him, the more he is drawn to her, the more she wants to go back to his arms. Unfortunately, Christ doesn't want her. He dislikes her. He can't stay in one place with her. He hates her... Or so she thought.Devon is right to fall for him, for all the wrong reasons. Devon's reputation isn't squeaky clean and she knows that. Chris also knows that. But beneath this tarnished exterior is a woman dying to be loved, to be accepted, to be cherished. Her past with Andrew seems to have broken her, but until she can fully accept the reality of their breakup and move on, she won't be getting into the good graces of Chris.Again, those roller-coaster of emotions I felt when I read Christine Natz first book, Seven Years, are all coming back to me now that I've read The Year After.  I swear, I got crazy over Chris Slater, his oh-so-good personality and oh-so-bad in bed character. This guy's machismo rules and he doesn't even had to shed clothes just to prove it.And if there's one thing that I really loved about the man, it's his way to a woman's heart. Pancakes! Have I ever told you that pancakes are my favorite comfort food? (Next to pizza, of course!) If Chris Slater were food, he'd be my pancake and I'm gonna devour him in two minutes top. Yum!I really love this book, not because the author is a friend, but because I have always admired how she was able to encapsulate intensity, drama, family, passion, pain and love in less than 200 pages. These pages have everything you could possibly want in a New Adult book. Christine Natz's writing is fluid and immersive and you can't help but be inclined to read the next chapter and on to the next and the next until you finished it. I think this is a great coming-of-age story with the truest and realest characters I've ever read. Kudos to another great book!

Silver March is a sought-after billionaire playboy who finally found his match. Lace Wyndham. A tomboyish basketball coach who loved the sports and the shoes that go with it. Nike basketball shoes. When she met Silver, she never knew she'd be soon getting her first kiss. Soon, it wasn't about kisses anymore.My first Marian Tee book and it surprised me. Didn't realize this was quite a titillating read! There were a lot of heavy, gritty, erotic scenes, one would want to cover their eyes while reading the story. Cute storyline, though. The romance between the two main characters was palpable and exciting. Even the basketball players that surround them were likable. Hoping to read more about Lace and Silver on the next book!

Casey Bishop needed to get away from her past, and the first step to forget about it was to change her name. She became Sally Andrews and moved to a new location, away from the man who gave her everything but also ruined her life. From Chicago to Oklahoma, she struggled and strove to live a better normal life, but there's nothing normal when you kept looking and watching your back and locking your doors with multiple deadlocks. Then she met Sheriff Evan Cole, strong, reliable, romantic, fearless. Just the man she needed. But what would happen when Evan discovered her real identity and learned about her troublesome past?This had been a good story, there is a plot and promise. I just thought the book was too wordy and discursive, the pacing was a little bit rush at first. This is an erotically charged series, so expect a lot of hot and heavy scenes that might be oh so over-the-top, I was actually blushing towards the end of the story. Overall, a quick intriguing read that will make you want to read the next book immediately.

I expected something more. Trying to make sense of the story but I was immediately put off by the main character (Hailey) who agreed for her body to be used for three nights, by Lock, the leader of the band Half-Life. She let him used her just so she can roam around the groupie headquarters to find out who knocked off her sister. And take note, both sisters were working in a Sunday school group or something. (Oh, and the sex scenes were over the top, I wasn't really feeling it). The writing was good though.

Harper Duquaine knew she was always doing her best at work, and it was evident that her boss was impressed with her. But he also realized that Harper needed to make friends and bond with her officemates. So he asked her to improve her social skills so they wouldn't call her Harper the Harper.JJ, Gio and Wade had a fantasy football game coming up and they needed another player to complete the gang. Enter Harper and everyone was surprised when she volunteered to join the game. Who would have thought that a lady like her knew anything about football?Well, the guys were in for a big surprise. Thanks to her brothers who were big football fans and players, Harper ventured and risked on a high stakes game with her wit, determination her heart in her sleeves. A fantasy game that will change her and her colleagues perception of her.After finishing this book, I thought Queen Harper was an inspiration. I liked how she had transformed herself from a reluctant co-worker into a brave and compassionate game player. Brook, one of Harper's football fantasy competition was also a likable character. He wasn't working with Harper and the boys in the same company, but he was friends with them.Brook had this charismatic appeal that made me love him. A school teacher who thinks of other people's welfare first before himself. A loving uncle to kids who meant the world to him. He was a man worth rooting for.First & Goal featured a lot of football players, techniques and ideas that football aficionados would easily relate to. While I may not have been aware of all these people and sports jargon, I liked the feel of the story, I liked the pacing and world-building and I liked mostly the characters individual personalities. Laura Chapman hit the jackpot with this novel!

I think, after a month of reading Trading Up, it is safe to say that Candice Bushnell's novels worked better when HBO interpreted her writing. Believe me, Sex & The City was my favorite Bushnell book but I loved it better on cable. I was also glued to the TV set whenever Carrie Diaries was on.Somehow, with Trading Up, I had a hard time getting charmed with Janey Wilcox and her posse. I didn't think I had the energy to like her, much more appreciate her as both a heroine & a bitch.Yes, I hated Janey to bits. Until the end. So forgive me if I lost my passion for reading this one after 15-20 days to a month. But I still took a peek from time to time, thinking that I might get interested in the end. But no. I just couldn't.

Geli Voyante seemed to think she’s being left out, especially after her frenemy Tiggy got engaged and everyone she knew were either settled down or were bound to walk down the aisle anytime soon. Where was her place under the sun?In my opinion, Angelica Geli Voyante had it all. She wrote the Hot or Not column and snagged her ideal boyfriend. But insecurities crawled upon her when she saw her arch-enemies picture/status on Facebook. Yes, Tiggy was getting married and she wasn’t pleased with the news. At all.I thought at first that Geli’s thinking was absurd. She basically thought she should be joining the bandwagon, just because everyone else was getting married. And then she got interested with her stepsister’s boyfriend. Ah, not good at all.What’s really interesting in this story was how Geli and Tiggy became mortal enemies when they initially started out as friends. Their respective family dramas pinched my heart in the most fascinating way. They even had me laughing all the way until the end. Yes, believe it or not, Geli Voyante is a troublesome character that can get you hot or not. Elle Field deserves to have a field day for this delightfully written story! My heart smiles for you!

Lexxi Rock learned and watched her boyfriend's infidelity through the screens and she couldn't have been more humiliated. Lexxi, a star in her own right, finally saw the light and fled to her hometown in Tucson for a much needed break. Then all the disguise and pretensions began.Sebastian was a dedicated firefighter, saved lives and served his people. One disastrous fire broke his leg and soon he found himself resting in his apartment, dilly-dallying about his failed relationship with Aileen. How could he not know that the woman he was seeing was already married! He was such a fool!When Lexxi stayed over her father's place, she met Bash, but she didn't tell him who she was. She pretended to be a boy named Alex. What she didn't know was Bash was aware of her all along.Disguise is a new hot and fiery series by the two belles of erotic romance, Bella Wild and Bella Love-Wins. As always, I'm thrilled to read stories from this tandem. Although at first I must admit, Disguise is quite reminiscent of Rocked (their previous six-part novel) because of the similarities with the characters. But in the end, this had been a really different story and the scenes were boiling hot. The Bellas sure can fire up a book, so careful because even your Kindle might just burn up!

Chase and Brooke had been working together side by side but never admitted their feelings for each other. One day when Chase was called by his father for an important meeting, he brought Brooke with him. One wrong turn at a bedroom door found Chase looking at a scantily clad Brooke and all hell broke loose.One night of intimacy brought forth a new twist in their relationship. Brooke tried to keep her distance but all her efforts had gone kaput. She knew she shouldn't be dating her boss, but the boss himself won't let her stay away from him. Maybe the whirl of cameras from paparazzi would wake him up? Oh wait, she overheard him say he wasn't planning on ever settling down so why was her heart cracking bit by bit?The Unforgettable Chase story was a good short story. Although there were still some parts missing (about Brooke and her family, et al) the flow of the story was fluid and characteristically engaging. Expect hot and heavy and steamy scenes between Chase and Brooke and you'll surely lose your focus on whatever you're doing. Can't wait to read the next billionaire brother's story next!

It's been a while since I last read a book involving Native Americans and I don't know why, but I always find myself drawn to this tribe stories.Talisman is a short first story in the Cougar Romance series and I must say, the storyline has got a lot of potential. We are introduced to Diana Grant who was hired as a temporary receptionist in the Yazzie Properties. She thought she was on her way to meeting the man himself, the enigma Catahassa Yazzie, but she was put out by the villainess assistant Amanda Hawkins for reasons unknown. It is on the latter part of the book where we discover what lies beneath Amanda and what future awaits Diana. How about Yazzie? Well, only one thing to find out..And I can't wait to read what happens next. Paula Knight sure got my head wondering and yearning to know more about the feuding black and white cougar and the fierce mountain lion. This is surely going to be a great series!

Talia thinks her life is about to end while serving the Peace Corps, and her heart is about to break into a million pieces knowing she will not be seeing this hottie Aussie lad who recently captured and damaged her heart.Bran.Bran who was across the miles and icebergs. Bran who was at the Arctic defending the marine life and Mother Nature.But love seems to always find its way to one's heart. Talia once again finds herself looking into Bran's eyes, crying, falling, hoping and loving. They need to come up with a definite decision, but they also need to be strong with their choice, because along with this decision, their future is also at stake.The stunning story about love, loss, pain, suffering, acceptance and moving on has come to an end. Talia and Bran deserve everything they have achieved in the end, and I couldn't agree more with Lia Riley. This is indeed a stunning conclusion. Wouldn't have it any other way.

A girl named Hikaru Saito never thought she’d be getting the attention of two well-loved personalities in her school. Imagine being tutored by the sought-after genius slash rich kid slash campus heart-throb Takeshi Hinata and saved from the mean girls by teacher Tetsuya Sakuishi, Hikaru’s life turned upside down from all the stares and bullies she was getting. Suddenly, the girl who only wanted to keep mostly to herself and her manga was surrounded by beauty and love.“How can you think yourself invisible until now? You’re the only one I see..” [Takeshi Hinata]I didn’t think that a love story can be effective without the usual villain manipulation or the heart-pounding scenes wherein the lead characters are fatally harmed thus resulting to revenge and death. No, I felt none of that with this book.Blossom Among Flowers gave me the light giddy vibes usually felt by teenagers falling in love. I liked this story a LOT! Reminded me of one of my favorite JDramas/Manga Hana Yori Dango. Takeshi and Hikaru look cute together, they fit together and I seriously believe they belong together. Their fascination with manga (more on Hikaru’s part) really got me going. (Death Note is a big favorite of mine, too!) The book also gave me a glimpse of something Japanese which I have always wanted to see. Japan is such a beautiful country, my own brother tells me so.But what I really, really, really liked in this book are the conversations, the “hirits” made by Takeshi. So romantic, so many feels, it’s like I’m reading a script from a famous “telenovela” and I can’t help but scream with delight and grin like a puppy.“I’m stubborn.. And I won’t stop until I got what I wanted. An what I wanted was to stay here with you. “ [Takeshi Hinata]Gosh, I’m melting into a puddle after reading that. LOL. Jay E. Tria hit the gold mine with this book. I am truly honored to have read this. Gotta love a writer who could bring her characters to life and make them swoon-worthy!

Old wounds opened up again when Liliana had to be with her old lover Emilio Amante. It didn't help her either that she must live and work with him while she was already committed to her new boyfriend Lucas, who happened to be Emilio's employee. This kind of love triangle may sound cliche, but trust me, their love story was something extra-ordinary.This story already captured my attention with its prologue. Liliana was startled awake after she saw herself running away from someone who wanted to claim and lunged her. As the chapters ran, my impression of Liliana being innocent changed to deceivingly cautious and mature. From that point on, I knew I was in for a good read. And it really was! It was an hour later when I realized I wouldn't be able to sleep unless I finish the story.MD Melai and CS Leigh are highly commendable authors, as they both made me thrilled from beginning to end. The ending provided an opportunity for me to think and guess what happens next. So I am looking forward to reading book 2.

Almost all of the chairs in this world are super comfortable for me, being 5'2", it's really hard to find a comfortable chair that doesn't feel like it was made for a 6' person. A fully adjustable office chair, while a must for me, often doesn't adjust enough. However, this is a well designed, fully adjustable chair worked like a charm!. For the money, it's an excellent happy-medium between the nicer, high-end chairs and the horrible, cheap low-end chairs. As someone who works at home, I tend to stand more than sit, but when I do sit, I want something that is comfortable and encourages good posture. Given the depth of this chair's adjustability, I suspect it would work beautifully for someone on the other end of the height spectrum. And yes, it's really comfortable.Out of the box, the Lively Task Chair assembled super easily and quickly. It's solid, and with nearly everything adjustable, I was able to configure the chair perfectly to my needs. The armrests, the lumbar support, and of course the height are all adjustable. You can also adjust the tilt to that sweet spot so can lean back in the chair comfortably.I'm super happy I found this chair!!

A bit disappointed in that this didn't provide the WiFi connectivity I expected. It was easy enough to install, but failed to deliver the goods. I tried this on a variety of computers and none would adequately connect. When a connection was established, there wasn't any noticeable speed difference and the connection would drop all too easily. I can't say it's the router itself, we have pretty killer router.While there is probably some limitations around this, the clunky nature of the device was really annoying. In testing this with a laptop, my son kept knocking it out of the USB port as he adjusted his sitting position (of course homework isn't meant to be done lying in bed with a laptop on your lap, so thumbs up for forcing him to sit up properly). In between the connectivity issues and the easy ability to knock it free from the port, the usefulness dropped to zero.

This is the first book I've read by Mr. Reich, and I found it to be one of the most profound treatises on our economy I've read to-date. Obviously many on the right will poo-poo much of what Mr. Reich states, but this isn't about left or right, it's about the survival of each and every working individual and our future generations in this country. Regardless of where you stand, the detailed history of how we got here is quite revealing. I have often felt we are entering the New Middle Age as we see the middle class rapidly vanish right in front of us.Over the last two decades there has been this shift to create policies and legislation that enable the richer to become richer while the middle class rapidly disappears and the those living in or near the poverty line grows exponentially. So what is really happening here? How can it be that our economy can roar back from the 2008 recession, and everyone but the wealthy top !% does not share in that growth too? Didn't they also contribute to the success? Therein lies Mr. Reich's fundamental point, which is to make capitalism work for everyone, not just a few, for a strong, vibrant and growing economy.With the "how we got here" info in place, Mr. Reich goes on to show what the probable future will look like and he brings a lot of historical context to support his ideas. He demonstrates over and over again that the answer is not socialism, which many on the left tend to support, but the answer lies in many of the tenets of capitalism. He clearly outlines why doling out more tax breaks to the wealthy and large corporations is not the answer; they are not the job creators they would like for us to believe. He notes that on the contrary there is a decreasing incentive for large corps and the wealthy 1% to continue to invest because as the purchasing power of the middle and lower classes decreases, there will be a decrease in demand for goods in services, which we are seeing already.Nearly all economists agree a healthy economy has three pillars equally contributing to its success; consumer spending, government spending and business investment. According to Mr. Reich, as the middle class disappears and the lower economic class grows, this will create a decline in consumer spending. This not to say that Mr. Reich is pushing for more consumerism (that is a different thing), but if people can only afford the basic necessities, this means demand for simple things such as a trip to the movie theater, will decline and slowly more and more small businesses will close their doors and there goes any hope of new employment. He does not advocate additional government spending as that will rapidly inflate our already ballooning deficit. He also notes that increasing business investment isn't the answer either; what good is it to have a more productive economy if the a growing population can't afford or use it?After thoroughly laying out the vastness of the situation, he doesn't leave you hanging, he provides plenty of details for how we can achieve a more balanced economy that benefits everyone. He outlines this in the last few chapters of the book, most of which will take some serious political action. The foreboding quote at the front of the book really comes home to roost as you near the end of the book and realize how urgent our situation is given that politicians are literally at the beck and call of lobbyists, CEOs and the wealthy 1%...creating meaningful reform that benefits everyone will be seriously challenging.

I have had the privilege of playing around with several Espon printers, from the high-end to the low-end and this one hands-down is my favorite. Epson really packed a LOT into this little workhorse - it does so much, I think I finally have the one, single device that can handle everything. There are some serious smart design elements that put this one over the top for me; killer Epson color quality, killer Wi-Fi capabilities, two paper trays (see more below) and a pretty amazing photo restore feature (see more below). It simply does everything, and it does it just as good as the some of the higher end devices. Here's the low-down:Graphics Quality - Epson is know for its color and graphics quality, and this printer performs as well as Epson printers costing twice as much. Also the black and white is super crisp, like laser printer quality. The colors are brilliant and this little workhorse does a good job of keeping the quality going even as one or more cartridges are getting close to empty.Ease of Install - if you can press a few buttons, and you remember your network password, it literally takes a minute or two to get the printer onto the network and everyone on the network can immediately access it. The control panel is a really nice touchscreen which has good sensitivity so you don't have to keep pressing the same button a bunch of times to get the desired action.Ease of Operation - Super easy to operate. If you want to copy, scan or fax, simply press that button on the touchscreen and if you want to choose any options, you can select those or simply perform the action without having to scroll through a laundry list of menu items. The printer has a relatively small footprint and since you can feed papers into the top for copying, scanning and faxing, it can easily sit on a shelf. Of course if you need to open the lid or use the rear tray, you'll need some clearance for that.Paper Handling - One of the best features packed into this little workhorse is the dedicated photo paper tray. No more switching piles of paper of different sizes and readjusting the inner paper tray. You simply load 8.5 x 11" letter  or - Big Bonus - 8.5 x 14" legal size paper in the bottom tray and photo paper in a dedicated tray on top (holds 4x6 or 5x7 only). When you want to print to one tray or the other, you simply select Cassette 1 or 2 from the Paper Settings and you're on your way.Another great paper handling feature is the ability to select Thick Paper from the touchscreen. I like to print onto card stock and many times find the printer mucks up the project by either failing to get the paper through the feeder or the paper moves too slowly or too fast and the images are distorted. This setting worked liked a charm - thick paper sailed right through without damaging the paper or destroying the image.Awesome Wi-Fi - this printer does a whole lot more than print boring docs from your computer. Got a tablet, phone or Wi-Fi-enabled camera? You can send docs from these devices right to the printer. This is huge - no more emailing stuff, using some cloud-sharing server or other zig-zag method of getting docs from one device to the a printable point. It's worth mentioning Epson's Connect app because it makes it really easy to send docs to the printer and since it bypasses the router, anyone can print without requiring you to give them the password and access to your network. Very nice (and secure)!.Scanning - there are a lot of options for scanning. First you can scan to your computer, memory card or to a cloud-based server (one you registered with on the Epson Connect app). You can also opt to scan the doc to PDF, JPEG or directly to email. I use a document scanner all the time, and I'm seriously thinking I might be able to unload that device since the Epson appears to do nearly everything that device does, including double-sided scanning!Copying - again, amazing array of features here including the usual items such as color, black and white, enlarge, reduce, two-sided (including 2- sided to 2-sided, 2-sided to 1-sided and 1-sided to 2-sided), but it also has a pretty nifty feature: Copy/Restore Photo. Yep, this baby will actually take a faded photo and "restore" the color, and guest what? It works!!! I took faded 40-year old photo and copied it to photo paper using this feature, and wow, it really brought the photo to life!!!Another handy feature, especially if you have kids in school, is the Personal Stationery function. From the touchscreen, you can select to print wide or thin-ruled lined paper, graph paper and even music sheet paper. There is also a Calendar print function with an option for Sunday-Saturday week or month calendar.With coloring books all the rage for both adults and children, this printer will make a black and white coloring book page from a photo. This feature worked really well, even with really detailed photos. There is a setting called Line Detection which when altered will produce a more or less detailed coloring book page. I'm already playing around with this for a holiday card idea!This little printer really reset the bar for home printers!!

My hands were a wreck after about a week of intensive gardening then came the super hot, searing, dry weather so the AHAVA Witch Hazel hand cream was put to a pretty extreme test - and it performed like a champ. This lotion made super quick work of my cracked cuticles and within just three days, my hands feeling less like a pile of dead skin and by around day seven, they were feeling like a woman of leisure's hands. This worked so fast and well on my old-lady hands, I used it on my feet at night too! Running around in sandals all summer long really dries your feet out, and after about a week, this hand cream made my feet feel like I had gotten a killer pedicure!I've used AHAVA products before, they are truly top-shelf quality, and this lotion is no exception. It's not greasy nor watery, and you only need a nickel-sized bit to get your hands, forearms and elbows nicely hydrated. I can't speak to the whole list of ingredients, but it doesn't contain Paragons or Phthalate, and I know those aren't good for you. I'm really partial to L'Occitaine's products, and this is right up there in terms of quality and performance.Lastly, AHAVA sealed the deal with the very faint and pleasant scent. It's just a little hint of floral and definitely not overpowering - there's nothing worse than a great hand cream or lotion product that stinks like a cheap date!

Now Designs has always made really nice dishtowels in both the thicker towel and the thinner linen-like towel. This is the thinner linen-like towel which is best for drying dishes and especially glassware. Despite being a tea towel, it's substantial in heft and a real workhorse in the kitchen.The color in this 100% cotton towel is dyed using vegetable dyes and the cotton is 100% organic.
